Job Description:
The Director of Infrastructure will lead a global team of IT managers and professionals who own the global IT responsibility for the telecom, systems & networking groups within Coherent. He/she will be responsible for developing and executing an IT business strategy. We are seeking a customer-centric, technology forward and respected thought-leader in the evolving world of infrastructure. This candidate will have successfully architected and implemented large scale global enterprise solutions.

Responsibilities;

Lead the Coherent IT global infrastructure team - own the global telecom, systems & networking components of infrastructure.
Managing infrastructure capacity and augmentation.
Ensuring reliable 24/7 operations in partnership with managed services provider by defining IT infrastructure architecture, as well as standards to include disaster recovery, security, storage, servers, monitoring, performance, and back-office systems. Manage and optimize a 24/7 Help Desk operation.
Manage Active Directory, Single sign-on solution, Microsoft Windows operation systems, Office 365, Microsoft Azure Cloud Architecture.
Foster a business-oriented mind-set, driven by continual service improvements in infrastructure organization.
Building and maintaining relationships with IT leaders and business executives to develop a clear understanding of business needs, ensuring cost-effective delivery of IT services to meet those needs, and responding with agility to changing business priorities.
Developing and controlling the annual operating and capital expenditure budget for infrastructure to ensure consistency with overall strategic objectives.
Staying up to date on emerging technologies; providing direction on which new technologies should be assimilated, integrated, and introduced.
Providing strategic guidance and technical assistance to respective infrastructure teams.
Demonstrating excellence in communication skills both internally and externally.
Effectively balancing employee satisfaction, customer satisfaction and financial performance in delivering and supporting our products and services.
Executive level management of external Vendor/Service Providers, to include purchasing strategies, contract negotiations and escalated support needs.
Directing the development of infrastructure sourcing strategy and providing executive oversight for strategic vendor and partner relationship management
Forecasting skill needs to acquire and develop workforce with business knowledge, technical skills, and competencies
Serving on IT planning and policymaking committees; driving the development of enterprise technology standards, governance processes, and performance metrics to ensure technology delivers value to the enterprise

Education and Work Experience:

The successful candidate is a strong IT professional who has a services-oriented approach driven to create and communicate your vision and strategy for IT service delivery. The candidate can lead with authority and assertiveness while being collaborative and highly approachable with cross functional teams. Additionally, he/she must be an effective communicator with well-honed influencing skills who can train and educate while measuring metrics and deliverables.

Additional qualifications:

Minimum of 15 years of relevant professional IT infrastructure experience
Minimum 10 years demonstrated experience in an IT leadership role managing senior managers and professionals
Direct and relevant experience in large-scale global infrastructure management
Strong knowledge of IT outsourcing services
Minimum 5 years with Cisco, Windows and Solaris infrastructure
Superior technical strategy and innovation skills
Contract management with vendor negotiation skills
Strong analytical skills (experience building, evaluating, and clearly presenting complex business models is critical)
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to influence others without formal authority
Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing at all organizational levels
Must be able to manage a complex and diverse workload

Who we are and what we do

SurveyMonkey (Nasdaq: SVMK), is a leader in agile software solutions for customer experience, market research, and survey feedback. Our mission is to power the curious and enable organizations, including 98% of the Fortune 500, to transform feedback into action. Our brand is beloved and well known throughout the world—over 6 billion people have taken a SurveyMonkey survey! Today, more than 17 million active users rely on our platform to measure and understand feedback from employees, customers, website and app users, and the market. And our enterprise-grade products and solutions enable 335,000+ organizations globally to solve daily challenges—from delivering better customer experiences to increasing employee retention.

What we're looking for


We are seeking a highly-experienced Vice President, IT Infrastructure & Operations to join our global technology team. Reporting to our CIO, you will power the employee productivity of a fast-growing global workforce and managing the global IT Infrastructure/Operations team. You will work with senior leadership, end-users, and the broad global IT team to help determine the best way possible to meet the technology needs of the company as we scale.

You will
Improve strategic and operational success for end-user services, network operations, systems administration, enterprise collaboration tools, IT cloud infrastructure and endpoint security operations
Promote operational excellence: scalable and reliable infrastructure, excellent customer service, efficient and agile operations measured with industry-leading metrics.
Partner with the security function to ensure compliance standards and processes are met.
Guide the strategy for the global infrastructure organization in collaboration with the broader IT strategy.
Develop relationships across the enterprise to ensure their IT infrastructure/operational expectations are met and priorities are set at the appropriate level.
Lead the planning and execution of essential infrastructure/operational projects within approved budget.
Build and mentor an outstanding team while fostering a culture of delivering high value solutions and exceptional service.
Ability to consistently and collaboratively resolve issues, mitigate roadblocks, and meets all financial and management goals.
Ability to effectively articulate the right message to the right audience from the C-suite to individual team members.
You have
15+ years' experience in information technology, with at least 10+ years of experience managing an IT organization or infrastructure group in a high technology company.
Excellent change management and project management skills.
Experience with Cloud Computing, IaaS, and other forms of service-based computing models.
Experience with M&A due-diligence activity and the integration of acquired businesses.
Successful career progression in complex organizations (multiple data centers, networks, applications).
Experience in contract negotiations, vendor management, and capacity planning in a fast growth environment.
Knowledgeable in compliance and information security.
Current on business applications, trends in IT and experience evaluating/implementing outsources solutions and service providers.
What we offer our employees

SurveyMonkey is a place where the curious come to grow. By embedding inclusion into our processes, policies, and culture for our 1,000+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we're building a workplace where people of every background can thrive. We've won multiple awards and received recognition for our forward-looking policies, including extended parental and bereavement leave, vendor benefits standards, and Take 4 sabbaticals.

SurveyMonkey was recognized by Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE as a top workplace in 2018 and 2019, and the company has also won numerous awards as a leader in global survey software, including being named among CNBC's Disruptor 50 and the Forbes Cloud 100.

Our commitment to an inclusive workplace

SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.

Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts here.

Manager, IT Operations (*FSLA Exempt)
Santa Clara Family Health Plan (SCFHP) is a local, community-based health plan dedicated to improving the health and well-being of the residents of Santa Clara County. SCFHP's mission is to provide high quality, comprehensive healthcare coverage for those who do not have access to, or are not able to purchase, good healthcare at an affordable price.

The Manager, IT Operations is responsible for management and oversight of the day-to-day activities of the IT Operations team. This includes oversight of the processing and monitoring of all incoming and outgoing data, including all healthcare-related data sets: eligibility, encounter, provider, claims, authorizations, pharmacy, and other EDI files and reports. This position will be responsible for maintaining and monitoring the IT Operations production process schedule for batch processing and system integrations. This position is responsible for troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving any identified or reported issues with batch processing, system integrations, EDI transactions, and file transfers with timely communication and escalation of any systemic or unresolvable issues.
Responsibilities for a **Manager, IT Operations*
Oversee the processing of incoming and outgoing data transactions through core systems, often outside of regular business hours, to reduce disruption to core system users. This includes tracking issues with data transactions, reprocessing when applicable, and escalating to other IT teams for additional support when needed.
Responsible for the development and maintenance of IT Operations desktop procedures to ensure they are kept up to date and accurate.
Maintain and oversee the use of the IT Operations task scheduling tool to track daily, weekly, monthly, and annual tasks and processes.
Manage and maintain the company intranet site and provide support to business units for department site content additions and modifications.
Perform general maintenance of operations directory structures and file systems including: SFTP sites, intranet, and file servers.
Contribute and participate in the strategic planning process and share in the development of SCFHP vision, goals, and initiatives.
SUPERVISORY/MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES*
Carries out supervisory/management responsibilities in accordance with SCFHP’s policies, procedures, applicable regulations and laws.
Providing effective leadership to attract and retain top talent to drive business results, including recruiting, interviewing, and hiring.
Effectively assimilating, training and mentoring staff and (when appropriate), cross training existing staff and initiating retraining. This includes coaching to help increase skills, knowledge and (if applicable) improve performance.
Appraising performance, rewarding and disciplining employees, addressing complaints and resolving issues. This includes providing regular and effective feedback to employees and completing timely and objective performance reviews.
Qualifications for a Manager, IT Operations*
Bachelor’s Degree in Healthcare, Information Systems, or related field of study, or equivalent training/experience.
Minimum two years of experience in healthcare and knowledge of healthcare business processes, operations, and regulations.
Minimum two years of experience in task automation and process flows.
Minimum two years of experience in positions requiring analytical and project management skills.
Working knowledge of and the ability to efficiently operate all applicable computer software including a working knowledge of computer applications such as Outlook, Word and Excel.
Experienced with Microsoft Project, Microsoft Team Foundation Server, or similar project management tool.
Strong Microsoft proficiency in use of work-enhancing software tools, including databases, spreadsheets, pivot tables, project management, and work management.
Ability to create process diagrams or flowcharts using Microsoft Visio.
Benefits for the Manager, IT Operations *
Competitive salary
Advancement opportunities
Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

Employee assistance program

healthcare business processes, operations, and regulations.: 2 years (Preferred)
task automation and process flows: 2 years (Preferred)

Who We Are

River City Medical Group (RCMG) is one of the largest Medi-Cal Independent Physician Associations in Northern California, serving approximately 275,000 Medi-Cal patients spanning nine counties: Sacramento, Butte, Colusa, Glenn, Nevada, Placer, Sutter, Tehama, and Yuba. RCMG provides its patients with quality care through its vast and diverse contracted network of primary care physicians, specialists and ancillary providers.

RCMG is an active member of the community helping to support it in our professional roles as an IPA. With the robust leadership of local practicing physicians, we are committed to ensuring our members and physicians are supported to provide the right care at the right time.

A dedicated team implementing creative solutions to assist providers with focusing more on patient care and less on administration
Community relations developing public and private partnerships that improve access to care and link members to services
Doctors providing care to almost 1 in 2 Medi-Cal Beneficiaries in the Sacramento area
Only IPA based in Sacramento County exclusively dedicated to serving the Medi-Cal population

Job Summary:

The Director of Information Technology will manage and direct the company’s information technology (IT) operations and Technology Infrastructure (Helpdesk and Hardware), ensuring the department provides efficient and effective technical support service.

Essential Job Functions:

Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position.

· Leads development and implementation processes for the organizations IT systems and department.

· Develops and implements business continuity protocols to minimize disruption to business operations in the event of emergency situations or data loss. Works with CIO and business leadership to regularly conduct tests of the Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity plan.

· Establishes efficiency and efficacy standards, providing recommendations for improvement of IT infrastructure.

· Analyzes IT infrastructure and systems performance to assess operating costs, productivity levels, upgrade requirements, and other metrics and needs.

· Oversees security of systems, networks, and enterprise information.

· Facilitates IT security audits or investigations.

· Develops and maintains relationships with external IT vendors and service providers.

· Ensures compliance with all software licensing agreements. Manages and safeguards software media and associated licenses. Maintains centralized software use log.

· Coordinates multisite IT systems via enterprise resource planning (ERP).

· Works with CIO and CEO to produce and update annual IT budgets.

· Works with CIO and Compliance to establish a level of IT security for all IT systems and information (including personal health information) commensurate with the sensitivity of the information and with the risk and magnitude of loss or harm
resulting from improper operation or losses resulting from fraud, waste, abuse, disasters, criminal activities or mismanagement.

· Works with the Compliance Officer to make certain technical solutions meet HIPAA security and privacy standards.

· Performs related duties consistent with the scope and intent of the position.

· Regular attendance.

· Travel as required.

Other Functions:

· Enforces Company policies and safety procedures.

· Collaborates with all departments and levels within the organization to understand current business needs and anticipate strategic direction and growth.

· Regularly updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining professional networks, and participating in professional organizations.

Competencies

· 7-10 Years of experience managing an IT department, both systems and technology, required.

· 5 + Years developing and implementing successful IT strategies for small to mid-size organizations required.

· 5+ Years direct supervisory experience required.

· Demonstrated experience using EZ Cap and other health plan or IPA core systems required.

· Experience developing SQL queries and developing advanced reporting required.

· Experience using cloud based platforms such as Amazon AWS, MS Azure Experience, or other similar platform required.

· Experience procuring IT hardware required.

· Proficiency in latest technology for IT systems and management required.

· Proficiency in Microsoft software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) required.

· Must have the ability to quickly learn, use and deploy new software tools.

· Excellent interpersonal skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

· Excellent communication skills, including both oral and written.

· Excellent active listening and critical thinking skills.

· Ability to solve advanced-level problems and think strategically.

· Ability to multi-task, exercise excellent time management, and meet multiple deadlines.

· Ability to provide and receive constructive job and/or industry related feedback.

· Ability to exercise sound discretion and strict maintenance of confidentiality of all confidential and sensitive communications and information.

· Ability to consistently deliver excellent customer service.

· Excellent attention to detail and ability to document information accurately.

· Ability to effectively and positively work in a dynamic, fast-paced team environment and achieve objectives.

· Demonstrate commitment to the organization’s mission.

· Self-motivated with strong organizational, multi-tasking, planning, and follow up skills.

· Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment.

· Ability to present self in a professional manner and represent the Company image.

Supervisor Responsibility

· This position supervises up to twelve (12) Direct/Indirect IT positions.

Education and Licensure

· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science required; Master’s degree or MBA preferred.

Travel

· The incumbent may travel up to 5% of the time.

Job Description:

Summary: The Director of Information Technology is responsible for the overall planning, organizing, and execution of all IT functions. The IT Director ensures that the IT department is able to meet PHC’s current information technology needs and, in partnership with the Chief Information Officer, plan for the organization’s continued improvement in the use and application of information technology.

Areas of Responsibility:


Develop, Implement and Manage ITServices:
Implement and evaluate ITstandards across all sites and services to assure efficiency and effectiveness of service delivery methods, including key quality metrics
Work proactively with management and leadership to identify and respond to shifts in service demand and supply
Ensure business goals, revenue and productivity objectives are met in a respectful, forward thinking and motivational style
Utilize management information tools to analyze financial, business and operations reports to identify and address trends and performance issues
Oversee the financialaspects of the department and ensures that operationsare aligned with the budget. Approves allbusiness requirements priorto the technical solution
Create and maintain strategic operationalinitiatives that promote yearoveryeargrowth
Develop strategicand operationalplans, manages execution, and measures results
Assist the organization in achieving optimal utilization of IT Systems, including the Electronic Medical Records and Phone System
Ensure optimal purchasing, inventory, and equipment management systems and processes are in place to support operations
Represent the organization’s IToperations on various internal and externalcommittees.
Project Management
Create and monitor implementation plans to ensure the effective execution of the IT
department’s initiatives to achieve both operational excellence and positive business results
Application and hardware management
Participate on all hardware and software evaluations and maintains vendorcontracts
Ensure the consistency and maintainability of existing applications by creating, maintaining, and enforcing standards/procedures for implementing technicalsolutions
Ensure satisfactory employee experience
Analyze complex business needs presented by the usercommunity and/orclients and recommends and/orimplements technicalsolutions
Perform liaison duties between users, operations, and programming personnel in the areas of systems design, modifications ortrouble shooting
Lead the IT team in delivering exceptionalcustomerexperiences in all practices
Leadership / Management:
Manage IT department with the integrity, honesty and knowledge needed to promote the culture, values and mission of Petaluma Health Center
Manage IT staff, recruiting, training, and ensuring high employee engagement, and accurate timekeeping and reporting,
Identify problems, concerns, and opportunities for staff improvement and helps supervisors develop theirskills
Provide training and development to ensure that all staff members demonstrate knowledge of PHC’s business model, job competency expectations and operating procedures and protocols
Perform staff competency evaluations
Ensure all staff have personalprofessionaldevelopment plans, and assists staff in developing their personalprofessionalgoals.
Quality Improvement/ Risk Management and Compliance:
Ensure robust Quality Improvement and Performance Improvement departmentalprogram, establishing goals and PDSA cycles within the IT department to continually improve services
Partnerwith stakeholders to analyze and make data-driven recommendations forprocess improvement
Implement systems that minimize and mitigate risks to the organization.
Ensures adherence to all legal, regulatory and accreditation requirements
Designs and performs appropriate and timely department audits
Security & Emergency Management:
Manage system technology to support information security and privacy requirements
Maintain the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data as the security and privacy integrate
Develop and maintain security and privacy policies and procedures including management of security risk assessments, the program budget, security complaints and incident activity, and enforcement
Provide workforce security and privacy training and awareness
Provide externalcompliance assurances and security survey activity
Develop business continuity planning
Develop, implement, and maintain the organization's protected health information privacy and security policies, procedures and guidelines in compliance with federaland state laws and accreditation standards, and in coordination with organization leadership, the privacy and HIPAA compliance oversight structure, and legal counsel
Cooperate with the Office for Civil Rights and otherinvestigative agencies in coordination with organization officers in responding to external investigations
Supervisory Responsibilities:
All IT support staff, including supervisors and technicians.
Required Experience:

Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree with a technical major, such as engineering orcomputerscience or equivalent; or fourto ten years related experience and/ortraining; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Advanced degree with atechnical major, such as engineering orcomputerscience, preferred
Minimum 4 years of supervisory experience
Systems Administration/System Engineerwork experience, certification in Microsoft (Active Directory, Exchange, MS SQLServer), VMWare, Cisco, and AWS, as well as otherhealthcare specific systems preferred
Demonstrated experience with standard software applications, including MS Office, Windows
Cisco Networking, certification in these areas a plus
Desired Skills:

Sensitivity to the needs and situations of a multi-cultural employee population
Ability to forecast and analyze business trends in order to maximize performance and profitability
Knowledge of current trends in electronicmedical records (EMR)
Database management skills with ability to produce reports, manipulate, analyze and interpret data
Ability to work in a fast-pace environment, strong communication and writing skills and dedication to customerservice
Experience in implementing effective and innovative software development methodologies
Ability to communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technicalaudiences
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and motivate professionalstaff
Demonstrated aptitude for learning new technologies
Training ability/experience aplus
Licenses and Certifications:

Technology certificates or a core component of education or experience preferred
Language Skills: Bilingual in English and Spanish, both written and verbal preferred

Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply, divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals

Reasoning Ability: Ability to recognize problems, collect data and establish facts

Computer Skills: High level of computer literacy and proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel and Outlook), electronic medical records and web applications

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of thosethat must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essentialfunctions.
Movement within health centercomplex environment repeatedly throughout the day
Ability to write by hand, use phone, use computer keyboard and mouse extensively to perform generaloffice functions
Manual wrist and finger dexterity and wrist-finger speed sufficient to perform repetitive actions for extended periods of time
Ability to effectively communicate by hearing continuously and speech in a manner which can be understood by a diverse population
Ability to give and follow verbaland written instructions with attention to detail and accuracy
Must have visual acuity near and far (20 inches to 20 feet), depth perception, field of vision, ability to focus on an object, ability to identify and distinguish colors
Ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time (minimum periods of one (1) hourat a time)
Ability to frequently walk, bend, squat, stoop, kneel, twist, crouch, and climb with the use of a step stool
Ability to grasp, hold and pick up and reach with hands and arms
Ability to frequently lift and or move up to seventy-five(75) pounds
Ability to coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to travel to and from otherhealth centersites and community locations
Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essentialfunctions of this job.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to general office and health center area environment with frequent interruptions by staff, visitors and phones. The work environment is a clean, well-lit, well-ventilated, and temperature controlled environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The hours of duty are Monday through Friday during the business day. The employee must be willing to work varied hours to accommodate meetings and special functions.

Sr. Manager IT Operations

App Annie

LOCATION: San Francisco

App Annie is the industry's most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. App Annie's mission to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. The company created the mobile app data market and is committed to delivering the industry's most complete mobile performance offering. More than 1,100 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business. The company is headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide.

Position Summary:

As a manager, Global IT Operations we are looking for an experienced Information Technology leader with a passion for building out organizations in high-growth mode. You know what it takes to scale a late stage startup to the next level. You thrive in a strategic and hands-on role where you might deploy a new security solution one day, and present an IT plan and vision to our executive team the next.

You will manage a small Global team of IT support engineers covering desktop support, networking and systems operations to support our offices and distributed workforce around the world. You will work cross-functionally with executives from Operations, Legal, Facilities, and People teams to develop and implement the IT vision. You have a proven track record of working in a fast-paced environment. From setting up new hires, providing end user support, to creating IT processes and documentation, to building out new offices across the globe - you've done it all and can't wait to do it again!

You should be comfortable wearing multiple hats and enjoy working with cutting edge technology to solve problems. This position is uniquely suited to highly organized individuals with a wide breadth of IT knowledge and experience and the ability to work with minimal direction. Good communication skills and ability to set and manage expectations are key to be successful in this role.

What you will do:
Represent the organization as the prime technical contact for IT operations and be a champion for world class employee experience
Lead and inspire a global team of 4-6 direct reports
Oversee global operations team, ensuring all network, hardware and software issues are attended to quickly and efficiently for AppAnnie employees globally
Review and Maintain IT/ security procedures and policies
Manage resources both locally and globally and establish follow the sun support model
Drive security audits, analyze outcomes implementing solutions to close security gaps
Define and implement L1/L2/L3 support procedures for critical business applications. Including SLA's and process governance
Research and evaluate new products and services that help keep our IT environment current and relevant
Manage relationships with IT vendors and consultants, evaluating and researching new vendors as needed
Be on call and able to manage critical issues outside normal work hours
Manage IT support for laptop/mobile, software, printers, and LAN/WLAN/ VPN
Administer and support 70+ SaaS platforms via SSO (Onelogin/ Okta experience preferred).
Manage and streamline new-hire onboarding/offboarding and IT orientations in collaboration with HR and other business teams
What will you bring to the team:
Positive attitude and a big appetite to provide/ enhance world class executive/ employee experience
6+ years of relevant experience, including at least 3+ years in a hands-on IT leadership role
BA/BS Degree, advanced degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
Experience in IT strategic planning, global office build outs and deployment of company-wide IT solutions
Great troubleshooting skills and understanding of IT problem-solving techniques and methodologies.
Strong experience in overseeing/ administering the Corporate/ Employee Experience technology stack (e.g. G Suite, JAMF, Slack, One Login, Zoom, Fresh Service, Jira, Box, LDAP user management, Security tools...).
Technical skills in Mac, Windows and Linux, including administration, support and troubleshooting
Strong understanding of networks and network security devices deep understanding of Palo Alto and Cisco networking technologies (e.g. routers, switches, firewalls, network and routing protocols and their related traffic patterns)
Familiarity with Meraki Wi-Fi a plus!
Ability to prioritize and effectively manage competing priorities and set clear expectations around deliverables.
Be a team player and build strong partnerships.
Experience in a fast paced tech startup environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to maintain composure in high-pressure situations.
Occasional travel required
What do we offer?
Lots of responsibility + room for you to experiment and grow with the company.
An international team of super-talented people from different cultural backgrounds (San Francisco, Beijing, Utrecht, London and more).
16 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!
Competitive salary & stock options.
And finally, an office in the heart of the city, so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.
Covid-19

During the Covid-19 Pandemic we've adapted how we support our employees in a number of ways:
Donut Dates - connecting you with someone else in your region once every 2 weeks so you can get to know each other
WFH Equipment Allowance - To ensure you have the best set up in your home office
Productivity Allowance - To keep your home office running
Wellness Sessions - To keep everyone happy and healthy
Virtual Happy Hours and Trivia to keep you connected with your colleagues
Generous PTO that we encourage you to use for your wellbeing to go offline, recharge, and reflect
You will also be taken through a fully digital onboarding process!
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

The Senior IT Project Manager is responsible for the successful delivery of large-scale, complex projects often involving multiple internal and external stakeholders through all phases of the SDLC. The Senior IT Project Manager helps set and follow clear project management standards including project plans, change controls, risk management, and other project management documents on given strategic initiatives. The Senior IT Project Manager assists in developing standards, managing the enterprise IT project priority list with IT Directors, and assists in IT Steering Committee meetings if needed. This position reports to the Director of IT Strategic Initiatives.

Accountable for successful project delivery through active project management oversight.
Lead cross functional teams delivering superior IT projects consisting of people, process, and technology that allows complete interaction with all impacted stakeholders, including internal business users and external providers.
Develop project management plans in accordance with roadmaps which integrate the requirements and activities addressing the management of project scope, schedule, cost, quality, human resources, communications, risk, and procurement.
Define and track project milestones while developing, maintaining, and reporting on an overall integrated delivery plan with IT and Business Units.
Rigorously manage scope to ensure commitments are achieved within agreed upon time, cost, and quality parameters.
Build an environment of trust and open information. Sharing lessons learned, perceptions, and best practices openly with the teams.
Communicate clearly with internal and vendor teams in multiple diverse locations, ensuring that strategic and tactical deliverables are understood.
Regularly conduct postmortems on capability delivery and ensure that the team learns from mistakes as well as victories.
Develop and maintain risk management plan addressing opportunities, best practices, risks, and issues or threats.
Monitor project risks. Assess the impact of new or increased risks and develop mitigation plans.
Work with various teams/disciplines to ensure release readiness and quality deployments.
Facilitate Project Steering Committee meetings and stakeholders meetings.
SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Participate in special projects, assignments, and other tasks as needed.

Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field and at least five (5) years of relevant project management experience required. In lieu of a degree, a minimum of eight (8) years of relevant experience to include a minimum of five (5) years project management experience will be considered. Particular emphasis on waterfall and iterative software development methodologies. Experience managing multiple complex projects with teams of 10 or more. Experience in health plan environment preferred.
Special Skills, Licenses and Certifications
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification, Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certification, or equivalent required. Strong project management skills, including the ability to create project plans, prioritize work, and meet deadlines. Proficiency in MS Office suite of applications (including Visio, MS Project, etc.), SharePoint, Workfront, and other internal applications. Valid California driver’s license and proof of current automobile insurance compliant with PHC policy are required to operate a vehicle and travel for company business.
Performance Based Competencies
Strong planning, organizational, and leadership skills. Understanding of team dynamics and ability to foster a positive team environment. Excellent time management skills. Self-starter and self-motivated. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to speak clearly and persuasively in all situations. Ability to effectively exercise good judgment. Attention to detail.
Work Environment And Physical Demands
Ability to use a computer keyboard. More than 50% of work time is spent in front of a computer monitor. Must be able to lift, carry, or move objects of varying size, weighing up to 10 lbs.
All HealthPlan employees are expected to:
Provide the highest possible level of service to clients;
Promote teamwork and cooperative effort among employees;
Maintain safe practices; and
Abide by the HealthPlan’s policies and procedures, as they may from time to time be updated.

Infosys is seeking Java Consultant This position requires an expert contributing to different phases of the consulting lifecycle. You will be intensely involved in business process consulting; you will define the problem, propose and create the solution. You will also play an important role in the development, configuration and deployment of the overall solution. You will guide teams on project processes, deliverables and contribute to the proposal development, client training and internal capability building and help detail the project scope. About Nevro


Nevro (NYSE: NVRO) is a global medical device company headquartered in Redwood City, California. We are focused on providing innovative products that improve the quality of life of patients suffering from debilitating chronic pain.

We started with a simple mission to help more patients suffering from chronic pain. At each stage of development, our research was subject to the highest levels of scientific rigor, resulting in a new therapy that has impacted the lives of over 55,000 patients around the world.

Nevro has developed and commercialized the Senza spinal cord stimulation (SCS) system, an evidence-based, non-pharmacologic neuromodulation platform for the treatment of chronic pain. HF10 therapy has demonstrated the ability to reduce or eliminate opioids in ≥65% of patients across six peer-reviewed clinical studies. The Senza® System, Senza II™ System, and the Senza® Omnia™ System are the only SCS systems that deliver Nevro's proprietary HF10® therapy.

Job Summary & Responsibilities


As the Vice President of Information Technology at Nevro, you will be an integral part of the leadership team. Reporting to the CFO, you will contribute to driving our growth by leveraging technology across a global enterprise. You will be responsible for developing and executing the IT strategy, including partnering with the company's senior leadership team to define technology requirements and solutions, drive innovation, and ensure success and efficiencies across the organization.

The ideal candidate is a results-oriented leader capable of delivering significant technology initiatives and outstanding IT support in a rapid growth environment. As part of the Nevro leadership team, you will build relationships and foster a positive, constructive culture throughout the organization and within the IT team.

The scope of your work will include the overall planning, organizing, and execution of all IT related functions at all locations including business systems, cloud technology, network topology and infrastructure, IT/data security and telecommunications. This includes directing corporate world-wide IT, capital expenditures, application implementation protocols and IT regular operations to meet all requirements, as well as the support and maintenance of existing and new technical solutions and strategic partnerships. As a large accelerated filer under SEC regulations maintenance of the control environment is a primary function.
Drive the roadmap to streamline, standardize, and strengthen performance, reliability, robustness and scalability across the company.

Provide innovative leadership, motivation, and guidance required for world-class IT to successfully meet strategic objectives and deliverables in support of the business needs.
Develop and lead a high-performing team of IT professionals; foster a culture of collaboration and support through coaching and mentoring
Successfully translate business requirements into team deliverables, individual goals, and objectives
Build the roadmap and provide the strategic vision to align the IT organization around key business initiatives, focusing on an increased demand for data management and cross system integration based on business needs

Company Description

Foster Farms has been a family-owned and operated company for four generations. Since our founding days back in 1939, we have always been committed to providing consumers with the highest-quality, best-tasting poultry products available. The hope is that our commitment to excellence, honesty, quality, service, and our people will shine through in everything we do.

We are always looking for talented individuals to join the Foster Farms team. We offer the experience of a large organization, but operate like a family business. More than half of our job openings are filled by internal promotion, and we encourage employees to gain a variety of experiences across different functional groups.

Job Description

PURPOSE OF POSITION:

To plan, organize, direct, improve and control all activities associated with the assigned Business Systems that support multiple business functions (Assigned Functions – Financial Systems, Procurement, Supply/Demand Planning). Successfully meet IT customer requirements through the effective planning and managing of the business systems that support Assigned Functions. This management encompasses all baseline support/maintenance activities, functional enhancement activities and development and implementation of new business systems and/or technologies. Provide timely, accurate resolution of business system issues resulting in the high availability of systems supporting Assigned Functions.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Manage the activities relative to the Assigned Functions:

Understand the strategic and functional business requirements of Assigned Functional areas. Develop plans to deliver systems and services to meet strategic and business needs. Coordinate the overall planning, execution and development and support activities of Assigned Functions. Evaluate client requests from a long-term perspective, resolving conflicting user demands and implementing solutions which will benefit the entire company. Function as a business consultant for Assigned Functions. Establish commitments with clients and deliver on these commitments. Insure all work is performed in accordance with established IT and Business Systems policies, methodologies and procedures.

Manage the development of new systems and technology applications that support both day to day operations and strategic direction of Assigned Functions, utilizing technology to create a competitive advantage. Insure that systems are implemented on time, are technically efficient, conform to standards and meet client expectations. Insure the Foster Farms systems development methodology is consistently and effectively applied on all projects. Insure that assigned staff is trained and fully able to utilize the methodology on all projects. Insure that all systems are fully tested prior to their release into production. Maintain, enhance and/or develop corporate systems development and documentation standards, providing coaching to IT Managers and staff on their use.

Manage the activities that provide for the day-to-day baseline support of assigned existing systems. Insure production problems are monitored and resolved to achieve high client satisfaction through system reliability/availability. Ensure that problem fixes and system enhancements are consistent with long-term department and application directions and architecture. Balance workload of assigned team between new systems development and maintenance/enhancement.

Human Resources Management:

Manage (plan, direct and measure) the work assignments of assigned staff. Insure detailed task plans and resource requirements are documented for all work and insure all work is completed accurately and timely. Establish appropriate control mechanisms to insure all work is completed correctly and on a timely, yet cost effective basis. Develop career plans and provide appropriate development opportunities for the assigned staff. Serve as a role model, mentor and coach for assigned team. Build teamwork and commitment to IT Department goals and values. Perform all facets of personnel management; initiating personnel actions to hire, promote or terminate assigned staff members. Recommend organizational structure changes to improve the service level, efficiency and effectiveness of Assigned Functions

Planning and Organizing:

Manage the planning, execution and support of Assigned Functions. Insure plans are in accordance with overall corporate strategic plans. Evaluate, design and implement cost effective solutions (hardware, software and services), ensuring that solutions are evaluated from a long-term perspective. Insure detailed task plans are consistently developed and utilized for all projects, and develop and implement other project controls as necessary to insure their accurate and timely completion. Evaluate new and emerging technologies within assigned business function(s), recommending new/different solutions to IT Management. Insure plans are understandable and actionable by IT Management. Function as a technology visionary/advocate within the Assigned Functions, recommending solutions before needs become critical.

Communications:

Communicate effectively and frequently with Business Management of Assigned Functions, IT management, peers, subordinates, clients and other company management. Develop rapport in interpersonal relationships through effective listening and communication skills. Develop and make effective presentations to Executive IT and Business Management regarding concerning ongoing project plans and status, strategic technology solution trends and potential technology solutions to business needs in the Assigned Functions. Consult with IT staff and user organizations regarding the most effective use of tools, products and services of Assigned Functions.

Leadership:

Develop and maintain a leadership role within IT and Business Management of Assigned Functions, contributing to IT and corporate goals as a team player. Participate as a member of the Sr. IT Management Team in developing organizational tactics. Present a positive, optimistic and upbeat image even when directing activities or implementing decisions that are not popular with IT or client staffs. Maintain an in-depth awareness of current and emerging technology trends regarding Assigned Functions. Provide management coaching to IT peers and staff. Function in a leadership capacity in both Assigned Functions and the IT Department as a whole. Actively pursue a personal program of formal and informal study to ensure an enhanced, progressive ongoing leadership role.

Financial:

Participate in the development of annual capital and expense budgets for Assigned Functions. Track all ongoing expenses for the Assigned Functions. Develop monthly expense analyses, budget vs. actual forecasts and capital expenditure analyses for Assigned Functions. Insure that all Assigned Functions and projects are correctly budgeted and that actual costs are equal to or less than the established budgets.

Additional Functions:

General Business Knowledge:

Understand the business functions of many Foster Farms’ business functions. Understand and evaluate how IT changes may impact the operation of these business functions.

Special projects as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, management/business information systems or related field.

10 - 12+ years experience in business systems development, enhancement and maintenance with direct experience in programming, systems design and development; with heavy experience utilizing Systems Development Methodologies

5 -10 years experience in managing complex business systems projects – analysis, design, development, testing, implementation and change management.

2 – 4+ years managing multiple, complex business systems projects, developing and managing projects with aggressive milestones.

2 – 5+ years management/supervisory experience.

Demonstrated ability to teach/mentor and educate staff in SAP/ERP or other complex enterprise-wide business software solution as well as other IT systems capabilities and best practices.

Must possess excellent critical thinking skills with the capability to envision creative solutions to complex and challenging business process/system issues.

Heavy experience applying Systems Development Methodologies in the development of new business systems

Excellent interpersonal and management skills.

Excellent communications skills with the ability to communicate effectively with Sr. Executives and all levels of management, users, staff and team members, both written and verbal.

Common sense skill sets.

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:

Master’s Degree

5 years of IT experience working in a manufacturing organization for a $1+ billion organization.

10 years of experience in Systems Development

5 years experience managing Business Systems in SAP/ERP environment

Proven track record of developing “in house” talent and creating development programs.

Ability to move up within the organization.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must have reliable transportation

Must have a valid or ability to obtain CA drivers license

Must be able to travel overnight occasionally

Must be able to have consistent attendance in the Livingston, or other assigned Foster Farms’ Office

Must be able to sit for long periods of time.

Must be able to drive to various company and vendor locations

Must be able to work on the computer for long periods of time

Must be able to deal with periodic high stress situations

Must be able to stay calm and focused when dealing with difficult personnel issues.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Foster Farms is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minorities, Females, Veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Foster Farms participates in E-Verify during the hire process at all locations for all new employees.

About Juniper Square Our mission is to make the world’s private capital markets more efficient, transparent, and accessible. Privately owned assets like commercial real estate make up half of our financial ecosystem yet remain inaccessible to most people. We are digitizing these markets and as a result bringing access to millions who don’t currently benefit from one of the most productive corners of our financial ecosystem. If you care about making the world a better place by making markets work better through technology—all while contributing as a member of a values-driven organization—we want to hear from you. We’ve tripled our team in each of the past three years while maintaining an excellent culture and staying true to our values. We are well-funded and building for the long-term, and are on track to triple our headcount again this year. We need YOU to help us achieve our mission. About your role As head of information technology and security at Juniper Square, you will establish the information technology organization and grow the team over time. Specifically, you will: Lead the definition of IT and security policies and procedures Scale the company’s IT and security functions over time by growing a team Manage our enterprise technology platforms, with a focus on building capabilities to support business needs, drive collaboration, and ensure information security Manage desktop IT and office technology infrastructure Collaborate with departments throughout the company to advise on computing practices and security Lead enterprise software application integration projects Manage enterprise security assurance projects according to standards such as SOC 2 and ISO 27001, in conjunction with our engineering, product, and finance teams Qualifications Bachelor's degree (technical field is a plus, but not necessary) 7+ years of IT management experience with a focus on security Experience with enterprise software management and integration Experience with security assurance standards such as SOC 2 is a plus Flexibility and adaptability—you will be juggling multiple projects in a fast-paced startup environment Benefits Competitive salary and meaningful equity Health, dental, and vision care for you and your family Unlimited vacation policy and paid holidays Generous paid family leave, medical leave, and bereavement leave policies 401k retirement savings plan Healthcare FSA and commuter benefits programs Freedom to customize your work and technology setup as you see fit Professional development stipend Monthly work-from-home wellness stipend while working remotely Mental wellness coverage including live coaching and therapy sessions If you got to this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you’ve just read! Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Juniper Square's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways – not just candidates who check all the boxes.

Build the IT framework to scale Flexport

The opportunity:


Flexport helps more than 10,000 clients and suppliers lead all aspects of their supply chain operations. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B from investors that include SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator.

With offices on three continents, our team is as global as our client base and we're excited to continue building a product and service they love. Wherever you are, whichever role you play, you're guaranteed to share your day with committed, encouraging, and resourceful team members.

We're looking for a Head of Global IT that is an innovative leader with excellent analytical abilities and judgment who can set and deliver on clear objectives for solutions that support the overall business and IT goals, while also being efficient and delivery focused. You'll work alongside self-starters interested in solving real-world problems and streamlining the inefficiencies in the complex global trade industry. You'll have the opportunity to reshape an industry by being part of the company creating the new operating system for global trade.

As Flexport's Head of Global IT, you will need to be able to manage a geographically dispersed team focused on creating a frictionless support organization that anticipates and quickly responds to our internal customer needs at anyplace, and at any time. You will need to provide transparent technology governance capabilities to help the business meet their net revenue and productivity goals. This should also tie into establishing and maintaining a strong audit ready, data driven IT organization. The ability to understand the business needs/requirements and create a business technology strategy aligned with internal integration and enterprise SaaS management is critical to the success of this role.

You will:
Oversee the global service desk, end user support, IT asset and software management, and business technology functions
Create and own the IT roadmap, which includes analyzing emerging technologies and assessing the impact on current and future business processes
Responsible for partnering with key stakeholders and vendors to identify, implement and manage solutions that align with the IT roadmap
Responsible for defining, implementing and managing an integration strategy that enables internal enterprise SaaS solutions to communicate securely and effectively to meet the needs of the business
Manage the Technology Portfolio as it relates to the General and Administrative (G&A) functions: Facilities, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technologies (IT), Legal and other internal functions.
Ensure all global IT services such as cloud-based phone & video conferencing systems are operating efficiently
Tight visibility and management of overall Software purchasing, usage and spend
Own and oversee our Flexport hire to retire automated employee lifecycle
You should have:


Results-oriented team player who leads by example and takes full ownership of work
A passion for business transformation, the ability to lead change in an inclusive manner and the desire to bring the best combination of skills together in a team
Possess solid project management skills, can set and manage expectations, and drive productively with others through leadership and people management skills
Must be able to handle changing and competing priorities where the path forward is not always clear at the outset and use good judgment in stressful situations
Must communicate exceptionally well, both in writing and verbally, including success communicating ideas in both technical and user-friendly language and technical writing skills.
About Flexport:


We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.

Worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's incredibly important for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
What's freight forwarding and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.
At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

We’re on a mission to empower every person to own their inner potential, and we’re seeking candidates who want to make an impact on our journey.

Our IT/IS team manages both the physical and digital infrastructure for the Veev Group and ensures that our employees have the technology, tools and software solutions they need to be successful and productive in their roles. Manage vendor relationships, negotiation, and budgeting

Lead the installation and configuration of hardware and software components throughout the employee life cycle (onboarding to offboarding)
Lead IT/IS projects, including system design and deployment of new IT/IS systems and services such as Product Lifecycle Management solution and SSO solution
Provide guidance and training to IT/IS staff (including external consultants)

Proven track record of providing exceptional IT/IS services and operating enterprise environments
Knowledgeable with Enterprise apps, Personal computing, networking, security and troubleshooting
Understanding relationships between technology and business operations.

Who We Are Samsara, founded in 2015, is a leader in Industrial IoT and our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy. Our solutions combine hardware and software to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations across various industries. Samsara's fast-growing team is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Jose, Atlanta, and London. Our team has raised $930M from Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, AllianceBernstein Holding LP, Franklin Templeton, General Atlantic, Sands Capital Management and Warburg Pincus LLC. At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact. About the Role Samsara is looking for a curious and motivated IT Manager who's excited to help us scale our IT Operations to support a rapidly growing user base of over 1000 employees. Your primary responsibility will be to support our People, Places, and Events - enabling our employees to do their absolute best work. This includes coaching and developing our IT team as well as organizing operations, developing and refining systems, and building processes to provide the best customer experiences. This is a full-time position at our office in Potrero Hill and includes company stock; up to 4% 401(k) match; catered lunch four days a week; commuter benefits; and 100% coverage on medical, dental, and vision benefits. In this role, you will: IT Systems - Own and optimize core tools and systems that power Samsara. Examples include Cisco Meraki, Okta, Zoom, Zendesk, and RingCentral Events and experiences - Connect the company by delivering the highest quality A/V experiences for both remote and in-person events Technical support - Optimize the employee support experience and keep things operational. Work with the team to establish best practices and build processes to ensure execution Security and Compliance - Drive core security and compliance activities to ensure we're protecting our information assets Operational Analytics - Developing and analyze IT's activities and ensure the highest levels of performance Team Management - Hire and develop our global IT Team An ideal candidate has: 4+ years in an IT services, technical support, or systems role Experience successfully managing people and projects Expertise in IT systems, networks, operations, and cloud systems Strong analytical and project management skills, proven ability to design and communicate clear processes, and a detail-oriented yet flexible approach to problem solving Impeccable discretion when handling sensitive and confidential information Excellent self-management and interpersonal skills Positive, tenacious attitude while delivering on complex and challenging projects BA / BS with a technical degree (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, MIS, etc.) Bonus points: experience in fast growing organizations with over 1000 employees Benefits Working at Samsara has its perks: for all global employees, we provide private medical and dental insurance plus growth and development opportunities, as well as regular virtual team and company events. In the US we offer flexible vacation time, EMEA employees receive 25 vacation days plus national bank holidays. Post-COVID we'll be back in our global offices with numerous in-office perks. Regarding COVID-19 With the spread of COVID-19, Samsara's global offices will remain closed until further notice with the exception of employees that require access to hardware and lab equipment. Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing. Employees are also able to work from countries and states where Samsara is a registered entity through June 2021. All employees are expected to return to our offices when they reopen with the exception of field-based roles. If you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to contact us at jobs@samsara.com.

Responsibilities
Strategy & Planning

Possess and apply knowledge of information and data security requirements and implementation of systems and processes to secure company networks and data and oversee cybersecurity operation and audit access rights for all IT resources
Ensure Service Desk SLAs and Customer Service standards are defined, communicated and met with focus on continuous improvement over time
Management and mentoring of IT staff to achieve company and departmental goals

Job Description:
Asana is seeking an experienced and motivated leader to manage our growing IT Support team. Based in San Francisco, this hands on role, will be responsible for managing a team that delivers world class support to our users globally. You will be focused on enabling the Support team to help Asana's teams to function at their peak potential. This position will report directly to the Head of IT in San Francisco.

You are someone who asks questions, is confident in not knowing everything, and would rather collaborate with others than go it alone. You are crisp and detail oriented, but able to work outside of the boundaries when necessary. On top of your proven history of success, you have a passion for technology and, like us, you value hard work and fun in equal measure.

What you'll achieve
Manage a team of IT tech support personnel in Asana's IT Support. You will be responsible for hiring, performance management, and career development as the team grows
Own SLAs for user support requests and ensure both their success and continuous improvement
Support Asana employees in resolving problems with IT issues Hardware, Software, Operating System(Mac/Windows), Desktop Applications, AV, and Communications systems.
Lead projects, focused on continuously improving IT Support at Asana
Facilitate escalations as necessary to IT Operations, IT Systems Engineering, Network Engineering, or AV Engineering as appropriate.
Partner with IT leads in other offices to ensure consistent service delivery globally
About you
4 - 7 years of experience with the following
Directly managing an in person support team.
Supporting employees and solving hardware and software problems with Apple products, including Mac laptops, iPads, and Apple application software.
Hands on knowledge of current IT and communications technology fundamentals(Mac, Windows, IOS, Android).
Experience with using and managing hosted productivity and communications applications, including gSuite, Asana, Dropbox, Slack, MS Office, Adobe, and others.
Possess both exemplary customer service skills and the ability to train and support employees on IT systems and hardware.
Ability to lift heavy equipment (50+ pounds) as needed
About us

At Asana, we're building a better way to work, fueled by transparency, inclusion, and technology that is a force for positive change. Asana is a work management platform that helps teams orchestrate their work, from daily tasks to strategic initiatives, so they can move faster and accomplish more with less. For the past 5 years, we've been named a top workplace, including top 10 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces, #1 Fortune Best Workplaces in the Bay Area, #8 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, and one of Ireland's Best Workplaces. With offices all over the world, we are always looking for curious, collaborative, and mission-driven people to help us enable the world's teams to work together effortlessly.

We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We welcome applicants of any educational background, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, and veteran status.

MOMENTUS OVERVIEW
Momentus is the first company to offer the infrastructure services necessary to enable enterprise and human existence to flourish in space. We are striving to meet the needs of our customers by offering the most affordable last-mile satellite and cargo delivery, payload hosting, and in-orbit servicing options. Our in-space shuttles are propelled by a revolutionary new type of water plasma rocket. No one has experimented with or built water plasma propulsion on the scale that we are, and so we are hiring to scale our company for continued success. Our technological breakthroughs paired with recent disruptions in the launch industry unlock business opportunities in space of a previously unimaginable magnitude. The market opportunity is massive, with the space economy projected to be worth trillions in the near term. At Momentus, we are helping to usher in the next industrial revolution—in space.

OUR PEOPLE
We know that daring problems require daring solutions. While our competitors take more conservative, proven approaches, we are experimenting with never-been-done-before technology to solve the greatest challenges of our time. Our team knows that working at Momentus means more than building innovative technology, it means creating an entirely new market in the space economy. We are level-headed, business-minded strategic thinkers intent on providing immediate value while simultaneously preparing for the vast possibilities of the future. If this sounds like you, we should talk.

Monitor performance of IT systems to determine lifecycle cost and productivity levels, and to make recommendations for improvement.
Develop procedures, processes, DR plans, instructions and other materials as necessary.

Broad experience administrating corporate IT environments locally and in the cloud (Microsoft 365, Gsuite, AD, Networking etc.)
Proven experience managing IT infrastructure and services
Minimum 5 years managing a fully staffed IT Department.
Experiencing managing a multicampus, multinational environment
Excellent project management skills and strong ability to prioritize
Experience deploying and supporting engineering specific applications. (PTC, Winchill PLM, Solidworks, Matlab, NetSuite, etc)

ABOUT LOANPAL

We provide friendly financing options for those who dream of living a more sustainable lifestyle and want to save money using modern technology. Our collective mission is to make a positive impact on the planet, build lasting relationships with our valued partners and customers, and deliver a tech-enabled lending experience that is simple, fast, and frictionless.

We are creating a financial ecosystem that connects billions of dollars of capital to millions of homeowners that want to convert their outdated houses into modern, smart, energy-efficient homes. By unlocking access to numerous products that help people achieve better sustainability, we are revolutionizing the $350B+ home improvement industry and protecting our only planet.

As part of our world-positive initiative, we are also the official sponsor of GivePower – a foundation that uses solar-based solutions to power life’s basic needs for people in developing regions of the world.

If you have an unstoppable desire to make a meaningful impact on our planet, and help mission-driven businesses and consumers achieve a more sustainable future, join us.
Competitive pay
Comprehensive benefits package
Position Summary:

Loanpal’s IT organization is looking for a manager responsible for enabling a winning experience for our new hires, internal employees, and stakeholders. The team provides support for onboarding new employees, help existing employee function smoothly without IT/Hardware difficulties, and streamline existing new hire process as well as on boarding process to create world class new hire experience. We are looking for a IT Manager to guide the team in the day-to-day execution of critical functions to support our employees and internal stakeholders. We are looking for a passionate IT professional who truly embraces the ownership mindset and who obsesses over how to make the world a better place through world positive, friendly financing and investing. The ideal candidate will be an experienced people leader with technical mindset and knowledge. The individual must have excellent influence management and communication skills, be effective in identifying patterns for improvement opportunities, and advocating scalable systems solutions to address them. The individual needs to demonstrate competent business process literacy, ability around applications and systems, and proficiency. technical process documentation. Overtime, the Customer Success Manager will transform most of the team’s work from pure execution to strategic sales engineering support.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Helpdesk Support – Provide hands-on Helpdesk support during the on-boarding process and offer technical support for our new hires and existing employees. Troubleshoot issues in production and perform root cause analysis. Remedy or report bugs as appropriate. Utilize Fresh service ticketing system for all activities, manage tickets based on predefined priorities, ensure all tickets are resolved within our SLA, and keep tickets up to date. Deliver customized training programs to various business teams.
Employee On-boarding/Off-boarding Advocacy – Work closely with front-line support teams to understand customer pain points and monitor trends and patterns. Advocate better new hire experience and support process by partnering with the HR/Recruiting teams to prioritize scalable system solutions. Build and manage relationships with Business departments/stakeholders.
Capacity Management and Prioritization – Lead team in managing issues beginning with identifying, reporting, reproducing, testing, and certifying so there is a closed loop on full resolution. Focus on informing the prioritization and tracking the resolution of known issues. Use metric driven projections to manage the staffing model of the team.
People Leadership – Mentor and develop a team of support specialist and engineers. Develop staffing model and capacity plans to effectively support all stakeholder and user groups. Model team norms and contribute to positive team dynamics, leading to continuous team performance improvement. Foster an environment of trust, effectively communicating with an ecosystem of stakeholders.
Communication and Reporting – Regularly provide updates to senior leaders, stakeholders, partners, etc. Effectively tailor communications to the appropriate audience to ensure broad alignment, awareness, and advocacy of the product. Manage stakeholder relationships reviewing performance and issues lists to help drive faster response times and higher quality.
Hardware Support/Inventory Lifecycle Management - Analyze existing equipment/hardware setup process to find gaps. Help improve overall process to allow the business to onboard 4 times the number of new hires. Help implement an Inventory Management system in place from scratch to effectively plan current and future new hire hardware needs.
Vendor/Tool Management - Effectively negotiate vendor contracts and maintain a centralized vendor repository. Own end-to-end license renewing process, procurement process, new vendor background check process, etc. across the organization.
Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
Technical background (or comfort with technical details) with a keen understanding of broader business needs and strategy
Deep empathy for customers and commitment to extraordinary customer service
Exceptional listening skills and influence management
Exceptional pattern recognition and demonstrated ability to synthesize data
Self-starter with outstanding organizational skills
Curiosity to continually reevaluate existing designs
Effective in partnering cross-functionally, cross-enterprise and work effectively with various levels of the organization as well as various personality types
Good understanding and/or experience with financial services regulations and loan origination is a plus
Experience Required:
7-10 years experience
Bachelors degree
