JOB DESCRIPTION

Want to make a difference and be challenged every day? Then come join the Application Technology and Innovations team at Robert Half Corporate and be part of a team that pushes the boundaries of what's possible with technology solutions.

Robert Half is a highly successful, $6.1 billion company with offices around the world. The Applications Technology and Innovations is a team of 450 highly skilled people who together build and support innovative technology solutions for Corporate back office users and Staffing Temps and Clients.

Robert Half is seeking an IT Applications Manager reporting directly to the Applications Director supporting North America HCM and Time solutions for our Staffing business. This manager will lead highly skilled Functional/Technical Architects, Software Engineers and Business Systems Analysts building new solutions within our PeopleSoft applications, custom API solutions in AWS, complex integrations, and auxiliary applications.

Our core products are highly customized Peoplesoft HCM, Payroll, Benefits and Time modules, and a completely custom application for Time entry, client approvals, back office management for our North America staffing business. In addition, the team owns APIs integrating PeopleSoft Time functionality with Robert Half Native Mobile App and in the near-future with a Salesforce-based web client.

Next year, our roadmap features a Tools Upgrade and migration of our ERP to the AWS cloud solution. In the next 3-4 years will plan and implement our next-gen application to replace PeopleSoft 9. Application solution for our corporate, field and external (candidate/client) users were and continues to be built on PeopleSoft, API integrations, Lambda, AWS, automation and many other tools for integration and file/documents transfers. Our team functions using SCRUM practices and is stringent on practices around ceremonies and architecture/design reviews.

We have a consistent track record of success in achieving a broad range of goals and timely delivery year after year. We have great leadership and individual contributor skills that have made our group successful and highly trusted by our business owners and IT partners. As a team, we are work-focused, cohesive, adaptable, and flexible with a positive attitude resulting in quantifiable results and wins. The team is encouraged to constantly evaluate and use new technologies/tools to adopt technological advances and make way for system efficiencies. We believe that our employees are our most valuable asset, and we embody a culture of recognition, caring, and involvement in company and community activities. We work hard but make the effort to enjoy a healthy work-life balance and fun while at work. We are looking for someone who can provide leadership, architectural knowledge, functional and technical guidance to the team, represent the team in collaboration with business groups, IT partners and senior leadership.

Responsibilities:

Deliver reliable, scalable, and efficient applications managing all phases of the development life cycle, including requirements gathering, modeling & design, development, testing, deployment, integration, and documentation.
Work with cross-functional teams to develop solutions that accelerate cycle times, alleviate cumbersome manual processes, and ensure results are accurate.
Identify process improvement opportunities to drive innovation.
Earn Trust of Others. Engage with many internal teams, building relationships and helping identify existing components and technologies that can be leveraged to deliver on our goals.
Team oversight of assignments and capacity to deliver projects on-time and within budget.
Engages with business owners and department counterparts, project delivery, scrum masters, project managers, and project sponsors in the business to:
formulate acceptable delivery timelines
discuss tactical and strategic objectives.
understand, clarify, and document the objectives and success factors for business-based project initiatives.
Collaborates and consults with IT management, architects, and business owners as appropriate in providing support during the solution delivery and application support phases.
Participates in and leads project estimating efforts.
Makes resource requirement and headcount recommendations based upon analysis and presents to management for final decisions.
Collaborates with management of Production/Operations team in resolving production issues.
Ensures new applications meet or exceed stated SLAs.
Responsible for personnel actions, including hiring, onboarding, firing, promotion, development, discipline, and employee compensation.
Provides coaching, guidance, mentoring to team members as appropriate.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in technology related field or equivalent years of experience
5+ years of Team Leadership, Supervisory or Management experience overseeing enterprise application development including:
Formation and management of diverse teams (e.g. on-site & remote, employees, contingent workers)
Handling hiring, promotions, performance evaluation, etc.
Vendor management (SOWs, POs, etc.)
Required: 5+ years of experience as a software engineer
Strong preference for expertise in integration technologies (API), java and JavaScript
Strong preference for experience on AWS, Lambda and SQL
Strong preference for applicants with experience in ERP/SaaS for HCM/Payroll/Time or extensive in-depth knowledge of multiple enterprise applications
Ability to engage in detailed discussions with architects, engineers, and analysts, both at a high level (e.g. strategy, architecture and design) and low level (individual items of code and configuration)
Experience in SCRUM methodology a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Must be able to work independently and apply good judgment.

Must be able to work within a team both as a leader and as a team member.

Director, Information Technology The Director of Information Technology is responsible for Castlight’s corporate IT infrastructure, applications, strategy and policies for the organization. S/he will lead and direct the IT organization that manages Castlight’s enterprise applications, corporate network as well as desktop IT assets and ensure that all members of the organization are able to perform their functions with the highest level of productivity and effectiveness. The leader will be tasked with ensuring business continuity and risk management when it comes to IT systems and processes. The leader is also responsible for developing and driving the IT strategy for the company aligned with business goals and needs. This position will be located in San Francisco or Salt Lake City. Responsibilities: Own planning and implementation of new and upgraded IT systems and solutions within the company. Lead a team of enterprise applications, database, network and systems administrators as well as IT infrastructure technologists to implement and maintain the company’s IT assets. Enterprise applications implementation and support includes the Salesforce Clouds for Sales, Marketing and Service. It also includes the company’s authentication systems Okta, office productivity, developer productivity tools such as Slack and JIRA and more. Responsible for defining the company’s IT architecture and strategy working with other senior leaders to ensure business alignment. Keep abreast of trends in information technology, emerging technologies and solutions as well as IT practices. Recommend adoption of solutions based on business need and value. Annually develop a Corporate IT Capital Budget, Operations Budget, and Project Roadmap. Partner closely with the CISO and the Information Security organization to ensure the company’s security posture and policies are maintained across the IT systems and services. Partner closely with the Engineering organization to ensure the needs of the company’s data center and customer facing production systems managed by Engineering are well supported. Partner closely with the Sales, Support and Marketing organizations to ensure the Salesforce Cloud infrastructure needs are well understood and well supported. Manage complex third-party vendor relationships and the procurement, finances and logistics required for the IT organization. Lead the team responsible for the operation, configuration and as necessary the customization of the Salesforce.com platform. Collaborate cross functionally to deliver projects and outputs in an agile environment. Skilled on Agile and Scrum methodologies of project management Experience working with product development organizations in integrating IT systems with the product stack. Analyze business requirements across the enterprise to determine technology needs and roadmap Manage multiple complex vendor relationships Qualifications: BS in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field 10+ years related experience with progressive responsibilities managing IT Infrastructure, Enterprise applications (i.e. Oracle ERP, Messaging)., Website, LIMS Helpdesk, and other specialized applications widely used in R&D, Operations, Clinical and regulatory. Direct experience working on CRM projects for middle market and enterprise sized organizations. Prior experience with Salesforce Cloud environments preferred. Experienced in Agile methodologies and environments In-depth experience in analysis, implementation and evaluation of IT systems and vendors Experience with ITIL and other IT methodologies desired

At Geltor we design award-winning ingredients for the world's biggest consumer product companies. Geltor is looking for an IT DIRECTOR to join our team in San Leandro, CA.

The IT Director will join the frontlines of a fast-paced and dynamic finance and operations team, leading the development and maintenance of the company’s information systems and technical strategy. This role offers the opportunity for a growth-minded Director to build out the IT function of a rapidly scaling biotech startup, designing the team and functions that will support the company’s ongoing success. This position will be trusted to provide technical advice on critical subjects such as data security and privacy, enterprise systems and applications, efficiency, and compliance.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop long-term and short-term IT strategy for the company; oversee development and implementation of an IT roadmap
Build the systems, processes, and team required to support rapid growth, commercialization, and evolving organizational needs
Serve as Chief Data Security Officer and oversee policies related to data security in both hardware and software venues
Develop and manage an IT asset purchase / replacement policy and manage the inventory of Geltor’s IT assets.
Lead and drive initiatives to improve compliance, security, and automation.
Proactively identify and pursue opportunities to exploit new technologies to achieve key business objectives.
Develop and implement IT governance framework for the company.
Lead all operations of Information Technology department including: desktop technical support, short- and long-term department planning, implementation of new applications and interfaces with purchased software, upgrading existing applications, and establishing department standards, procedures, and work flow
Requirements:
Comprehensive background in Information Technology, preferably in both large company environments with established IT infrastructure and small, fast-paced, rapidly growing companies where systems and processes need to be designed and implemented.
Experience managing cross-functional teams or projects, influencing senior-level management and key stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to translate strategic priorities into IT solutions
Experience in IT management Experience with Security and Compliance policy rollout and maintenance
Ability to develop budget for departmental hiring and strategic needs
Experience in building and developing high performance teams – engaging, coaching, and mentoring teams in support of their growth and increased contribution.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate, influence and work effectively with teams at all levels
Excellent organizational and project management skills with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver high-quality projects amidst tight timelines and competing deadlines
A positive, open, and intellectually curious team player who embraces the challenges and excitement of an entrepreneurial business;
Resourceful and able to drive projects autonomously, with limited oversight
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, lean organization amidst a shifting competitive landscape.
About Geltor
Geltor designs high-performance, sustainable ingredients for consumer product companies by combining computation, biology and materials science. Our first products are collagen proteins optimized for cosmetics and personal care applications and produced through a proprietary animal-free fermentation process. The company was founded in 2015 and is headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area.

At Geltor we believe the most innovative progress and scientific discoveries happen when we include, celebrate, and embrace difference. We are committed to building a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. Geltor is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Sr. Director - IT Commercial Systems (Remote Position)
Job Description:
*NOTE This position may be remotely based from anywhere in the United States.

Position Summary

The Senior Director IT Commercial Systems is a senior IT Leader accountable for providing technology partnership and delivering on system capabilities for all Commercial Operations business activities at Cepheid. This IT leader would be accountable for full lifecycle of systems development for Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, Customer Service and Support functions. This strategic leader role would interact with senior leadership of Cepheid on business requirements analyses and oversee teams of associates and external resources in providing a seamless delivery of technology solutions. This role would provide functional leadership to global IT Commercial Operations resources and coordinate local system capabilities enablement with the IT Leaders in the EMEA and APAC regions.

This leader plays the primary BRM (Business Relationship Management) role across various management levels of the Cepheid Commercial Organization and provide strategic partnership to the business partners in developing and delivering on the technology roadmap to create business value. This leader will be involved in new systems rollouts and software automations to drive efficiencies and help scale the organization through the hyper-growth phase Cepheid is currently experiencing.

Essential Job Responsibilities
Serve as the primary IT-BRM (Business Relationship Manager) for the Commercial Operations organization
Build strong partnerships with the global business partners to understand the business architecture and create a Technology Architecture that creates maximum value
Effectively deal with ambiguity by confidently walking through an undefined situation and drawing out key requirements and organizational constraints
Effectively lead the key IT Operations activities including strategic planning and execution, architectural design decisions and resource planning
Develop and execute the technology roadmap identifying gaps between current and desired end-state delivering comprehensive solutions that will enable achievement of business outcomes
Design, Implement and Operate using Agile methodologies focusing on continuous delivery
Lead, Mentor and Run IT Associates and Contract resources in full SDLC activities supporting the CRM platform
Disseminate standard methodologies on solution and mentor associates across managers and individual contributor levels and hold them accountable for results
Work optimal in a fast paced, fluid environment while building scale and re-usability in the enterprise
Balance immediacy of need with scalability and supportability of solutions
Design and implement business continuity protocols and controls to minimize disruptions to business operations.
Coordinate with the business on identifying the business needs and being responsible for the project/product delivery backlog and solution delivery processes.
Utilize data and metrics to drive continuous improvements in IT delivery
Minimum Requirements


Education and Experience
A bachelors or masters degree in business administration, computer science, information science or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Fifteen or more years of business experience, ideally in Business Systems or IT Management. Broad business experience internally and within the vertical industry is desired.
Ten+ years of progressive leadership experience in leading multi-functional teams and enterprise wide programs, operating and influencing optimal across the organization and within sophisticated contexts.
Experience in integrating sophisticated, cross-corporate processes and information strategies, and/or designing strategic metrics and scorecards.
Strategy and management consulting experience desirable
Knowledge and Skills
Validated experience supervising sophisticated global CRM Application deployments
Broad expertise in SFDC (SalesForce) Platform across SaaS and PaaS capabilities including SalesCloud, ServiceCloud
Preferred experience with Field Service Lightning and/or Configure-Price-Quote solutions
Ability to synthesize complex business requirements into functional design elements and drive innovative solution delivery
Excellent eye for business and interpersonal skills; able to work across business lines at a senior level to influence and effect change to achieve common goals.
Validated leadership; consistent record of leading sophisticated, multidisciplinary talent teams in new endeavors and delivering solutions.
Information strategy experience Experience in strategic technology planning, and policy development and maintenance.
Analytical skills Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Familiarity with business information generation and analysis methods.
Ability to drive business, culture and technology change in a multifaceted and sophisticated operating environment.
Excellent oral and written communication skills. Able to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders, and business concepts to technologists. The candidate should be able to sell ideas and processes internally at all levels, including the board and investors.
Record of effective leadership, including the ability to balance team and individual responsibilities, build teams and consensus, get things done through others not directly under his/her supervision, and work ethically and with integrity.

Job Description

Sr. Director of Information Technology


About Ingrid & Isabel

Ingrid & Isabel, the leading apparel brand in the premium maternity category, designs innovative pregnancy essentials to help women look and feel beautiful throughout pregnancy and beyond. Since the launch in 2003 with the lead product The Bellaband®, the company has expanded to include activewear, nursing, fashion, and more. Ingrid & Isabel’s line is available at speciality stores across the US, as well as major retailers including Nordstrom, Amazon, Bloomingdales, Gap and more! Launched in 2017, you can also find Ingrid & Isabel’s sister line, Isabel Maternity, in over 1800 Target stores.

About The Role

Ingrid & Isabel (IAI) has entered an extremely exciting time of expansion and growth since its inception in 2001. As our Director of IT you will be the first and lead digital thought leader and technology strategist in the company, partnering with your colleagues in operations and our external partners (ERP, warehouse, etc.) to ensure the integrity of the organization’s IT infrastructure. This is a leadership role, and as such you will lead the company’s technological vision and strategy with your cross-functional business acumen. You are a hands-on leader with a proven track record in managing diverse teams delivering against tight deadlines in a dynamic environment. You will be responsible for enabling a high-performing and reliable IT operation and robust infrastructure to power Ingrid & Isabel on its steep growth curve. You will nurture cross-functional synergy between I.T. and other internal partners, drive standardization practices and process improvements and create opportunity from complexity. You must have strong communication skills and be a positive, team player, as this is a family-style business with great culture, where everyone pitches in to ensure our continued success.

What You'll Do
Design the overall IT architecture for Ingrid & Isabel and the Information Systems and Information Technology master plan
Ensure that internal clients (Marketplace, Design and Production teams, Operations etc.) within Ingrid & Isabel are provided with adequate information and technical tools to keep their team efficient and productive
Identify and pilot new tools that support innovation and efficiency for the company
Manage relationships with external vendors (ERP, hardware, software, etc) to ensure the best service and technology at cost-effective sustainability
Facilitate communication between the internal team, leadership, vendors and other technology resources within the organization
Define and communicate corporate policies and standards for acquiring, implementing and operating IT systems
At a Minimum, We'd Like You to Have
A B.S. in a related field and at least 10 years’ experience in the information technology arena
An M.B.A./M.S. in related field is preferred
At least 5 years of management and strategic leadership experience
Experience leading and deploying ERP and CRM solutions
Experience with call-center solutions
Strong project management experience
Experience leading globally distributed organizations
Experience managing budgets
Be Who You Are and Do What You Love at Ingrid and Isabel

We’re a Family
At Ingrid and Isabel, we strive to create and foster a strong family environment in our workplace. We collaborate to accomplish our goals, always working as a team. We aim to build a culture of inclusion — celebrating and leveraging our differences for the betterment of one another, our products and our community.

Ingrid & Isabel team members come from many backgrounds and bring diverse experiences to the company. We take pride in making each person feel at home.

Ingrid and Isabel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We Make Things Happen
Our team members play a key role in guiding the direction of our company and are able to work across multiple groups to implement fresh ideas that allow Ingrid and Isabel to be the industry leader. If you are interested in applying your passion to create products that will transform the lives of millions of people welcome to Ingrid and Isabel.

Benefits And Perks
Competitive salary
Flexible PTO
Commuter benefits
Medical, dental, vision insurance
Maternity/paternity leave program
401k retirement savings plan
Flexible spending accounts


Seniority Level

Sr. Director

Location: The position will be based in San Francisco, CA.

Overview

SBM Management is looking to hire an Executive IT Support Specialist to join their team! This position is responsible to work in a security constructed mindset while ensuring work is carried out in a discreet fashion with extreme confidentiality. Technical Specialist who provides professional and timely support for a wide range of IT equipment and software. Using a proactive approach to issues and opportunities, along with a sense of urgency and accuracy supports Executive users within SBM.

Responsibilities
High standards of professionalism and integrity.
Protects and maintains the privacy of employee information.
Delivers high level IT support both onsite and at remote offices.
Provides consistent organization, planning and time management.
Ability to understand, troubleshoot and solve the technology challenges the CEO encounters in his day to day activities with effective decision making and problem solving.
Ability to explain technical issues in non-technical terms to end users
Focuses on technology requirements and tools such as laptops, desktop, iPad, iPhone, PC/Tablets, remote access, home offices etc.
Works with CEO’s Assistant and the IT Helpdesk to develop a support plan and technology roadmap for CEO technology needs, including travel and other offsite engagements.
Ability to work in an environment that may be occasionally stressful when assisting clients on site maintaining an excellent communication and customer service focus.
Works with remote support vendors as needed to have various tasks performed at home offices where travel and remote support are not possible.
Responds quickly to technology outages affecting the CEO and service at his home offices to restore service as quickly as possible, on a 24/7 basis as needed.
Works in partnership with the IT Helpdesk Team, understands and follows the established technology standards and support processes as appropriate.
Provides feedback based on CEO input and usage.
Develops ideas for new and improved solutions based on needs.
Establishes and monitors metrics on service delivery and customer satisfaction.
Ability to manage multiple projects, particularly those impacting end users.
Global support as needed.
Ability to work with a broad tolerance for the different work styles of the CEO.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university with three years’ experience in providing desktop support services to senior executives; and five years of user support experience, troubleshooting hardware and software problems required; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience in managing projects and providing global support to end users.
Professional experience with current Windows OS, Apple OS, and hardware.
Professional experience with The Microsoft Office Suite (2013 and 2016) as well as Microsoft Exchange and Outlook.
Experience in Windows Server Active Directory management is required and Windows Server Administration is a plus.
Professional experience with VOIP, mobile technologies, network environment, specifically TCP/IP preferred.

Available Shift: Full Time: 5am - 2pm and on-call as needed.

Compensation: Depends on experience

Overview: POSITION SUMMARY The Information Technology (IT) Manager is responsible for the day-to-day secure and effective operation of all information system services, application systems, networks, computer systems, and related applications within the Medical Center. This includes direct supervision and management of information technology staff including the performance of personnel duties. The IT Manager also leads or participates, at the direction of Administration, in IT projects, Medical Center’s committees and/or initiatives. Responsibilities: ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Manage all daily operations of the information services and technology functions, including; help desk; data center operations; network operations; daily coordination with technology and application vendors; and end-user devices and computers. Directly supervise Information Technology staff, including Help Desk and IT analysts, supporting them in the effective execution of their job responsibilities. Carries out supervisory responsibilities and duties in accordance with the Medical Center’s policies and procedures. Oversees the Medical Center’s network security planning and data center operations, including: regulatory compliance; disaster planning & business continuity; remote system access & authorization; data integrity, system backup and recovery procedures; and required technology and application system upgrades and maintenance. Works closely with users, steering committees, and Administration to analyze Medical Center’s network, hardware and application requirements. Reviews and evaluates hardware and software alternatives and recommends solutions or options. Evaluates, identifies and resolves information services-related operational problems. Maintains current knowledge of system hardware, networks and software systems implemented; strives to assess near term opportunities for improvement and required migrations. Strives to establish and maintain good working relationships, positive intra- and inter-departmental communications, as well as effective relationships with outside IT service providers. Works with Administration to develop and justify annual budget requirements and ensure cost effectiveness. Performs other duties as assigned or requested by Administration to support the overall needs of the department, and in accordance with AHMC SMC’s Mission, Vision, and Values. Qualifications: TRAINING/EXPERIENCE 5+ years’ experience in IT management and support of healthcare information systems. Excellent working knowledge of computer systems, security, network and systems administration, databases and data storage systems, and phone systems. Experience leading and managing large IT projects. Experience with IT services performance metrics and benchmarking. Experience with IT infrastructure and operations best practices. Requires a high level of personal integrity, and the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and demonstrate the appropriate level of judgment and maturity. Requires a high degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision. Knowledge and understanding of the integration of information systems as it relates to the healthcare field. EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION/LICENSE 4-year degree in Computer Science or related field. Certification and/or understanding of ITIL processes and standards. Facility: Seton Medical Center Req ID: req9003 Shift: Days Category: Information Technology Position Type: Regular Full-Time

Our client is looking for a Director of Information Technology to join their growing team. The Director of Information Technology will lead the IT function and define and implement the company IT infrastructure. The Director of Information Technology will ensure the scalability, efficiency, connectivity, and security of the company network and business systems.

DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead the IT staff that supports worldwide IT operations
Develop and implement the company IT infrastructure initiatives including: scalable data storage solutions, automated data backup plan, network, and business system bandwidth optimization, business system security, automated business system process efficiencies.
Improve and maintain existing systems including website, SharePoint, Service Cloud, File Cloud, NetSuite, Salesforce, Propel, telephone, and conferencing systems.
Manage and maintain IT annual budget.
Work with cross-functional business partners to identify business and technology needs to optimize the use of technology.
Develop processes and standards for selection, implementation, and support of systems
Audit network and business system performance, network security, and data storage back-ups in compliance with company policies.
QUALIFICATIONS:
BS in IS, IT, or computer science is required.
8+ years of experience working in IT operations management.
5+ years of leading the support of a Microsoft Windows-based computing environment for both PCs (Windows 10) and Servers (MS Windows Server 2012).
Experience with Azure Active Directory and Virtual Private Networks is required.
Virtual Machine experience a plus (VMWare).
Experience with Meraki Firewall and Access Points preferred.

We/Our Clients are equal opportunity employers. We Are Genetic Navigators bringing together passionate, creative and dedicated professionals to join a rapidly-growing startup on our mission to translate novel genetic insights into lifesaving medicines. We are integrating human genetics and functional genomics to decode the mysteries of genetic modifiers, leading us to new medicines we'll develop for a range of severe diseases.

We are seeking a dynamic IT leader who will develop and position our IT infrastructure to meet the demands of a rapidly growing biotechnology startup The role will be a key enabler of our mission to apply cutting edge techniques and data in the pursuit of new therapeutics for patients with unmet medical needs.

Your Role in Navigating The Maze:
Lead IT strategy and operations for a deeply scientific and data-intensive R&D organization, preparing the company for future growth
Be the face of IT responsible for providing technical IT assistance, including timely and customer-focused desktop support to Maze staff
Be responsible for contingency planning and maintenance of a robust information security program
Lead development of strategy and implementation of enterprise IT projects to support scientific and G&A functions
Be accountable for setting up IT infrastructure at a new local facility and ensure data integrity and seamless operations during multi-phased company move
Create and maintain IT policies, procedures and systems to ensure regulatory, compliance and quality needs are met
Manage vendors, consultants and overall budget for IT infrastructure
Help build and maintain the company's cloud-based computing environment
Develop and implement systems for managing data and software lifecycles
Champion the adoption across the company of best practices in data governance, management, and security
Your Navigation Tools:
7-10 years of relevant experience leading IT for a scientific R&D organization, including support of lab operations and users across PC, Mac and cloud computing
Efficient management of external relationships with MSPs, other IT vendors, contractors and consultants
Experience leading information security operations, including implementing, monitoring and incident response
Experience managing large data storage platforms both on-premise and in the cloud (specifically AWS) and ensuring that best security and configuration practices are adopted and implemented (AWS certification a plus)
Experience establishing an environment for validated systems, and developing and implementing processes and guidelines in preparation for SOX compliance
Knowledge of systems employed for managing biomedical research data (eg. relational and graph databases and specialized file formats on AWS S3 for genomics, clinical, and/or imaging data)
Ability to support tools required for the software development lifecycle (eg. Agile)
Customer service oriented and strives for excellence, with demonstrated ability to work effectively across teams of scientists, software engineers and business leaders
Strong leadership, project management and communication skills
Hands-on, proactive and willing to get involved with the detailed work needed to maintain optimal IT systems throughout the organization
Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science or engineering. Advanced degree is preferred

Baber Technical Consulting is a small, family-friendly firm of 10+ people. Our clients (mostly in Berkeley and Oakland) typically operate networks of 40 to 100 computers, predominantly in a Windows and Microsoft Office environment. We work primarily with non-profits and value a diverse workplace. Our goal is to provide a highly-capable IT department to organizations where IT is a fundamental requirement and a strategic priority but not a core area of expertise. Join us in doing IT and doing good: you'll see the impact of your work. We are seeking a person with a broad background in Information Technology to join our firm in providing contracted IT support, development, and integration services. The ideal candidate will be both a generalist and a specialist, able to contribute depth in his or her focus areas and also able to support the full gamut of IT services with assistance from our technicians and other specialists. Our firm provides contracted IT services for clients, primarily in the East Bay, who have chosen to outsource all or part of their IT departments. Generally our clients are firms whose primary mission is not technology but who recognize that advanced, integrated, and dependable communication and information systems are key to realizing their primary mission. Through service-level agreements, we allow them to focus on results instead of on managing their own IT staff and infrastructure. This is an ideal position if you are someone who has been the sole technical support person of a small firm or large group and you want to join a team of people who understand and appreciate what you do. Or, if you've been a successful IT consultant and want to continue your client relationships while at the same time having the support of a team to enable you to truly develop and focus your specialist skills. We are primarily focused on small- and medium-sized business and primarily Microsoft-focused. Our services include everything from network design and cabling to website-, database-, and application-development. The trust of our clients is our most protected asset, so we're seeking candidates with great communication skills and an over-developed sense of personal responsibility, who can inspire and continually earn that trust. This is not an entry-level position. You should have prior significant responsibility managing and delivering IT services and be comfortable supervising the work of others. You'll need to be able to both take and give direction and to constantly keep your team up-to-date. Time management, the ability to triage and prioritize, and the ability to recognize and pursue opportunities are all key. These are big shoes, but if you're the right person and have mastered more than one IT niche, you'll recognize these shoes because you're already wearing them! Salary commensurate with skills and experience. To apply: Please send a resume that summarizes your skills and experience and a cover letter describing a) your current technical interests, b) why this job might be a good fit for you, and c) your specific salary requirements to Jobs@babertechnical.com.

The Corporation of the Fine Arts Museums is looking for an experienced and energetic Director of Information Technology, who is passionate about technology and good business processes and committed to the highest level of IT support across complex organizations. This position is in charge of a team of IT professionals and works closely with the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO) to ensure our technology operations function at the highest level and to ensure the implementation of new IT systems is smooth and successful. The incumbent will implement new technical initiatives; streamline, automate, and simplify processes; and educate staff across the organization in the effective use of the technologies and processes. This position will have a profound impact on deploying IT to enhance the museums' international reputation, support its mission, and continually build and improve relationships with multiple constituencies. Primary Responsibilities: Develops and articulates the overall IT strategy consistent with organizational strategy, along with a roadmap for implementation. Oversees evaluation, selection, acquisition, and deployment of solutions. Approves, coordinates, and implements technology projects. Leads the evaluation, selection, implementation, and maintenance of applications. Evaluates systems to measure their success; establishes and reports on appropriate metrics. Analyzes the business requirements of all departments to determine their technology needs and identifies new software solutions that meet the needs of the expanding business. Oversees all technology operations and evaluates them according to established goals. Devises and establishes IT policies and systems to support business initiatives Coordinates the IT, Data Services, and Photo Services staff and provide guidance and mentorship to direct reports. Manages IT operational and capital budgets. Serves as the primary IT contact to software, hardware, and network-related vendors, consultants, and partners. Develops and maintains policies and procedures to protect FAMSF's IT assets, data, and intellectual property; assures compliance with laws and regulations. Develops and maintains business continuity and disaster recovery plans. Develops, maintains, and documents procedures, and provides training to assure continued operation of all museum IT, security, and telecommunications systems following a major disruption such as earthquake, fire, power failure or security breach. Ensures high quality IT department service museum-wide. Ensures timely and satisfactory resolution of all IT issues and concerns. Builds and maintains relationships within the technology industry broadly and IT departments of peer organizations. Minimum Qualifications: Education and Training: Bachelor's Degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent work experience. Work Experience: Minimum of 10 years IT project/program management experience preferably across multiple hardware and software platforms. Minimum 3 years experience leading an IT department. Skills and Abilities: Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to interact as comfortably with senior management and board members as with technical and non-technical staff. Proven vendor and consulting services contract negotiation and management. Must be able to work collaboratively with multiple departments in a positive and constructive manner. Ability to establish and maintain good working relationships with museum leadership, staff, management, donors, peers, and vendors; uses logic and analysis to solve computer and systems problems; and to produce complex reports; manages confidential information. COFAM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination in all phases of employment in accordance with all federal, state, and local laws. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. The Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco are the city's largest public arts institutions and comprise the de Young and the Legion of Honor museums. The de Young, designed by Herzog & de Meuron and located in Golden Gate Park, showcases American art from the 17th through the 21st centuries, international contemporary art, textiles and costumes, and art from the Americas, the Pacific, and Africa. The Legion of Honor displays a collection of over 4,000 years of ancient and European art including Auguste Rodin's The Thinker and houses the Achenbach Foundation for Graphic Arts in a Beaux-Arts style building overlooking Lincoln Park and the Golden Gate Bridge. GitHub is looking for a Project Manager to join our world-class IT organization. This is a critical role and one that will have a large impact on the speed with which GitHub ships great products.

We are looking for someone with a proven track record in leading technical, cross-functional teams in the delivery of complex IT systems and initiatives within established cost, schedule, and performance goals. The ideal candidate will be well versed in agile product development best practices and knowledgeable of the broad range of subjects that fall under IT's purview. The candidate should also be ready and willing to get their hands dirty, not just managing or leading projects, but also pitching in to assist in the work itself.

The Project Manager will partner with internal and external cross-functional teams in design, engineering and product management through the product development lifecycle while managing schedule, cost, scope and quality. They will report on schedule, identified risks and calls to action, while using use data to drive decision-making and process improvements.

Responsibilities:
Drive complex initiatives from conception through successful completion by overseeing the development of an actionable roadmap and ensuring effective execution against the plans for all aspects of the initiative
Create project plans and manage projects to ensure high quality and alignment with stated goals
Partner with functional leadership and business systems leads to manage and execute a portfolio of projects from concept to execution, in a measurable and repeatable manner
Drive measurable and agreed-to business outcomes, using an agile-like approach while effectively working cross functionally in a matrixed environment
Infuse project and program management skills into the organization by mentoring others, sharing business process and best practices, as well as creating and maintaining tools
Work hands-on to ensure projects' success, including scripting, systems implementation and user support
Minimum Qualifications:
5+ years of successfully managing and delivering IT projects in cross-functional work environments
2+ years demonstrable hands on IT experience in areas of OS, Scripting & Networks
2+ years experience managing agile teams and agile practitioners
Versed in Project Management best practices: team building, role/responsibility definition, risk management, work breakdown structures, project tracking, conflict management, etc.
Knowledgeable in a wide range of IT problem areas
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate and drive results and accountability from local and remote teams
Creative self-starter with an ability to devise solutions and drive consensus for complex problems with diverse, sometimes opposing, concerns
Comfortable in rapid development cycles with high aspirations and goals.
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Who We Are:

GitHub is the developer company. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world's most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

Leadership Principles:

Customer Obsessed - Trust by Default - Ship to Learn - Own the Outcome - Growth Mindset - Global Product, Global Team - Anything is Possible - Practice Kindness

Why You Should Join:

At GitHub, we constantly strive to create an environment that allows our employees (Hubbers) to do the best work of their lives. We've designed one of the coolest workspaces in San Francisco (HQ), where many Hubbers work, snack, and create daily. The rest of our Hubbers work remotely around the globe. Check out an updated list of where we can hire here: https://github.com/about/careers/remote

We are also committed to keeping Hubbers healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We've designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place where we truly love working, we think you will too.

GitHub is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate!

Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to ask your Talent Partner.

The IT Sr. Director of Information Technology Security will be responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring a strategic, comprehensive enterprise cybersecurity and IT risk management program. The Sr. Director, IT Security will provide the vision and leadership necessary to manage the risk to the organization and will ensure business alignment, effective governance, system and product availability, integrity and confidentiality. Under their leadership they will be accountable for the companies vulnerability protection, incident response, security operations center, data loss protection create and implement company security policies, controls and procedures. They will establish monitor and track the company’s security posture based on security control measurements.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

Responsible for the corporate security posture ensuring the protection of networks, systems, applications, data and physical security. Lead development of the enterprise wide security program ensuring it is strategically aligned to mitigate current and future security risks. Understand the threat landscape and adjusts the program periodic basis to ensure it addresses the changing security environment. Establish a Security Operations function and provide leadership to security monitoring and incident response of cyber security events. Oversee the investigation of reported security breaches, determine what went wrong in a breach, and plan to avoid repeats of the same crisis. Advises and shares metrics and analysis with business groups to optimize visibility of security risks and mitigation efforts. Manage the information security organization as part of the company security compliance office. Direct and approve the design of security systems. Create, and implement security policies, controls and procedures. Ensure the consistent application of security policies and standards across all technology projects, devices, systems and services. Manage recurring verification of the vendor security risk profile. Ensure compliance with the changing laws and applicable regulations. Ensure IT, applications, network and store infrastructure are designed with best security practices in mind. Deliver new security technology approaches and implement next generation solutions for cloud security, identity and access management, email security, data loss prevention, vulnerability management, and threat intelligence. Develop and implement business continuity plans to ensure service is continuous. Work directly with the business units to facilitate risk assessment and risk management processes. Assist with documentation that supports attestations, RFPs and Risk assessment questionnaires specifically for technology vendors. Manage all teams, employees, contractors and vendors involved in IT security. Provide training and mentoring to security team members. Lead the development and delivery of information security awareness training program.

About Productiv


Productiv is a rapidly growing Series B startup that enables enterprises' IT and Finance teams to take a data- and analytics-centric approach to understanding and driving adoption of SaaS applications at scale. In a modern world where productivity matters more than ever and companies have hundreds of SaaS applications, Productiv's automated, real-time collaborative platform enables not only significant IT productivity gains, but also understanding and driving productivity across the entire organization. CIOs at innovative companies like Square, Equinix, Okta, Fox, Zoom, Dropbox, Conga, and Uber trust Productiv for delivering better employee experience, increasing business agility, and driving RoI from their entire portfolio of SaaS applications.

Backed by Tier 1 investors including Accel, Norwest, and Okta and led by experienced founders from Google, Amazon, and LinkedIn, Productiv is a team like no other. We're a fast-moving results-oriented team with a strong culture that values family, fun, diversity, and mutual respect as much as earning customer love. We tackle the hardest problems and the largest opportunities together, working as a tight-knit highly collaborative team. If you would have leaped at joining Amazon in 1997, Google in 1999, Salesforce in 2001, or Facebook in 2006, this is your chance to have a massive industry-level impact.

Your primary responsibility will be to enhance, optimize, and ensure that our IT systems and operations provide us with a secure and scalable platform, enabling our employees to do their job without friction. You'll be a mighty team of one, building the foundation of our IT infrastructure, then building out the team.

Own Productiv on Productiv - Be customer #1 for all new feature releases, provide product feedback and build strong, empathetic customer relationships

Proven ability to design and communicate clear processes and documentation

Thinking strategically, influencing decisions, and crafting a compelling product vision which strengthen the security posture for IT applications and services

Job Title: Director of Business Systems and IT
Job Description:
Poshmark is looking for the founding member of the business systems and IT team that owns, builds, operates and continuously improves the business systems of Poshmark. Reporting into the SVP of Engineering, you will serve the systems and IT needs of Finance & Accounting, Operations, People operations and the rest of the Poshmark organization.

Responsibilities
Lead the development and operations of internal Business Systems to support the rapid growth of the company
Create the strategic roadmap of business systems buildout and improvements that fit Poshmark's needs
Own ERP systems and their integrations to our production as well as external partner data
Serve as a cross-departmental bridge across the entire organization to create, improve and operate internal systems
Oversee the IT functions of procurement, device management, corporate network, SAAS services management and support for Poshmark employees across all locations
Drive build vs buy and hiring decisions based on the tactical and strategic needs to support the business
Become an advocate for the team by promoting a culture of excellence, knowledge sharing, expanding the team's skill set, and focusing on Poshmark's growth and fun
6-Month Accomplishments
Understand current systems and challenges with a focus on financial systems
Identify key short term and long priorities for business systems
Build business systems roadmap and start executing to it
Deliver 2 to 3 key internal system improvements
Establish trust and create relationships with all their customers
12+ Month Accomplishments
Become an advisor to all key stakeholders. Proactively identify and drive new system and process initiatives
Automate a large portion of accounting reporting and audits
Improve HR and payroll systems to meet the needs of Poshmark
Build out the Business Systems and IT organization to the next level of maturity
Requirements
10+ years of relevant experience implementing and managing business systems with 5+ years in a leadership capacity
Experience in building and scaling up the business systems in a rapid growth company
Proven ability to create and deliver to a roadmap with limited resources
Solid understanding of financial accounting and operational business processes
Experience in maintaining, upgrading and implementing additional human resources, tax and partner data systems that integrate with the core ERP.
Strong project management skills and ability to successfully manage multiple competing priorities and projects
Ability to balance long term strategic priorities with short term tactical needs
Experience with business systems at a publicly traded company and with Sarbanes Oxley implementations is a plus
Experience in Robotic Process Automation and Data Warehouse is highly preferred
Why Poshmark?

Poshmark is a leading social commerce platform for the next generation of retailers and shoppers. Through technology, our mission is to build the world's most connected shopping experience, while empowering people to build thriving retail businesses. Since launching in 2011, Poshmark has become a vibrant social shopping community with seven million Seller Stylists helping 60 million users discover items they love from over 100 million listings. The company is backed by the world's leading investment firms including Mayfield, Menlo Ventures, GGV Capital, Temasek, Inventus Capital, Uncork Capital, Union Grove Venture Partners, Shea Ventures and AngelList. For more information, please visit www.poshmark.com, or find us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and YouTube.

About Us:

At Poshmark, we're constantly challenging the status quo and are looking for innovative and passionate people to help shape the future of Poshmark. We're disrupting the industry by combining social connections with e-commerce through data-driven solutions and the latest technology to optimize our platform. We're nothing without our amazing team who deliver an unparalleled social shopping experience to the millions of people we connect each day.

We built Poshmark around four core values: 1) focus on people to create empowered communities that drive success; 2) together we grow to support each other to strive for our dreams; 3) lead with love to foster genuine connections built upon a foundation of respect; and 4) embrace your weirdness to accept and empower one another on their own unique journey. We're invested in our team and community, working together to build an entirely new way to shop. That way, when we win, we all win together. Come help us build the most connected shopping experience ever.

Here's what we'll set you up with:
A team that is invested in your career growth and training
Competitive salary and equity, based on experience
Company sponsors up to 100% cost for your health, dental and vision plans and up to 90% for your dependents
Work alongside world-class talent
Flexible vacation / paid time off policy
Parental leave
Personal style encouraged (or not, whatever you're in to)
Poshmark is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

The Role

We are looking for an outstanding IT Director with extensive Help Desk and leadership experience. In this role, you will lead our journey of providing world class service, where we put customer service first for all our employees. You will be leading a global team and report to the VP, Information Technology & Operations. This individual will oversee a global multi-site Help Desk support organization.

Your day-to-day
Partner and collaborate with other leaders to identify and implement new tools to increase automation, provide data that will help us to scale
Lead a direct and indirect team across Proofpoints global presence
Create strategic and comprehensive processes to improve and drive outstanding customer service
Lead the transformation from reactive to proactive/predictive
Establish core metrics for the Help Desk function
Develop a robust global 24x7 Help Desk model
Participate as part of the broader Operations leadership team to develop the organizations skills as a whole. Assess employee performance frequently; address underperformance, and recognize and promote the strongest
Partner with our global recruiting staff to expand and strengthen the team, including sourcing and interviewing candidates, participating in conferences/events, and on-boarding new hires
What you bring to the team
8+ years of directly managing an IT organization
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills and executive presence
Strong customer focus with experience building and scaling a world class automated Help Desk function
Ability to proactively identify and resolve technical, process, organizational, and resourcing challenges without frequent escalation or assistance
Extensive experience in hiring and managing a diverse and inclusive team environment with a commitment to collaboration and team building
Technical depth in managing various end user platforms (Windows, Macs, Unix)
Experience with industry-standard operational practices such as change management, incident management, problem management, and vendor management
Experience working in a high-growth environment
If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Vice President of Information Technology*
Reports to: *Michelle Meyer, CFO*

Status: *FT *

Location: *San Francisco, CA*

Exempt/Non-exempt: *Exempt, salaried *
Coyuchi*
Coyuchi makes responsibly sourced organic textiles for the home. We make people feel good, we protect the earth, we care for our partners, employees, and customers. We make homes truly restorative, nurturing places. Places of trust, places of comfort and places of relaxed, luxurious style.

At Coyuchi we are committed to our core ideals; sustainability, highest quality organic and consciously processed fibers, great design and a truly human commitment to everyone who interacts with our product, from artisans to customers. We support organic farming because of its positive impact on farmers and work closely with GOTS to ensure healthier alternatives to conventional practices, thus healthier soil. Healthy soil yields carbon-neutral farms, which help to combat climate change and reduce our carbon footprint. For us, it’s more than a philosophy, it’s what we’re made of.

Coyuchi is a multi-channel retailer with a robust direct-to-customer business with Coyuchi.com and a shop in Point Reyes Station, along with a wholesale business servicing retail stores across the country.
Position overview*
The Vice President of Information Technology will lead and manage Coyuchi’s information technology operations, teaming with executives to evolve the vision, strategies and implementation plans for all facets of information technology for Coyuchi. This role will manage a team of internal as well as partner information technology professionals and work alongside the Management Team to ensure that Coyuchi has the IT framework, infrastructure, applications, and partners to support its strategy.
Primary Responsibilities*
· Partner with department heads (e.g., E-Commerce, Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Business Development, etc.) to evaluate, implement and support the appropriate IT solutions to support Coyuchi's operations;

· Collaborate with client facing leaders to improve their IT capabilities and enhance the value of Coyuchi's deliverables;

· Design and deploy Information Security policy to ensure privacy and data security;

· Enhance and implement a strategy to migrate the appropriate technologies and services from on premise to the cloud, including ERP implementation in the coming year;

· Augment and improve employee collaboration and engagement tools to align with the needs of Coyuchi;

· Ensure the user support team is responsive and knowledgeable;

· Identify and implement IT outsourcing opportunities where appropriate;

· Maintain and upgrade legacy systems to cloud first technologies;

· Adopt an ITSM framework that encourages continuous learning and continuous improvement to build strong operations and technical excellence;

· Develop and implement IT policies and procedures;

· Build strong relationships with employees across Coyuchi's channels and markets;

· Develop an IT team with goals that align with the Coyuchi's growth strategy;
Qualifications*
· Minimum of a bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science or Information Technology

· eCommerce and retail industry experience required

· 15+ years of IT experience with a broad background in IT infrastructure, management and strategy

· 10+ years leading an IT organization

· 5+ years working with Magento or similar eCommerce platform

· 5+ years experience in public cloud infrastructure, architecting and migrating to public cloud, managing and maximizing public cloud and hybrid cloud infrastructure

· 5+ years leading IT projects with a demonstrated history of developing, executing and delivering IT solutions on time and on budget

· Proven success aligning IT solutions with the organization's strategy

· Knowledge and leadership presence necessary to balance the needs of Coyuchi’s business goals with IT solutions

· Success at building high-performing teams

· Excellent interpersonal skills, including the ability to build and maintain effective working relationships

· Outstanding communication and presentation skills

· A highly analytical mind-set with superb problem-solving skills

· A technologist with in-depth knowledge of the current and up-and-coming trends in IT
Expectations*
The Vice President of Information Technology will be passionate about Coyuchi’s potential as a market share leader in the organic home textile industry. She/he must bring strong collaboration skills and develop strong internal and external partnerships in addition to communicating decisively recommendations for business optimization. They will also have the ability to focus on the small details, while maintaining a broad perspective on the overall business strategy.

Thank you for your interest in Coyuchi.

IT Business Analyst/Project Manager*
Job Description*
ACBH IT Department is seeking an IT Business Analyst to provide Project Management and business process implementation to support the IT department. The primary focus will be a project implementation of our Claims processing and EHR application.

\*\*TO APPLY: You must provide a cover letter explaining your interest.
IT Business Analyst/Project Manager*
The IT Business Analyst will help with project management duties such as evaluate, design, monitor and manage the implementation of a billing and claims processing application and an Electronic Health Record system. The IT Business Analyst will ensure that business process outcomes are in harmony with the organization’s strategic goals. The ideal candidate will also focus on the entire process from beginning to end, introducing innovation into the process that can impact results, enhance revenue and assist the organization to meet our business objectives and goals. Other projects will be assigned.

DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: NOTE: The following are the duties performed by employees in this classification. However, employees may perform other related duties at an equivalent level. Not all duties listed are necessarily performed by each individual in the classification.
\*\* MUST HAVE “EXCEPTIONAL” CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS\*\**
IT Business Analyst* *(Local Residence Only) ($35.00 - $40.00/hr. DOE)*
TYPICAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: *
Managing and developing an Electronic Health Billing/Claims Processing and Electronic Health Records system.
Provide assistance with department workflow and user needs utilizing knowledge and experience with financial solutions
Ability to undertake large projects with a focus on the entire process including compliance requirements.
Perform lead functions, including scheduling, task assignment, orientation etc.Advise leadership in the development of strategies for EHR implementation and improvements of workflow processes.
Lead workflow design discussions, building and testing the system and analyzing associated issues.
Provide subject matter expertise to team as needed. Assists management during employee orientation.
Identify issues that arise in assigned application area as well as issues that impact other application teams.
Guide end users in ongoing training during all phases of implementation.
Review the status of deliverables, issues and milestones with leadership.
Serve as a liaison between end users’ workflow needs and implementation staff.
Perform job duties in compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations and company policies.
Experience in managing projects (i.e. mapping, software/process flow, system linkages, etc.) primarily using commercial off-the shelf solutions, both hosted and resident.
Experience with Microsoft Access is highly desirable.
Knowledgeable in SQL, structures of databases and programming languages such as Python, .NET is desirable but not required.
Provide assistance with business, and user needs utilizing knowledge and experience with financial solutions.
Work with resources to ensure that system enhancements follow the appropriate IT guidelines, meet or exceed user requirements and are completed in a timely fashion.
Effectively manage change requests or requests for enhancements.
Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical staff.
Maintain a positive work atmosphere with a culture of respect for others.
Assist in troubleshooting post implementation issues for large/complex projects.
OTHER JOB DUTIES: *
Coordinate and assist user acceptance testing, including reporting and documenting defects.
Ability to identify failure in process and address with IT and the business.
Assist in the development and implementation of quality improvement of processes for IT department and the partnering departments.
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Perform other duties as required.
EXPERIENCE: *
Preferred candidate will possess 1 year of experience as a Business Analyst with a focus in Process/Project Management (required) and a 2 or 4 year degree (desirable) in an IT related field (MIS, computer sciences, IT, engineering)

Local Candidate Only

ACBH does not provide sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g. H-1B).

Job Description:
Who we are and what we do
SurveyMonkey (Nasdaq: SVMK), is a leader in agile software solutions for customer experience, market research, and survey feedback. Our mission is to power the curious and enable organizations, including 98% of the Fortune 500, to transform feedback into action. Our brand is beloved and well known throughout the world—over 6 billion people have taken a SurveyMonkey survey! Today, more than 17 million active users rely on our platform to measure and understand feedback from employees, customers, website and app users, and the market. And our enterprise-grade products and solutions enable 335,000+ organizations globally to solve daily challenges—from delivering better customer experiences to increasing employee retention.

What we're looking for
We are seeking a highly-experienced Vice President, IT Infrastructure & Operations to join our global technology team. Reporting to our CIO, you will power the employee productivity of a fast-growing global workforce and managing the global IT Infrastructure/Operations team. You will work with senior leadership, end-users, and the broad global IT team to help determine the best way possible to meet the technology needs of the company as we scale.

You will
• Improve strategic and operational success for end-user services, network operations, systems administration, enterprise collaboration tools, IT cloud infrastructure and endpoint security operations
• Promote operational excellence: scalable and reliable infrastructure, excellent customer service, efficient and agile operations measured with industry-leading metrics.
• Partner with the security function to ensure compliance standards and processes are met.
• Guide the strategy for the global infrastructure organization in collaboration with the broader IT strategy.
• Develop relationships across the enterprise to ensure their IT infrastructure/operational expectations are met and priorities are set at the appropriate level.
• Lead the planning and execution of essential infrastructure/operational projects within approved budget.
• Build and mentor an outstanding team while fostering a culture of delivering high value solutions and exceptional service.
• Ability to consistently and collaboratively resolve issues, mitigate roadblocks, and meets all financial and management goals.
• Ability to effectively articulate the right message to the right audience from the C-suite to individual team members.

You have
• 15+ years’ experience in information technology, with at least 10+ years of experience managing an IT organization or infrastructure group in a high technology company.
• Excellent change management and project management skills.
• Experience with Cloud Computing, IaaS, and other forms of service-based computing models.
• Experience with M&A due-diligence activity and the integration of acquired businesses.
• Successful career progression in complex organizations (multiple data centers, networks, applications).
• Experience in contract negotiations, vendor management, and capacity planning in a fast growth environment.
• Knowledgeable in compliance and information security.
• Current on business applications, trends in IT and experience evaluating/implementing outsources solutions and service providers.

What we offer our employees
SurveyMonkey is a place where the curious come to grow. By embedding inclusion into our processes, policies, and culture for our 1,000+ employees across North America, Europe, and APAC, we’re building a workplace where people of every background can thrive. We’ve won multiple awards and received recognition for our forward-looking policies, including extended parental and bereavement leave, vendor benefits standards, and Take 4 sabbaticals.
SurveyMonkey was recognized by Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE as a top workplace in 2018 and 2019, and the company has also won numerous awards as a leader in global survey software, including being named among CNBC’s Disruptor 50 and the Forbes Cloud 100.

Our commitment to an inclusive workplace
SurveyMonkey is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities.
Learn more about our diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts here.

We have been engaged to identify an *IT SOX Program Manager *for a strong and stable FinTech company that is committed to build prosperity around the world by providing tools to enable small business and individuals. This organization has received many accolades: Fortune Best Places to Work #11; Future 50 Sustainability Allstars #1; and Forbes World’s Best Employers #33, among others. They rate very highly in areas of diversity and inclusion, pay equity, and social responsibility. This position can be based (post-Covid) in *Mountain View* (SF Bay Area) or *San Diego*, CA.

The company is in the process of building out an IT Audit/SOX function, and this newly created role will report to the Head of IT Audit and oversee execution of the IT SOX program. This will include building relationships with key stakeholders, participation in risk assessment and planning, overseeing execution of plan, and managing both in-house and co-sourced resources. This person will also lead a major re-engineering/rationalization of the IT SOX program.

The ideal candidate will have led IT SOX program end to end for another company. You will also have solid technical skills/understanding, and experience working with engineers in a dynamic Cloud-based, service architecture. Finally, you will have a highly collaborative personality and excellent communication skills.

· *High profile role* – excellent visibility within organization

· *Outstanding Internal Audit Leadership Team*

· *Company scores very highly *for areas like *diversity, pay equity, and corporate responsibility – *ranked #15 on People Magazine’s Companies that Care
_WHAT WILL MAKE YOU A GREAT FIT!_*
· Bachelor’s (ideally in Computer Science, IT/IS, Cybersecurity; Accounting, or related)

· CISA, CISM or CISSP – or equivalent required

· 7+ years progressive experience in IT Audit/IT SOX

· Experience leading IT SOX program for similar company

· Above average technical skills/knowledge, with experience with full-stack engineering, and working with in house Engineering/technology teams – highly desired

· Experience with SDLC/Project Auditing (pre-implementation), highly valued

· Strong IT process, risk, and controls knowledge beyond SOX, preferred

· Fintech or Software Company experience highly preferred

· Experience working with Oracle, cloud services, as well as tools like Argo and Kubernetes, a plus

· Comfortable working in a fast-paced highly dynamic environment

· Strong organizational skills and adept and multitasking and prioritization

· Excellent written and oral communication skills

· Highly collaborative personality; strong team player

Job Description

Position Responsibilities- Other duties may be assigned:
Develops and oversees the implementation of long and short-term strategic and operational plans for software products development and IT infrastructure that align with the organization’s strategic priorities and business needs.

Implement processes and metrics to ensure the software development organization is extremely efficient and focused, and that the products are market ready, highly reliable, scalable, and maintainable that adhere to industry standards for architecture, security and best practices.

Take a hand-on approach to the software development lifecycle to demonstrate ownership and accountability of the entire product delivery process. Communicate proactively, clearly and completely with team members, cross-functional teams, executive committee (EC), and strategic partners to provide product delivery requirements, product roadmap statuses, impediments, and product performance data.

Leverages and transcends the existing IT infrastructure environment to create a new, more modern architecture to support future strategies and evolving needs. This includes the use of cloud technologies, data analytics, process automation technologies, mobility, and next generation cybersecurity tools.

Manages business continuity processes for the organization, including disaster recovery, products high availability, the Business Continuity Plan, and the Business Impact Assessment. Oversees testing, training, and the maintenance of these plans to ensure they are current and properly deployed across the organization, and appropriate in scope to mitigate business continuity risks.

Provides strong technology vendor management to ensure high performance and cost effectiveness with third party solutions.

Leads the evaluation and deployment of new technologies and enhancements to ensure that ALLDATA is prepared for rapid technology advances in the automotive aftermarket industry. Works with the business units to ensure the company leverages the best technology to achieve its business objectives, reduce cost, and reduce employee and customer friction.

Provides inspired leadership needed to develop and retain highly competent, technology and service-oriented teams. Drive culture of continuous improvement to improve quality, efficiencies, and standards across our software development teams, IT infrastructure & services. Provide architectural oversight during the detailed design, build, test, and deploy phases.

Manage Data Science teams to develop algorithms and systems to extract knowledge and insights for automotive market to predict repairs, forecast repairs, merchandizing and store efficiency, total cost of ownership, and tools for internal product usages, sales, and retention.

Work closely with AutoZone IT security, compliance and privacy to set standards, operational processes, and policies that support organization needs.

• Must demonstrate ability to handle diversity among people and environments
