You are collaborative and a creative self-starter who drives for results, works independently and with cross-functional teams, builds strong relationships with key stakeholders, develops innovative sourcing and category management solutions that result in driving competitive advantage and greatest value for The ReaReal.

The RealReal is seeking out a highly-strategic experienced Strategic Sourcing, Technology Category Manager to join our growing team. This is a unique opportunity to build technology sourcing solutions for Technology Hardware, SAAS, InfoSec, Engineering, and Processional services. As part of The RealReal's Sourcing and Procurement organization within Finance, you will be responsible for leading category management, spend analysis, market intelligence and benchmarking, end-to-end Sourcing, contract negotiations, reporting, and vendor management.

What You Get To Do Every Day
Develop strong collaborative relationships with key stakeholders across The RealReal to strategically develop, implement and optimize category, sourcing and vendor management solutions
Manage end-to-end sourcing projects, including planning, RFx development and execution, measurement, and optimization
Drive market intelligence and competitive benchmarking for your category, leverage key cost drivers and total cost of ownership (TCO) to inform strategies
Develop and lead negotiation strategy and execution while ensuring alignment with key stakeholders
Drive continuous improvement strategies within the sourcing dept, category, and supplier agreements
Identify, develop and deploy industry-leading category management and supplier management practices
What You Bring To The Role
5+ years of experience in Consulting, Technology, Supply Chain, Operations, or Strategic Sourcing
BS degree in Business, Supply Chain, Sourcing, Finance, Operations, or Management
MBA/MA, and/or Black Belt in Six Sigma/Continuous improvement preferred
ISM CPSM, or equivalent preferred
International/ global experience a plus
Highly motivated, strategic thinker with proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience driving change, improve end-to-end processes, flourishing in an environment of fast growth and ambiguity
The RealReal is the world's largest online marketplace for authenticated, consigned luxury goods. With a rigorous authentication process overseen by experts, The RealReal provides a safe and reliable platform for consumers to buy and sell their luxury items. We have 150+ in-house gemologists, horologists and brand authenticators who inspect thousands of items each day. As a sustainable company, we give new life to pieces by hundreds of brands, from Gucci to Cartier, supporting the circular economy. We make consigning effortless with free in-home pickup, drop-off service and direct shipping for individual consignors and estates. At our stores in LA, NYC and San Francisco, customers can shop, consign, and meet with our experts. At our 10 Luxury Consignment Offices, four of which are in our retail stores, our expert staff provides free valuations. Founded in 2011 and listed publicly in 2019 (Nasdaq: REAL), we're growing fast and fundamentally changing the way people buy and sell luxury a multi-billion dollar industry. Build your career with us and enjoy 401K matching, health, dental and vision insurance, commuter flex spending, healthcare flex spending, generous PTO, a mother's room, and flexible work hours!

The RealReal is committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or Veteran status. We will consider qualified applicants for a position regardless of arrest or conviction records, consistent with legal requirements.

Ability to organize and deliver presentations in written and verbal formats.

Applicable Certifications

Why Join Us? Be a hero for our rare disease patients Ultragenyx is a commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company committed to developing novel therapies for the treatment of rare and ultra-rare genetic diseases. The company has rapidly built a diverse portfolio of small molecule, monoclonal antibody, mRNA and gene therapy candidates with the potential to address debilitating genetic diseases for which the unmet medical need is high, the biology for treatment is clear, and for which there are typically no approved therapies treating the underlying disease. Developing new treatments for rare genetic diseases is challenging work. It takes courage, talent, and dedication to look past the easy answers and uncover new solutions that can make a meaningful impact. At Ultragenyx we push each other to perform at our very best, because we never lose sight of our mission – to make a difference in our patients’ lives. Come join our team during this exciting time of growth and opportunities! During the COVID-19 Outbreak we are committed to our hiring process. The health and safety of our employees and prospective employees take priority which means at this time our process will include WebEx video discussions, interviews & onboarding. Position Summary: ultraimpact – Make a difference for those who need it most Ultragenyx is seeking a Director IT, Information Security to oversee and manage the Information Security and Privacy programs. This role will provide the vision and leadership necessary to build the Information Security function and manage the risk to the organization, and will ensure business alignment, effective governance, security of Ultragenyx’s information, data integrity and confidentiality. This role is responsible for creation and implementation of the information security and privacy, strategy and roadmaps. It is also responsible for developing, maintaining, and publishing privacy and information security standards, procedures, and guidelines for use within the IT organization. This position reports to the Chief Information Officer (CIO). Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Conduct risk assessments and develop a comprehensive program to manage risk. Establish organization-wide Information Security and Data Privacy strategy, roadmap, policies, procedures, and guidelines. Maintain and implement appropriate security measures and mechanisms to guard against unauthorized access to information and protects against anticipated threats and vulnerabilities. Analyze current security infrastructure and define security solutions to be designed and implemented in order to meet organization requirements. Develop information security and privacy policies and procedures, in compliance with federal, state regulations and international standards. Coordinate with legal department to ensure data protection practices are consistent with domestic and international regulatory requirements. Develop and maintain a governance program that ensures all Information Security controls are adequately maintained and reported. Ensure an appropriate, risk-based approach for Security Incident Response, Remediation and Recovery. Provide management with up to date information on the different threats and security vulnerabilities, that the organization may face and recommend actions. Ensure compliance through adequate security awareness and training programs, and oversight of periodic internal security audits. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or equivalent degree 12+ years of overall information security engineering and technology operations experience. Security+, SSCP, CISSP, CASP or similar certification highly desirable. Demonstrated ability to build and lead the Information Security function. Strong leadership abilities, with a focus on effective prioritization and appropriate sense of urgency. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Knowledge of and experience in developing and documenting security architecture and plans, including strategic, tactical and project plans. Strong knowledge of networks, operating systems, cryptography, preventive, and detective security solutions. Strong analytical skills to analyze security requirements and relate them to appropriate security controls. Experience in system technology security testing (vulnerability scanning and penetration testing). Ability to identify needs, take initiative and prioritize work efforts — balancing operational tasks with longer-term strategic security efforts. CIOs at innovative companies like Square, Equinix, Okta, Fox, Zoom, Dropbox, Conga, and Uber trust Productiv for delivering better employee experience, increasing business agility, and driving RoI from their entire portfolio of SaaS applications. We're a fast-moving results-oriented team with a strong culture that values family, fun, diversity, and mutual respect as much as earning customer love. We tackle the hardest problems and the largest opportunities together, working as a tight-knit highly collaborative team. Work with the team to establish best practices and build processes to ensure prompt execution of support tickets Asset Management: Hardware Procurement, Provisioning, Deployment Operational Analytics: Build reporting and dashboards to measure IT effectiveness Champion, role model, and embed Productiv's culture as we scale globally and across new offices Own Productiv on Productiv - Be customer #1 for all new feature releases, provide product feedback and build strong, empathetic customer relationships Required Skills and Experience 4+ years in an IT Client Platform or SaaS Engineering role with 24x7 responsibility Passion for operational excellence and measurable ability to deliver continuous improvement Expertise in networking, infrastructure management, information security patterns, integrating systems, operating and consuming cloud applications Strong project management skills ability to collaborate across teams and deliver Proven ability to design and communicate clear processes and documentation Detail-oriented, adaptive, flexible approach to problem solving Impeccable discretion when handling sensitive and confidential information Excellent self-management and interpersonal skills Positive, tenacious attitude while delivering on complex and challenging projects BA / BS with a technical degree preferred Preferred Experience: Scaling companies from tens to hundreds of employees in a fast-paced startup environment. Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

As a member of the IT Change Management and Adoption team at Splunk, you will help develop and lead change management programs to ensure we realize successful outcomes on our key strategic initiatives.

In this role, you will lead change management of a program within our portfolio to support large scale IT initiatives. You will also be accountable for designing and managing dynamic change and enablement programs, acting as a trusted advisor to our business partners, and working to ensure program adoption goals are met.

We are looking for a fun, hardworking, and creative Change Manager that possesses broad knowledge and expertise in change management and organizational behavior frameworks, communication strategies, adoption tracking, enablement practices, execution capabilities, and training design.

If you have deep knowledge in Organizational Change Management in a fast-paced cloud environment and are passionate about bringing that expertise into Splunk, then this role is for you. Do what you love, alongside Splunkers who are just as passionate as you are! If you want to see the impact of your work and be an integral piece of our growing IT Change Management and Adoption team, what are you waiting for? Apply today.

What You'll Be Doing:
Craft and implement change management frameworks (process, tools and techniques) to “engineer” the people-side of change processes
Develop change management programs and roadmaps to ensure adoption
Lead the development of a communications framework, strategy, and operating rhythm for communicating with all internal stakeholders including, but not limited to, executive staff, senior management, project teams, business unit partners and employees
Perform and evaluate change readiness assessments
Identity and evaluate potential change resistance and develop/execute mitigation tactics
Define adoption success metrics for the change before the program starts and measure against post the program ends
Develop partner engagement and management plans, including handling a feedback loop to identify gaps and introduce plans to address and mitigate issues
Build relationships and deliver results for diverse audiences including Sales, Marketing, Finance, Legal, Information Security, Products Organization, etc.
Develop approaches and strategies for training and leading the enablement plan and delivery
Partner closely with IT Program Management to ensure tight interlock to their deliverables and the change plan
Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified:
Good understanding of change management principles, methodologies, tools and best practices

Founded in 1982, Lighthouse Worldwide Solutions is the world’s leading supplier of real time contamination monitoring systems and airborne particle counters. Driven by the passion for elevating the science and utility of genetic testing, Natera is committed to helping families identify and manage genetic diseases. Natera is a rapidly-growing diagnostics company with proprietary bioinformatics and molecular technology for analyzing DNA. Our complex technology has been proven clinically and commercially in the prenatal testing space and we are actively researching its applications in the liquid biopsy space for developing products with oncology applications.

The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, youll work hard and grow quickly. Essential Duties
Is responsible for the functionality, integrity and service delivery of all network/servers/platform administration for Tech CU’s headquarters and branches.
Maintains internal controls and security measures to ensure prudent information security consistent with operating objectives.
Oversees, monitors and troubleshoots wide area network (WAN) and local area network (LAN) components including MPLS, VPN, SDLAN, access controls, and associated routing.
Is responsible for day-to-day operations and uptime of cloud systems, on-site equipment, and on-site data center, including all network, servers, power, cooling, and other infrastructure.
Manages change and incident resolution processes including communication to business owners and employees as needed.
Ensures development of documentation, policies and procedures as appropriate for the function.
Monitors inventory and maintenance of all managed systems.
Contributes to preparation, maintenance and testing of business continuity and disaster recovery plan for all equipment and servers running in the Tech CU data center.
Ensures Tech CU’s network, server, and DevOps services are meeting the needs of the organization.
Provides monthly metrics and progress reports to management regarding systems operations.
Promotes a positive image of Tech CU within the companies in the technology community.
Coordinates with the business on project requirements, solutions, and deliverables.
Supervisory Functions
Establishes scope of authority, schedule and responsibility for direct reports.
Engages with direct reports and peers to align goals with organizational goals and objectives, establish performance metrics, provide feedback and develop talent.
Manages and monitors budget to maximize operating efficiencies.
Reviews and responds to issues identified in audit and regulatory reports.
Supports established policy and procedures, recommending changes as needed.
Work Schedule
Full-time; typically 40+ hours/week
Flexible within core business hours, M-F
Occasional early morning, late evening, or weekend hours, typically scheduled
Workplace Essentials
Supports Tech CU’s Mission and Vision and consistently demonstrates Tech CU’s Values (Accelerate, Collaborate, Innovate and Cultivate).
Meets with manager on a regular basis to discuss goal alignment, performance metrics, and development plans.
Complies with Tech CU policies and procedures.
Upholds employee Code of Conduct and Business Ethics and ensures confidentiality of the workplace.
Complies with requirements imposed by federal, state and local regulatory agencies.
Adheres to internal control and security measures designed to ensure regulatory compliance and mitigate losses and errors.

Certifications: CCNA/CCNP/CCNE, MCSA/MCSE certifications highly desirable.
Experience:

Albertsons Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers with 2,300+ stores. The Albertsons Companies family of brands includes some of the most prominent brands in food retailing, with a growing base of loyal shoppers. Thanks to the professionalism, diversity, spirit, and friendliness of our people, we have locations across the U.S.

The Digital IT Department has an opening for an IT Director, Customer Service. This position is located in Pleasanton, California.

Position Purpose

Help to build Albertsons Digital Fulfillment and Customer service platforms and deliver on a multi-year roadmap that delivers new and improved Customer Service solutions. Albertson's Companies is looking for people who are interested in re-imagining the grocery experience by harnessing the power of digital technologies. The IT Director will work closely with Product, Agency, Business, UX, Data teams and more to define and govern the platform solution.

Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Take part in design and development of digital capabilities and business opportunities within IT Fulfillment to enable different ways of fulfillment of Online Grocery orders
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand business requirements, identifying solution gaps and available capabilities, and defining solutions to meet the business need
Translates business domain understanding and context to technical capabilities for technical architects and development teams
Defining data and integration architectures to support partnership with external vendor driven projects and own the detail integration patterns for integrating various Albertsons teams, APIs, and data properties
Work closely with a Product management, Architecture, Data Engineering, Quality Engineering, and Information Security groups to define and deliver the overall solution including contributing to roadmap of backlog of priorities
Continuous partnership with cross functional teams, including vendor partners, to ensure all solutions are being developed with continuity of the enterprise solution ecosystem, while meeting all security, data governance, legal, risk and compliance standards
Collaborate with Enterprise & Data Architecture teams to shape EA guardrails, standards, and patterns
Ensure quality guidelines and control process are created and implemented for the technology platforms and products working with engineering teams
Well-organized, detail oriented, has great communication skills and thrives in a fast-paced environment.
Flexibility and ability to work collaboratively within matrices, 'virtual' and flat environments.
Qualifications:
10+ years of experience in designing and developing backend order management and fulfillment technology solutions / platforms
Experience gained in a Senior Management role, leading, or mentoring small to medium teams, able to guide them, review their work, drive best practice
Experience in ability to work on vaguely defined requirements and ability to create a roadmap for solution with very less direction and detail
Experienced in delivering automation marketing projects, collaborating with distributed global teams in a matrix/flat organization and working alongside the project management.
Experienced in catalog systems, check out systems, fulfillment systems and other eCommerce offerings gained through both package and system implementations.
Experience with platforms using Microservices is a huge differentiator for this role as it requires clear understanding of how eCommerce works in Albertsons banners
An excellent communicator - for building relationships, managing stakeholders, working with clients and delivery teams - both orally and written and for technical and non-technical audiences.
Significant understanding of and experience in best practices around systems integration, security, performance, and data management.
Must have prior experience in building and defining solution requirements across Grocery eCommerce platforms including exposure to Instacart, Shipt and Google Shopping experiences
Excellent listening, presentation, and written and verbal communication skills
Effective time management skills; ability to prioritize, delegate and meet deadlines
How to Apply: Interested candidates are encouraged to submit a resume by visiting https://www.albertsonscompanies.com/careers/en/home.html

Job Title: Senior IT Change Manager
Duration: 6 months
Location: Remote through SIP (San Jose/Greater Bay area preferred)

Description:
Change managers will help us shape how we execute effectively! You will be the process authority for a number of change management initiatives taking place within Client.
Client is looking for a talented individual that can help us grow and scale. We are looking for
someone who has experience in managing change advisory boards, architectural review boards and running multiple change initiatives across the organization. The change manager will play a key role in ensuring projects (change initiatives) meet objectives on time and on budget by increasing employee adoption and usage. This person will focus on the people side of change, including changes to business processes, systems and technology.

Essential Duties
Change Management:
Manages planning and execution for change management projects using various processes
Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities
Apply a change management process and tools to create a strategy to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative.
Assess change impacts
Identify, analyze and prepare risk mitigation tactics
Identify and manage anticipated resistance
Manage stakeholders

Adoption:
Gather and report on adoption metrics for IT services
Prepare, adjust and compare adoption methodologies for IT services to get most ROI for services

Communications:
Support and execute against communication efforts
Excellent presentation skills
Strong in expressing ideas using Google Slides

Project / Program Management:
Create, maintain and report on project plans for seamless execution
Consult and coach project teams
Coordinate efforts with other specialists
Track and report issues
Requirements
Bachelor''s degree with 6 + years of experience as a project manager managing moderate to complex change initiatives.
5+ years of experience as a Change Manager
Familiar with a change management methodology.

Nice to Have
Experience in using Google Slides, Sheets and Docs
Experience with JIRA and Confluence
Experience using ProSci/ADKAR (Change management methodology)
Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Professional or PMI Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP)

Ashland Community and Technical College, located in Northeastern Kentucky, invites applications for the Director of Technology Solutions. At ACTC, we are more than buildings and programs: we are a community where students find confidence, collaboration, compassion and success. We are looking for an innovative, collaborative, proven leader to join our team. Duties: Leadership Duties and Skills • Provide vision and leadership for development of the ACTC Technology Plan by emphasizing consistency and standard delivery of services to support the administrative, academic, and operational needs of the college. • Supervise and oversee the activities and monitor the effectiveness of all college information technology staff including Help-Desk management, performance evaluations and development of performance improvement measures. • Manage Ashland IT security with support from KCTCS, including providing technical expertise to leadership in the event of a Security Breach and working with KCTCS Technology Solutions and Legal Counsel in investigations of potential violations of policy or law. • Represent Ashland on the KCTCS Peer Team including attending monthly meetings and working closely with system personnel by providing input and participating with various networking projects and other initiatives of the System Office. • Ensure service levels are being adequately met by routinely meeting with KCTCS system personnel, vendors, and third-party service providers. • Provide input in training of faculty/staff/students about new technologies. • Serve as a permanent member on college committees. Management Duties and Skills • Coordinate with technology vendors and System Office personnel to ensure procurement procedures are followed such as managing copier contracts and purchasing of technology and software. • Manage, track, evaluate and reorder/cancel enterprise software licenses of various providers. • Manage information technology resources and budget by development, evaluation, testing, purchasing, installing and maintaining computer systems while justifying expenditures. • Coordinate the setup, configuration, and repair of all computer systems Technical Duties and Skills • Design, purchase, install, monitor, and maintain local area network (LAN) and wide area network (WAN) equipment and resources, as well as servers. • Develop and maintain technical standards for the college. • Manage and aid in maintaining data network. • Manage and aid in installation and maintenance of servers. • Support Security and Surveillance technology. • Keep up to date with Safety Notification Alert Process (SNAP) and train users as needed. • Manage and oversee information technology security by administering Active Directory (AD) accounts, creating group policies and scripts, manage antivirus, computer management and network admissions control (NAC) applications • Be proficient in System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) for the purpose of deploying operating systems and applications to the college computers. Qualifications: The successful applicant will have previous supervisory and leadership experience with an in-depth knowledge of industry standards. Must have excellent communication skills, strong problem-solving skills and experience with budget management. Knowledge of Cisco networking and Microsoft servers is required. A bachelor’s degree and a minimum of five years of related experience. Prefer an applicant with a master’s degree and higher education experience. Experience with PowerShell and Microsoft or Cisco certifications are a plus. Description


Relation is among the fastest-growing insurance brokers in the U.S. We work together to bring new products, capabilities and ideas to our clients, while preserving the local relationships and expertise that our clients have come to expect. Our employees and our clients are our top priorities…our success is built upon both and we take that seriously. We offer a competitive compensation package (including benefits), a collaborative team environment and growth opportunities.

We are looking for brilliant minds to come join us in a fast-paced, exciting work environment where having fun while working hard is part of our core values. Our culture encourages personal growth, and success. Are you a team player who enjoys challenging work? Do you believe the client always comes first? Come claim your future with a growing company that can help you be your best. Build a lasting connection with Relation!

POSITION SUMMARY

The Director of Infrastructure & Security is responsible for all aspects of planning, managing, and securing corporate and business-unit IT operations and infrastructure. The Director of Infrastructure & Security oversees all network, application, security, system administration, telecommunications, help desk, infrastructure and data center operations.

A GLIMPSE INTO THE POSITION

• Directs IT project management activities centered around infrastructure, operations, and security.

• As key liaison to the Relation acquisition team, manages and executes the infrastructure components of Relation’s IT projects related to onboarding and integrating newly acquired offices/personnel.

• Manages daily IT infrastructure operations to ensure high availability, including job, event log, and data center monitoring.

• Oversees incident resolution, ensuring they are resolved efficiently while working across functions, and providing strategic input to ensure any underlying issues are fully remediated.

• Directs and trains Technical Support Analysts and Infrastructure personnel to improve the standards and procedures for handling issues accurately and expeditiously.

• Communicates up and out on all IT issues. Keeps all levels of management informed on progress.

• Promotes a culture of collaboration, accountability, innovation, and excellent customer service within the department.

• Works with IT and executive leadership to establish a strategy for ensuring a stable, secure, and cost-effective infrastructure in alignment with, and in support of, the overall IT and corporate strategies.

• Contributes to the development, implementation, and management of operational plans supporting the IT strategy.

• Ensures effective recruitment, development, performance, and retention of qualified, enthusiastic, and motivated team members.

• Provides leadership and oversight to the hiring, growth, motivation, and development of a highly skilled technology team.

• Manages and carries out established departmental budgets and goals.

• Manages vendor relationships.

• Collaborates with IT and leadership to design data and telecommunication solutions to meet business challenges and requirements.

• Ensures compliance with regulatory requirements related to ERISA standards (HIPAA, COBRA, PII, etc.).

• Builds strong relationships with peers and senior management to best meet Company goals and objectives.

• Provides input, support, and hands-on leadership for server, storage, network, and telecom infrastructure-related tasks.

• Designs and manages server, storage, network, and telecom environments and ensure high service levels are achieved.

• Manages all internal and offsite data centers.

Requirements


SKILLS

• Experience in developing security architecture with progressive leadership roles in technology and security with a collaborative management style and significant executive presence.

• Experience in integration of company-wide systems

• Experience leading strategic decisions of technology, definition, and implementation of software products

• Significant, hands-on experience managing all facts of infrastructure and security technologies including systems, networks, databases, firewalls, IDS, and IPS.

• In-depth knowledge in information security and assurance program management with experience in risk, audit, and compliance management leveraging framework. Ability to effectively communicate these programs to internal and external clients.

• Experience leading the strategic decisions of technology, definition, and implementation of software products.

• Experience partnering with product development based upon industry trends and needs.

• Superior analytical skills and excellent writing and presentation skills.

• Strong communication and team management skills with proven success in motivating, mentoring, and creating an environment that attracts the very best talent.

• Strong, visionary leader and strategic business partner with a passion for technology and customer service.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS

• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field; or equivalent work experience.

• 10+ years in information technology and proven expertise in online security methodologies and practices with other certifications and credentials key to this position.

Location: San Francisco Bay Area
Job Description

The Director of Information Technology Operations (Director of IT Operations) is responsible for providing the vision and leadership for a business unit to develop, maintain and enhance infrastructure and align it with business strategies, imperatives and core values. This position has both strategic and functional management responsibility for all aspects of IT's network infrastructure, business applications, operations, web application development and production and telecommunications within the functional area. Specific areas of management will include: analytics, network services and management, desktop hardware and software support, systems development and support, platform architecture, database management, IT/business design and support, systems security, IT training, quality assurance, disaster recovery, business continuity, and communications systems and tool.

Desired Skills & Experience
A minimum of 8 years of progressively increasing responsibility in an IT and IT Operations capacity
A minimum of 8 years of experience managing technical teams to support desktop, network, project, server and telecommunications staff
A minimum of 8 years of related IT experience including: Unix, Linux, Wintel server, LAN/WAN, and storage, backup and security technologies
BA or BS in computer science, information systems or related field
Master's degree or higher in computer science, information systems or related field preferred
Research and/or health care experience preferred
Proven multi-disciplinary leadership capability preferred
Senior leadership experience partnering with executive levels preferred
Essential Functions
Partnering with Executive Leadership to develop and define the technology strategy.
Strategically align technology plans with business unit and KP's national and regional strategies
Identifying and implementing technology solutions to meet current and future IT needs.
Directing the preparation of source documents and technical manuals and enforcing the use of established and documented IT processes, tools, and best practices
Developing/implementing effective resource capacity planning and demand management.
Developing, tracking and managing annual IT staffing, purchasing and operations and capital budgets.
Ensuring that the following IT controls are in place:
General security-physical, infrastructure, network, and application
Business continuity and disaster recovery-procedures and infrastructure in place and frequently tested
Release management and version control
Change management
Service agreement contract management
Licensing agreement management and compliance
HIPAA privacy and security compliance
Creating appropriate measurement, reporting and monitoring metrics that provide guidance for process improvement and/or training opportunities for internal staff
Managing, mentoring, motivating and developing a team of IT professionals, including completing and delivering performance evaluations and facilitating necessary training

GENERAL PURPOSE:

The Sr. Manager, Store Systems will manage the Stores applications portfolio (POS, Returns, Payment Applications), through implementation of projects, support as well as liaison with Business customers and internal cross functional IT teams. He/she will lead evaluation, selection, and implementation of solutions to meet business needs in the 5 Year plan. This is a highly visible role with IT executives and directly interfaces with the Business community.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

• Lead, develop and mentor the team
• Influence strategic direction for Stores front end technologies and roadmap
• Consult with senior business leadership to align demand with broader strategic IT initiatives

• Project Delivery: Ensure

o Detailed project plans are created, covering the entire systems development life cycle, and associated project budgets
o Requirements are defined accurately
o Systems are designed/coded or purchased that meet the defined requirements, and that execute efficiently
o Test plans and training plans are designed and executed successfully
o Determine a deployment and change management plan in partnership with the Business team
o Projects are completed on time and under budget and that anticipated business benefits are achieved.
• Must be able to quickly establish credibility at all levels of the organization including senior-level business executives
• Manage budget, resources and schedules across multiple projects, internal and system integrator staff. Coordinate with other programs and ITs horizontal services
• Identify, manage and communicate issues, risks and dependencies to project stakeholders and sponsors
• Help maintain and evolve the IT applications roadmap and drive strategic recommendations

COMPETENCIES:

• Developing Effective Teams
• Developing Direct Reports and Others
• Technical Competence / Expertise in Store Systems
• Communications
• Motivating Others
• Conflict Management
• Decision Quality
• Organizational Agility

QUALIFICATIONS AND SPECIAL SKILLS REQUIRED:

• At least 10 years experience managing and supporting IT systems, processes or capabilities within a Fortune 500 or similar IT environment
• Bachelors Degree or equivalent years of experience
• At least 5 years experience implementing large scale store projects including but not limited to areas such as POS, Returns, Payment Applications, etc. in a program management capacity
• Experience managing teams over 20 FTEs, including subcontractors and offshore resources
• Demonstrated ability to anticipate and handle critical situation, negotiating solutions and resolving conflicts with customers, IT partners and vendors
• Demonstrated ability to execute basic financial analysis, such as estimating, managing cash flow and ROI
• Ability to manage program budgets of $10M
• Demonstrated ability to manage staff remotely, across multiple time zones
• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, and able to work effectively with VP and above executives
• Leadership skills: able to influence others to the desired outcome, supervise and inspire team members
• Some travel may be required

Company Description

Who We Are

Twitter is a growing organization that faces new challenges as it evolves. The IT Asset Management (ITAM) team is responsible for lifecycle management of all IT hardware, software, and service agreements. ITAM responsibilities encompass purchasing, deployment, in-service tracking, and EOL procedures of all goods and services within IT. Additionally, The ITAM team will assume responsibility of managing outsourced and managed service partnerships related to asset lifecycle within IT End User Services (EUS) and IT Infrastructure. Our mission is to keep our business running effectively while maintaining a healthy, compliant IT asset environment.

Job Description

What You’ll Do

This is a unique opportunity to grow and manage a team of purchasing, inventory, and operational specialists. You will drive the vision and roadmap of our Asset Management team, overseeing tooling, process, and measurement. You will partner with IT engineering teams, product managers, and IT leadership to own our global service lifecycle. You will lead a team to build programs, manage to meet scale, and oversee the general budget process for the IT business.

Qualifications

Who You Are

To continually strengthen our growing team, we are looking for an experienced IT Asset Management leader. You are knowledgeable in budget management, understanding how to differentiate between opex and capex, while connecting these financials to variable lifecycles in our Fixed Asset registry. You are a team focused people manager who knows how to manage across customer areas to support critical partnerships. You are operationally minded, while possessing a strategic vision.

If this sounds like you, you probably have experience with the responsibilities of this role :

Drive the roadmap & day-to-day operations of the IT Asset Management Team, partnering to oversee logistics across multiple IT teams around the globe

Ensure IT hardware inventory is sufficient to complete daily operations

Partner with the Head of IT EUS to build & define the hardware provisioning and deployment program

Develop and maintain relationships with regional IT Leaders and key IT equipment vendors

Manage & plan the ITAM systems roadmap in partnership with the Enterprise Services Engineering team within IT Applications

Develop new processes to increase productivity while driving for automation everywhere

Physically receive and store IT assets while managing storage requirements in partnership with the Real Estate & Workplace team

Deliver required inventory to IT departments and locations, overseeing shipping and receiving needs

Develop and oversee measurement of the IT Asset Lifecycle and related IT services

Develop and manage the IT Service Catalog

Document and refine IT equipment inventory processes

Requirements

5+ years experience directly managing IT assets in an Enterprise environment

3+ years experience managing a team of IT professionals

Knowledge and experience with MacOS and standard desktop application licensing, purchasing systems, Atlassian Tools, physical system installation and configuration, basic networking

Excellent attention to detail and process discipline

Self-motivated and ability to work in a fast-paced environment

Excellent verbal & written communication skills

Additional Information

Summary of Position: *The IT Senior Manager is a senior leadership role which is responsible for the hardware, system software, operating systems, connectivity, security and networks in multiple locations. This role will have strong understanding of business systems applications and infrastructure support to lead the development and execution of our IT strategy. This candidate will be a key contributor to the architecture, enhancement and maintenance of all IT systems, supporting internal business processes, ensure compliance and will work cross functionally with all of GC Farms business partners – Finance, Operations, Sales, HR and Engineering along with identifying and eliminating security risks. This position reports to the CEO and will have direct interaction with the company’s Owners to provide expertise and input on strategy and major initiatives. This role will lead IT capabilities to scale the company through growth.
Job Specific Duties & Responsibilities: *
· Manages staff, contractors, third parties, cloud services providers, and vendors that perform installations, configuration, testing, monitoring, maintenance and who support the infrastructure

· Comprehensive understanding of networks, databases and storage systems. Maintains the network’s integrity and security

· Defines information technology and systems infrastructure strategy, architecture and processes

· Maintains all information technology activities, operations including systems analysis, programming, data security, computer and auxiliary operations

· Manage the migration and integration of equipment, software and systems to support a food processing operation

· Supports Finance, Operations, Sales, HR and Engineering departments through the development and management of information systems that will provide quantitative data and reports

· Generates and manages budgets for IT operations and projects. Advises company on future IT solutions

· Leads IT and IS projects, including design and deployment of new systems and services

· Monitors performance of IT systems to determine cost and productivity levels and to make recommendations for improving infrastructure

· Provides leadership through effective mentoring and on-going performance feedback to staff

· Oversees all technology operations (e.g. network security) and evaluate them according to established goals

· Develops and establish IT policies and systems to support the implementation of strategies set by leadership team

· Evaluates the business requirements of all departments to determine their technology needs

· Purchases efficient and cost-effective technological equipment and software

· Oversees the use of technological equipment and software to ensure functionality and efficiency

· Identifies the need for upgrades, configurations or new systems and report to executive team

· Build partnerships with vendors and negotiate cost-efficient contracts

· Travel as required to multiple locations
Qualifications: *
· Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field

· 10+ years of progressive experience in IT infrastructure/system administration or managerial role

· Prior experience managing third party vendors

· Developing and managing an annual operating and capital expenditure budget to ensure it is consistent with the overall IT strategy and is within plan

· Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, influence, and communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization, to both technical and non-technical audiences.

· Outstanding leadership and cross-functional team building skills

· Experience in analysis, implementation, and evaluation of IT systems and specifications

· Sound understanding of computer systems (hardware/software), networks, and cloud based services

· Able to lead teams through considerable change, by inspiring confidence and achieving results, able to problem-solve quickly and effectively when faced with difficult and complex issues

· Capable to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously and provide clear direction

· Well versed with MRP and ERP systems, compute and storage

· Experience with SAP

Job Description An industry-leading tech company At Zendesk, we geek out about building software that delivers the ultimate customer experience. Your favorite brands (AirBnb, Lyft, Slack, OpenTable) leverage our products to engage you as a customer and we lead the industry with beautifully simple software. We’re constantly innovating. Seriously, we can’t wait to outdo ourselves in the near future, and we apply this philosophy to all prioritized initiatives. What you’ll do As a Program Manager for our CIO organization, you will work with leaders from IT, People and Places, Legal, etc. to drive cross functional programs for our IT teams. This is a new role leading delivery of key technical programs, which engage a wide cross section of internal and external constituent groups including Legal, Procurement, Workplace Experience, and People Operations. You will work closely with the Zendesk IT leadership and staff to drive strategic priorities and programs and bring structure to program definition, requirements gathering, design, implementation and, ultimately, operational excellence. You will work with cross-functional teams to drive goals and objectives for each strategic program and then execute effectively and efficiently, providing transparency and visibility to all involved teams and levels of management. Zendesk’s CIO Team is a friendly, global group that manages functions as diverse as Global Security Desk, Identity Access Management, Enterprise-Wide Applications, People and Places, Legal, Sales and Marketing, Finance, and Data and Analytics. Our goal is to build trustworthy products and keep our customer’s data secure. Live and breathe these words: Streamline, communicate, fill gaps, facilitate, and negotiate. An Inclusive team We value diversity of opinions and experiences. We have an international organization of Program Managers, Business Operations consultants, and M&A leaders who have backgrounds in tech, healthcare, criminal justice, org development, and more. They’re brilliant, supportive, and collaborative. We help each other out with best practices, tips, and strategies for success. From day one your input will be valued, your skills leveraged, and your personal style celebrated. You’ll report to Dana, who will partner and collaborate with you to provide guidance, feedback, and support. She’s not into micromanagement, so expect independence in your work, and be willing to share and strategize about program issues, risks, and challenges together. She’ll help you explore career growth options and paint a picture of what success looks like for you at Zendesk. What you need to succeed We’ve found that a bachelor’s degree and 3+ years experience in a fast-paced SaaS environment is the most common recipe for success in the Program Manager role at Zendesk. We value experience across a range of disciplines for this role that is supported by a strong foundation of program management best practices. In addition to a solid background in both Agile and traditional delivery methodologies, you also have experience working with the Atlasssian (JIRA, Confluence) tool set. You have a proven track record for driving large-scale, complex programs across organizations, with extremely strong collaboration, planning and prioritization skills. You are familiar with supporting an IT team, bonus if you have worked with internal facing applications management! You are exceptionally organized and a master in collaboration and prioritization. You are able to get to the heart of and mobilize the right people to solve it. In addition, you are known for being a facilitator of efficient and productive meetings that people look forward to attending! A supportive company Zendesk embraces and invests in the power of Program Management & Business Operations, all the way up to the execs. You’ll hear Adrian, our President of Products, regularly talk about the level of discipline and efficiency that we bring to a growing organization, and Colleen, our CIO, talk about us as a critical execution engine, powering the successful achievement of our most complex business goals. Our team is deeply embedded in what Zendesk does and how we get there. Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth. More than 150,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America. Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities. Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

JOB SUMMARY

Provide leadership and guidance to project teams consisting of business and IT professionals who are engaged in planning and implementing solutions that are projects of all sizes and complexities. Mentoring Project Management subordinates is an essential responsibility of this role to ensure that the team is maturing their project skills and capabilities.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Ensure project scope and costs are agreed upon by the stakeholders
Coordinate business requirements gathering, documentation and stakeholder approval
Prepare project plan(s) and implementation schedule(s): ensure the project plan includes all stakeholder requirements and the nine areas of knowledge from Project Management Body of Knowledge®
Conduct internal and vendor inquiries pertaining to the development of technology or information systems to meet current and projected business needs
Coordination of RFI/RFPs with third parties, project and internal IT procurement team
Provide regular report updates to all stakeholders and project sponsors, including status updates, milestone information and risk and issue information
Active problem solving: recognize potential problem areas against the plan and identifies and implements alternative solutions
Serve as escalation point for project risks and issues
Provide guidance on team activity through leadership and support towards goals
Work independently projects of any size, with an ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Master the ability to influence teams without direct authority
Recommend, prepare and conduct training
Manage change control processes and is responsible for overall project execution
Maintain a good working relationship with customers and vendors
Ensure 100% adherence to all IT and department policy, processes and procedures.
Other duties may be assigned
General responsibilities include the following:
Participate in the exchange of ideas and information within the IT department and with our business partners
Ask questions; encourage input from team members
Identify creative ways to reduce cost by streamlining processes and systems (i.e. modification of responsibilities or consolidation of tasks, elimination of non-value added processes, or complete re-engineering of processes and systems).
Demonstrate a commitment to customer service; anticipate, meet and exceed expectations by solving problems quickly and effectively; making customer issues a priority
Confer with reporting manager on complex or unusual situations
Effectively identify and address project-related conflicts
Ability to work effectively under pressure with constantly changing priorities and deadlines
Understand and embrace the business and IT strategic direction
To be dependable and conscientious in all work performed
Exchange knowledge and information with other Jabil facilities to ensure best practices are shared throughout the Jabil organization
Ensure 100% adherence to all company policies and procedures (i.e. Health, Safety and Quality)
Maintain discretion and confidentiality in all areas pertaining to IT systems, data and proprietary information, whether internal to Jabil or customer specific
MANAGEMENT & SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
Typically reports to Management. Direct supervisor job title(s) typically include: IT Manager, Sr Manager IT, Sr Manager Site IT, Director IT
Job is NOT directly responsible for managing other employees (e.g., hiring/termination and/or pay decisions, performance management).
JOB QUALIFICATIONS

KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS

Must demonstrate mastery on the following skills/competencies:
Accountability – Accounts for his/her activities, accepts responsibility for them, and to discloses the results in a transparent manner
Action/Results Oriented - Brings full energy to things he/she sees as challenging; enjoys working hard; can act with a minimum of planning; seizes more opportunities than others
Business acumen - Knows how the business works; demonstrates knowledge in current and possible future policies, practices, trends, technology, and information affecting his/her business and organization; knows the competition; understands how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace
Organizational change management – Is familiar with the processes to transitioning individuals, teams, and organizations to a desired future state
Business Relationship Management – Practices building strong relationships with business, operations, and other IT groups.
Detail oriented - Has an eye for details and makes a conscious effort to understand the actual cause behind an occurrence.
Emotional intelligence - Has the ability to monitor his/her own and other people's emotions, to discriminate between different emotions and label them appropriately, and to use emotional information to guide thinking and behavior
Managerial courage - Doesn't hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and "actionable" positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation (not including direct reports) quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary
Mentoring - Assists other persons in developing specific skills and knowledge that will enhance the less-experienced person’s professional and personal growth
Negotiating and conflict management - Successfully mediates conflict between individuals and groups; can hammer out tough agreements and settle disputes equitably; can find common ground and obtain cooperation with minimum noise
Presentation Skills - Is effective in a variety of formal presentation settings: one-on-one, small and large groups, with peers, direct reports, and bosses
Sense of urgency - Acts with the realization that efficiency is vital to success, and makes decisions and drives activities in the organization to meet important windows of opportunity
Analytical skills - Has the ability to visualize, articulate, and solve both complex and uncomplicated problems and concepts and make decisions that are sensible and based on available information
Business results orientation - Understands the process of figuring out how to get the right requirements, no matter the challenges faced, and stays resolutely focused on the core principles of gaining alignment and achieving clarity. Ensures that the project and efforts are consistently focused on delivering value for the organization
Business/process analysis; Business needs into technical solutions - Identifies business needs and determines solutions to business problems. Utilizes the set of tasks and techniques used to work as a liaison among stakeholders in order to understand the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals
Communication skills - Is able to convey information to another effectively and efficiently
Creativity - Adds value and original thinking during brainstorming settings; generates new and unique ideas; makes connections among previously unrelated notions,
Decision making (problem solving) - Is able to forecast the outcome of each option, and based on all these items, determine which option is the best for that particular situation
Learning agility - Has the ability to learn, grow, and change over time and consequently develop new skills, rather than simply enhance those that he/she may already have
Organizational awareness - A level of understanding for both the organization and its leaders regarding current capacity, abilities, potential, and results
Prioritization - Spends his or her time and the time of others on what's important; focuses on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal.
Relationship management - Builds strong relationships with peers, providers and customers (internal or external).
Teamwork - Works collaboratively with a group of people in order to achieve a goal
PMP Certification – Is certified by the Project Management Institute (PMI) as Project Management Professional (PMP).
Facilitation and training skills - Guides and directs organizing work with groups of people such as meetings, planning sessions, and training of team members and leaders
Project Management methodologies – Displays and applies knowledge on Project Management methodologies, specifically on Waterfall and Agile
Resources management - Efficiently and effectively deploys and allocates the organization's resources when and where they are needed
Project planning - Estimates and schedules projects activities using Gant charts to plan and subsequently report progress within the project environment
Post-Implementation Reviews - Conducts PIRs after completing a project in order to evaluate whether the project objectives were met, determine how effectively the project was run, learn lessons for the future, and ensure that the organization gets the greatest possible benefit from the project
Cost estimations - Has the knowledge to calculate the cost of a program, project, or operation accurately, transparently, and reliably
Controls, audit, regulatory and compliance requirements - Understands the concepts and processes implemented to compare performance to predetermined standards, plans, or objectives (includes Security, ITAR, MedVal, Health, Safety, Quality, etc.).
Building WBS -– Can develop a deliverable-oriented decomposition of a project into smaller components, and organizes the team's work into manageable sections
Project Portfolio Management tools – Has experience using PPM tools to analyze and manage current or proposed projects
Must demonstrate self-sufficiency on the following skills/competencies:
Consulting/thought leader – Is recognized as one of the foremost authorities in selected areas of specialization, resulting in being the go-to individual for said expertise
Innovative thinking – Thinks outside the box to come up with interesting, different or creative ideas and/or solutions
Organizational agility – Is knowledgeable about how organizations work; gets things done both through formal and informal channels; understands the origin and reasoning behind key policies, practices, and procedures; understands cultures of organizations
Leading and influencing/talent management - Is committed to recruit, retain, and develop the most talented and superior employees available in the job market
Industry collaboration/networking - A working practice whereby individuals work together to a common purpose to achieve business benefit
ITIL Foundations - Is aware of the key elements, concepts and terminology used in the ITIL Service Lifecycle, including the linkages between Lifecycle stages, the processes used and their contribution to Service Management practices
Forecast, budget, variance and financial management - Efficiently and effectively manages money (funds) in such a manner as to accomplish the objectives of the organization. Includes CapEx and OpEx.
Risk and issues management - Understands the process of identification, analysis, assessment, control, and avoidance, minimization, or elimination of unacceptable risks and/or issues
Developing business cases - Captures the reasoning for initiating a project or task to convince a decision maker to take action. Usually a well-structured, formal document, the business case tells the story of an initiative - from beginning (what problem or situation triggered the initiative) to end (what benefit, value or return is expected). Business cases are typically written at the project or initiative level as a way to secure funding and commitment
Procurement process - Understands the process of finding, acquiring, buying goods, services or works from an external source, often via competitive bidding process (RFI, RFP, RFQ)
KPAs, metrics and SLA tracking - Understands and applies the tools and techniques to define, measure and control the performance of the project
Preferred skills/competencies:
Scrum Master / Agile certification
Working knowledge of Lean/Six Sigma concepts
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree required; degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Business discipline preferred.
Minimum 8 years of experience actively leading IT projects of medium size and/or scope with complex matrixed teams.
PMI's Project Management Professional (PMP)® certification or equivalent is highly preferred.
Or an equivalent combination of education, training or experience.

The Global Information Technology Directors help us iterate the internal project management platform we’ve created, which we call Compass. Compass tracks each of our branches, and each of the projects we complete annually. It allows us to centrally store the client engagement contracts, track engagement progress, collect and analyse consultant and client feedback, and centrally invoice clients who have offered a contribution. It also allows us to ensure minimum standards of branch governance.

Working as a Global IT Director for 180 Degrees offers an opportunity to write code that will enable us to grow and serve thousands more clients and students each year. We welcome applications from anyone with a proficiency in PHP looking to gain experience in a live environment working for a good cause. A level of training and guidance will be facilitated for those who need it.

Time Required
This role is voluntary, with a significant degree of flexibility in how and where you allocate time during the week
You must be able to commit to 5-8 hours per week, including fortnightly team meeting and a monthly GLT-wide meeting
You must be able to commit for a duration of at least 12 months
Key Responsibilities
Work as part of a IT team to (a) consolidate the existing code base, (b) plan, develop and roll out functionality improvements, and (c) improve the user experience
Liaise with the finance, consulting, operations and business development teams on desired functionality, and generate a rational development plan for these improvements based on our organizational strategy and priorities
Desired Characteristics
The ideal candidate will be a full stack developer with 1-2 years experience in a professional environment
Proficiency with PHP, or a willingness to learn it quickly, is essential
This position may suit a recent CS graduate looking for work experience
The ideal candidate will live in Sydney, but anyone with high levels of self-motivation and a willingness to work independently in a virtual environment towards shared goals and deadlines will be considered
High levels of time management and personal organization is essential

Company DescriptionSquare builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.Job Description

As the Head of IT Logistics, you will help envision the future of Square's internal IT procurement, asset management and supply chain functions. You will partner with different team members to assess our needs, financials and the technology vendor market to determine the best options and sources of supply for the IT organization. You will partner with senior leadership within the Business Technology, Finance, Legal and Square's larger indirect procurement organization to balance cost, risk and speed, and ensure that the business can work towards its goals.

You will:
Determine technology sourcing strategies for IT products, services, and digital platforms in consideration of our goals and priorities.
Work with the business and several partners such as Legal, People Ops, and Finance to design and implement a new hire-to-retire process from an IT logistics perspective (annual forecasting, budgeting, proactive ordering, and license management).
Look for areas where automation can provide a better user experience and reduce manual workflows and related errors.
Partner with Square's indirect procurement team to run strategic price negotiations with suppliers to ensure regulatory compliance and favorable contract terms.
Create programs that review our hardware/software/services spend on an ongoing basis and ensure that Square is getting the best possible deal.
Create a vendor service management practice that uses tools such such as vendor scorecards, service reviews, and QBRs to understand and improve vendor relationships.
Develop a global supply chain network to ensure that we can reliably procure and ship IT equipment to Squares wherever they work in the world.
Develop a high-performant IT logistics team. Set clear goals and directions, and provide regular feedback on staff performance.
Stay informed about industry trends that have an impact on IT strategy.
Qualifications
12+ years of relevant experience leading an IT Logistics, Procurement or Supply Chain organization.
6+ years of people leadership experience.
Experience collaborating with technical and non technical team members.
Experience with influencing strategy decisions resulting in a win-win for both suppliers and the business.
An ability to distill complex issues into solvable and applicable tasks.
A passion for pushing boundaries and questioning the status quo.
Additional InformationAt Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Perks

At Square, we want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:
Healthcare coverage
Retirement Plans
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Wellness perks

Learning and Development resources

Job Title: Senior Manager, IT & Bus Apps PMO Center of Excellence
Job Description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey! As a Senior Manager within the IT PMO, you will lead the centralized PMO Center of Excellence Team in developing and implementing processes and policies that enable the broader PMO and IT organization which includes IT Operations, Data Technologies and Business Applications to efficiently and effectively lead complex, cross-functional projects and programs that meet organizational goals and objectives. In this highly visible role, you will work with other department leaders to define, prioritize their needs, and develop a centralized process for Splunk projects that can be consistently applied across multiple portfolios. This includes insight into all projects in the PMO to leverage opportunities, optimize shared resources across projects, and manage methodologies and metrics. Ensuring standardization, reducing duplication and utilizing your team, technology, and communication in an efficient manner will also be required. We are looking for a dedicated and passionate leader who has an appreciation for simplification and increasing the ease of conducting business. You are known for rolling up your sleeves to co-create and deliver high-quality solutions with business and technical teams in a manner that is as evolving and as fast-paced as the rest of the organization. You are considered a visionary. You are able to visualize end-to-end processes that make the most sense, identify problem areas from a distance, and proactively recommend measures to solve them. With an eye for improving operational efficiency and team velocity, you make decisions in a consultative and cooperative manner. You use these skills to measure performance and surface insights into future improvements. Does this sound like an opportunity that has the right dose of challenge and excitement? If so, apply today. What You'll Be Doing: Define and deploy IT PMO process improvements that enhance and streamline planning and management of programs and projects that will impact the IT Operations, Data Technologies and Business Applications teams Establish program management governance policies and practices, conduct regular reviews such that key projects are tracking to defined objectives and key performance indicators, maintain stakeholder alignment, and proactively manage risk to quality and schedule performance Identify and solve for evolving gaps and emerging needs in skills, process and tool capabilities, and capacity to support sustained long-term business growth thereby achieving a greater level of maturity as a PMO organization Design and implement balanced scorecards/dashboards to report on portfolio health, projects, vendors and financials. Translate benchmarking results and new/best practices to the IT organization Partner with other PMO’s across Splunk, to ensure alignment on organizational priorities and visibility into necessary portfolios Lead teams to achieve the organizational vision through Agile portfolio management, including lean principles, constantly assessing the value stream and planning on a rolling basis Build relationships with senior leadership and key PMO stakeholders, and act as a trusted advisor. Align IT leaders on PMO responsibilities and establish accountability for standardized processes, reporting, and governance across IT Build and drive adoption of our project, program and portfolio methodology and toolset Develop an intake/strategy and prioritization framework to ensure we are solving the right problems, in the right order, and that drive the most impact Develop a world-class COE Team that exhibits hallmarks such as effective and powerful communication, a fail-fast mindset and gratitude towards one another. Build and execute on a robust talent development plan Manage complex projects with a goal of litmus-testing COE’s processes and best practices, as well as to identify areas that might cause overhead to a PM. Project management activities would include the development of business cases, charters, and budget management, reporting and retrospectives Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified: 5+ years experience leading Agile transformation and Agile portfolio management across enterprise, well versed in talent, tools, governance models, project/financial planning and reporting required for execution 10+ years designing and leading IT PMO processes and tool adoption, technology strategic planning and budgeting spanning the entire organization, portfolio management using various methodologies 10+ years of experience building new operating models, leading change across the enterprise of talent, processes and technologies Deep understanding of current and emerging project, program and portfolio management best practices and how other fast-growth enterprises are employing them to drive digital and data business Demonstrated ability in building IT balanced scorecards, KPI management, and operational reporting A distinctive blend of business, IT, financial and communication skills Preferred knowledge and experience Minimum of 15 years of relevant experience with a bachelor’s degree; or 12 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 8 years’ experience; or equivalent experience Expertise in one or more project management methodologies, preferably PMI and Agile Experience working alongside executive staff to achieve organizational goals Experience collaborating with IT Operations, Data Technologies and Business Applications stakeholders Strong validated experience with leadership, business insight, problem solving, critical thinking, project management, and analytical skills Six Sigma background, a plus Education: Got it! Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or equivalent years of industry experience. What We Offer You: Wow, I want that. A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies. A set of extraordinarily hardworking, innovative, open, fun and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support. Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation. A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment. We don't expect people to work 12-hour days. We want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and dedication and believe that balance helps cultivate an extraordinary environment This isn’t a job – it’s a life changer – are you ready? Splunk has been named one of San Francisco Bay Area’s “Best Places to Work” by the San Francisco Business Times, ten years in a row. We offer a highly competitive compensation package and a plethora of benefits. We value diversity at our company. You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
