Job Title: IT Director, Communications and Change Management
Job Description:
Overview

In IT, we’re on a journey to reimagine and transform the role of IT within Cisco. We see communications and change management as key components to enabling our success.

The IT Communication team is focused, agile, innovative, and fun. We use data and storytelling to inspire our teams and communicate our company vision and strategy to internal and external audiences.

What You'll Do

This highly visible role will see you responsible for the Communications and Change Management strategy for the global IT organization as well as being the Executive Communications Manager for the CIO. You will also be managing a team responsible for content, blogs, PR and overall communications needs for the Senior Leadership team in IT.

You will be responsible for developing an organization-wide reputation, communication strategy and messaging hierarchy for the IT business, content and messaging for internal and external audiences for the CIO as well as working very closely with the communications communities across other Cisco functions to ensure alignment and best practices.

Key audiences include customers, internal and external stakeholders and employees.

Your team will be responsible for preparing executive briefings for customer and partner meetings, content and messaging for internal and external events, as well as content for social media, blogs, online web presence and media assets.

Who You'll Work With

As part of the IT team, you will work closely with the CIO, the IT Chief of Staff, Communications leads and Executives across IT and Operations, as well as other partners across the company.

Key Priorities
Develop a communications strategy for the CIO and clearly articulate the mission, objectives, and value of the organization
Work cross-functionally with global team leads to integrate corporate communication activities and events
Manage a direct and virtual team of Communications professionals
Research and develop new creative communications channels for both internal and external messaging driving innovation to the science of communications
Research relevant statistics, data and compelling content for use in messaging development
Lead and evaluate all incoming speaking opportunities as part of the overall Communications plan
Demonstrated and consistent excellence in communications with the ability to adjust in the moment to exceed the expectations of the leadership team, customers, stakeholders and employees
Who You Are
An accomplished strategic communications professional with 10+ years of experience in Communications
Experience in successfully managing creative and impactful messaging, with the ability to make even the most complex story relatable and easy to consume
Someone who is able to build relationships at all levels of the organization with the ability to manage and influence a direct and virtual team
Have the ability to understand a strategy and drive the necessary communications to ensure its success
Experienced in advising and working directly with senior executives, are a strong collaborator and have the ability to partner globally
Someone who is curious, innovative and digital-savvy, with vast experience in message creation and storytelling
Someone who likes a challenge and is willing to give their point of view, whilst offering ideas and solutions
A talented and empathetic people manager and leader
You demonstrate an ability to work across multiple communications as well as a strong urge to learn and share your knowledge of the business
Be willing to take risks
You love working in a fast-paced environment, self-motivated and can thrive under pressure
Someone who has a sense of humor
Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an expansive future for all.

We adopt digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job Title: IT Director, Communications and Change Management
Job Description:
Overview

In IT, we’re on a journey to reimagine and transform the role of IT within Cisco. We see communications and change management as key components to enabling our success.

The IT Communication team is focused, agile, innovative, and fun. We use data and storytelling to inspire our teams and communicate our company vision and strategy to internal and external audiences.

What You'll Do

This highly visible role will see you responsible for the Communications and Change Management strategy for the global IT organization as well as being the Executive Communications Manager for the CIO. You will also be managing a team responsible for content, blogs, PR and overall communications needs for the Senior Leadership team in IT.

You will be responsible for developing an organization-wide reputation, communication strategy and messaging hierarchy for the IT business, content and messaging for internal and external audiences for the CIO as well as working very closely with the communications communities across other Cisco functions to ensure alignment and best practices.

Key audiences include customers, internal and external stakeholders and employees.

Your team will be responsible for preparing executive briefings for customer and partner meetings, content and messaging for internal and external events, as well as content for social media, blogs, online web presence and media assets.

Who You'll Work With

As part of the IT team, you will work closely with the CIO, the IT Chief of Staff, Communications leads and Executives across IT and Operations, as well as other partners across the company.

Key Priorities
Develop a communications strategy for the CIO and clearly articulate the mission, objectives, and value of the organization
Work cross-functionally with global team leads to integrate corporate communication activities and events
Manage a direct and virtual team of Communications professionals
Research and develop new creative communications channels for both internal and external messaging driving innovation to the science of communications
Research relevant statistics, data and compelling content for use in messaging development
Lead and evaluate all incoming speaking opportunities as part of the overall Communications plan
Demonstrated and consistent excellence in communications with the ability to adjust in the moment to exceed the expectations of the leadership team, customers, stakeholders and employees
Who You Are
An accomplished strategic communications professional with 10+ years of experience in Communications
Experience in successfully managing creative and impactful messaging, with the ability to make even the most complex story relatable and easy to consume
Someone who is able to build relationships at all levels of the organization with the ability to manage and influence a direct and virtual team
Have the ability to understand a strategy and drive the necessary communications to ensure its success
Experienced in advising and working directly with senior executives, are a strong collaborator and have the ability to partner globally
Someone who is curious, innovative and digital-savvy, with vast experience in message creation and storytelling
Someone who likes a challenge and is willing to give their point of view, whilst offering ideas and solutions
A talented and empathetic people manager and leader
You demonstrate an ability to work across multiple communications as well as a strong urge to learn and share your knowledge of the business
Be willing to take risks
You love working in a fast-paced environment, self-motivated and can thrive under pressure
Someone who has a sense of humor
Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an expansive future for all.

We adopt digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

GEM20

Job Title: Senior Business Operations and Strategy Manager (IT Markets)
Job Description:
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role


The Business Operations & Strategy (“BizOps”) team is passionate about getting results for the company through performance management, operational cadence, planning and critical initiatives with an IT Ops and the DevOps buying center lens for our GTM organization.

As the Senior Business Operations and Strategy Manager (IT Markets), you will report to the Sr. Director of Biz Ops and partner with the VPs/Business Leaders for IT Ops and DevOps and their matrix leadership team to develop and execute strategies that drive growth and improvements in the business. Projects include formulating strategic priorities and operational plans, conducting market and customer research to drive new opportunities for growth and expansion, tracking and deriving insights from metrics, uncovering customer and competitive insights, and influencing long and mid-term roadmap investments.

In this role, you will seek highly sophisticated problems, gain insight into the strategic and operational issues which are forefront in the minds of the leadership team, have exposure to senior-level decision-making and have the chance to create relationships with people across the entire company.

You have a strong product and marketing background and excel in all areas of strategy development and execution including: project management, business analysis, problem solving, executive communication, consensus building, and people development.

Responsibilities
You will drive highly visible projects for Splunk; Work cross-functionally to structure problems, analyze opportunities, and work towards solutions and impactful recommendations and results
You will help with driving the operational cadence for the group, measure and supervise critical initiatives, and assist in the preparation of content for Executive Staff, Quarterly Business Reviews and Board Meetings
You will provide insights to the business through analytics and market research as required (e.g. market, customer, competitive)
You will develop strategic and business cases working with cross-functional teams outlining business opportunity, rationale, and execution plans to achieve the vision for the opportunity including product, GTM strategies, and business model
You will uncover areas within the business to drive performance improvements to unlock productivity and increase successful execution
You will work with cross-functional teams (product, development, marketing, sales, alliances, corp dev) to conduct build vs buy vs partner analyses to execute on growth opportunities
Requirements
8+ years experience (or 6+ if post MBA) with a mix of strategy, business operations in a technology company, and top-tier consulting firm / corporate strategy field with strong exposure to technology
Experience driving large initiatives from framing the problem, conducting research / analysis to building the business and plans through to driving execution to success is required
People development and influencing skills; able to build and drive extended and virtual teams
Proficient experience with analytics and financial skills to work on sophisticated business issues with minimum supervision
Experience in working directly with APM and monitoring products and in delivering a new product into market is a plus
Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related area; Master of Business Administration degree preferred
We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Job Title: IT Business Relationship Manager, Finance Systems
Job Description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 107,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries

The IT Business Relationship Manager will be responsible for working closely with Abbott Diabetes Care (ADC) Finance business partners and serve as the liaison between business partners and shared services delivery teams to ensure that business needs and requirements are being addressed across Plan, Build, and Run areas. Responsible for IT Capital and Expense financial projections, planning, and oversight of IT systems. Responsible for identifying technology solutions to meet evolving business needs with an excellent understanding of the application and technology lifecycle management. Candidate should be aware of the evolution of technologies and consider regulations relevant to the business area.

WHAT YOULL DO

Strategic Thinking
Building and maintaining expertise on the IT portfolio for Abbott Diabetes Care globally. Proactively analyze business processes; elicit, analyze, and document business requirements; identify alternative solutions, assesses feasibility and make recommendations typically seeking to exploit and leverage new or existing IT technology components
Champion change and innovation. Stimulate creativity, innovation and open to new ideas.
Constant awareness of corporate IT standards, technology trends, evolving regulatory requirements and their applicability to the business process and IT portfolio, and influence the IT stakeholders and partners in addressing them in the most efficient way
Manage collaboration and partnership with Corporate IT Services including Plan/Build/Run teams
Business Acumen
Understand the business and ensure IT solutions meet the needs of the business
Understand the specific challenges and opportunities linked to the regulatory, legal and economic situation across countries and business units.
Consulting
Consult senior leadership on IT systems lifecycle, tools and solutions. Recommend solutions assuring alignment with organization direction, vision and priorities. Where needed, involve area or functional BRM and IT business consultants, as well as external expertise.
Develop, propose and implement innovative solutions to improve business outcomes in support of business strategies.
Relationship Management

Partner and collaborate with key IT staff and other Abbott divisions to support cross divisional business initiatives, and explore IT synergies and efficiencies

Project Management

Good understanding of project management process, best practices and documentation. Experience with both Agile and Waterfall methodologies

People Skills

Responsible for maintaining healthy and conflict-free relationship between the business customer and the IT delivery teams. Responsible for creating and ensuring a productive, collaborative and friendly team environment.

Compliance

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional policies and procedures. Operate with broad goals and objectives. Has direct impact on capital budget, expenses and project completion

Decision Making

Make strategic decisions that impact Business and IT. Shared decision authority for IT budget and project activities. Manage initiatives that span multiple virtual teams across the world and different cultures

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOULL BRING

Minimum Education & Qualifications

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or another discipline relevant for the healthcare industry or equivalent experience. A minimum of 7-10 years of IT experience in large or mid-size multinational organization including experience in IT systems and technology lifecycle management. IT expertise in one or more disciplines, like systems development, infrastructure, change management, vendor management, etc.

Preferred Qualifications/Experience
Strong experience in engaging with Finance business environment and solid understanding of ERP, accounting/finance systems, and planning/forecasting solutions
Experience managing accounting / finance process improvement
Experience in developing and implementing applications in an FDA/GXP environment
Experience with GxP validation and large-scale IT implementations (e.g. SAP, ERP, CRM, QSM, Model N, etc.)
Pharma/Medical Device commercial, development, and manufacturing business process knowledge, as related to IT
Technology Lifecycle Management, Product Life Cycle Management and Document Management
Strong organizational skills including program/project governance
Strong interdisciplinary, intercultural and networking skills
Strong influence and negotiating skills
Experience leading teams - both with direct staff and indirect project teams
WHAT WE OFFER

At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer:
Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance
Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans
Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs
Paid time off
401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match
The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities
Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

525 Market St, San Francisco, CA

Company Description:

Who We Are

At Twitter our IT Enterprise Applications team focuses on implementing and supporting applications to help our internal customers meet their operational needs. We are responsible for establishing processes for continual improvement, guiding administration, and partnering with multiple stakeholders on a project-to-project basis. Our mission is to keep our business running effectively while maintaining a healthy application environment.

Job Description:

What Youll Do

To continually strengthen our growing team, we are looking for an experienced business intelligence manager with a background in project based work and data development. You will partner with business and engineering teams to build roadmaps, and consistently deliver excellent results against time-sensitive priorities. You have practiced interpersonal communication skills, have experience managing teams, possess a broad range of database related experience, are team-oriented, and you thrive in a fast paced environment.

Genesys is looking for an experienced, highly driven IT director to lead Sales and Customer Success applications portfolios.This is a unique position which requires deep functional knowledge and expertise coupled with the ability to creatively and effectively solve problems. You will lead a team of business analysts/product managers and partner with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams to deliver on enterprise-wide large initiatives. Analyze current state needs and challenges, identify improvement and automation opportunities, portfolio planning, capability maturity assessment, and tools rationalization.

Responsibilities will include business engagement, lead project delivery, provide functional expertise in identifying, evaluating and implementing processes and procedures to help solve complex business problems.

Profile:
As an IT director of Sales and Customer Success business functions, you will have an exciting opportunity to shape and deliver Go-to Market strategy to help enterprise scale and transform.
Mange global team of self-driven business analysts/product managers to support sales and customer success portfolio.
Work with business leaders, stakeholders and cross-functional teams to deliver across portfolio of large enterprise wide initiatives.
Strong blend of business sense and process knowledge: You evaluate things holistically and think through the objectives, impacts, best practices, and what will be simple and scalable.
High-energy, company first, positive attitude: Passionate and motivated to make a massive impact and work hard in a fast-paced environment.
Creative, innovative and design thinking to enable and improve business processes through new or enhanced processes and tools.
Multi-tasking prioritization expertise: Experience (and preferably an enjoyment of) balancing numerous different priorities and demands.
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to effectively collaborate with a diverse group of people.
Ability to effectively prioritize across portfolio and manage tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science or similar technical area, MBA is a plus.
12+ years of experience in leading sales and customer success IT applications organizations.
Expert level functional understanding of capabilities across GTM Strategy & Planning (forecasting, quota & comp), Sales Execution (CPQ & Billing), Partner Lifecycle management, Issue to resolution, Customer Experience.
Strong expertise in business process management, technology architecture and building roadmaps across large portfolios.
Established track record of building rapport with Senior business leaders.
Deep understanding of Salesforce platform, CPQ, and billing.
Expert in collecting information from multiple sources and integrating the information to find creative ways to meet the business' needs.
Successful track record of leading and delivering large multi-million-dollar enterprise wide initiatives.


About Genesys

Every year, Genesys® delivers more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in over 100 countries. Through the power of the cloud and AI, our technology connects every customer moment across marketing, sales and service on any channel, while also improving employee experiences. Genesys pioneered Experience as a ServiceSM so organizations of any size can provide true personalization at scale, interact with empathy, and foster customer trust and loyalty. This is enabled by Genesys CloudTM, an all-in-one solution and the world’s leading public cloud contact center platform, designed for rapid innovation, scalability and flexibility. Visit www.genesys.com.

Job Title: Senior Director - Infrastructure, Networking and Foundation IT
Job Description:
Company Overview


Riverbed enables organizations to maximize performance and visibility for networks and applications, so they can overcome complexity and fully capitalize on their digital and cloud investments. The Riverbed Network and Application Performance Platform enables organizations to visualize, optimize, remediate and accelerate the performance of any network for any application. The platform addresses performance and visibility holistically with best-in-class WAN optimization, network performance management (NPM), application acceleration (including Office 365, SaaS, client and cloud acceleration), and enterprise-grade SD-WAN. Riverbed’s 30,000+ customers include 99% of the Fortune 100.

About this Position


Title: Senior Director - Infrastructure, Networking and Foundation IT

Location: United States

The Sr. Director, IT Infrastructure is a high-level management position focusing on the architecture, engineering, and operation of all IT infrastructure at Riverbed including but not limited to voice and data networks, on-premise and cloud based application platforms, and incident management across the global enterprise. The Senior Director is responsible for bridging the tactical and strategic objectives of the organization with the daily IT activities.

In addition to the architecture, engineering, and operation of all technology platforms and infrastructure, Senior Director, IT Infrastructure is responsible for establishing and executing IT Service Management (ITSM) and Enterprise Architecture best practices. The Senior Director, IT Infrastructure directly supervises the leaders for network, systems engineering, IT operations, platform engineering/ops and sets their goals, evaluates their performance and ensuring results. The Senior Director must also effectively interface with leadership throughout Riverbed and form tight working relationships. This role is key to the overall success of the company.

The Senior Director, IT Infrastructure is also responsible for managing the purchasing of new IT systems and managing relationships with outside vendors that sell IT products and services to Riverbed. This includes evaluating the needs of new hardware and software systems, determining possible solutions, verifying solutions meet our needs and assisting in the purchase of those solutions. The Senior Director then manages the implementation and support of those systems. The Senior Director must work with other Riverbed leaders to resolve issues and problems that arise in the field.

Finally, the Senior Director, IT Infrastructure helps the CIO/CDO set the long-term strategic direction for the IT needs of the company. Together they take the strategic direction and formulate policies and procedures that support that direction. The Senior Director is responsible for creating a large portion of the policy and procedure documentation.

Responsibilities:
Transition Riverbed infrastructure to cloud based infrastructure based on SaaS-first guiding principle
Establishes a technology roadmap and vision for technology infrastructure at Riverbed
Drive hosting consolidation and transition to cloud based hosting
Moving distributed hosting networks to cloud based hosting frameworks
Continually improves the talent level and competencies of the IT Infrastructure department
Acquisition integration and due diligence as needed
Establishing SLAs with technology partners and vendors
Directs and manages the network, systems, and IT operations teams which provide the core IT services for Riverbed.
Acts as a mentor to his direct reports
Creates and reviews monthly reports that are provided to the CIO/CDO
Works with senior management to develop and facilitate the IT strategy and services for the company.
Helps to develop long-term plans and sets the tactical direction for the IT infrastructure needs of the company.
Creates and reviews all policies and procedures for IT infrastructure group as well as any other company policies and procedures that pertain to it.
Manages the IT operational and CAPEX budgets for the group
Works closely with the information security team to ensure compliance with all security requirements including HIPAA & SOX regulations as well as the HITRUST framework.
Manages the IT portion of all audits, both internal and external. Works with Internal Audit to ensure effective compliance testing.
Helps the organization find, review, purchase and implement new IT systems.
Manages the vendor relationships with all IT suppliers
Qualifications:
B.S. or B.A. in Computer Science, Information Technology, MIS or other related business field.
A minimum of fifteen years of experience in information technology.
A minimum of ten years of prior management experience in information technology with a broad range of experience in various technology areas.
Experience with global service provider networking
Extensive experience in storage
Cloud based infrastructure expertise such as AWS or Azure
Awareness and understanding of security best practices: NIST, DLP, SOX and SOC compliance
Experience with vendor management
Financial acumen in terms of budgeting and expense management
Proven ability to recruit, retain, and motivate highly skilled technical teams
Understands technology at a detailed level but can express concepts simply to non-technical colleagues
Ability to inspire teams to achieve goals and exceed expectations
Strong technical skills especially in the technologies in use at the company.
Must have strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively and equally with technical people as well as executives
About Riverbed


Riverbed offers a rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry that are changing the world through cutting edge technology and applications. We are proud of our great culture that continuously fosters innovation, collaboration, and diverse work environments. We remain committed to attracting, developing, and retaining the most diverse group of talent to better serve our customers.

Learn more about Riverbed:

www.riverbed.com

@LifeAtRiverbed

Riverbed is proud to be an affirmative action (AA) and equal employment opportunities (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd, one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms. We’ve never been a typical professional services firm. We put people first, and that is what sets us apart.

As one of the fastest-growing professional services firms in the world, Grant Thornton LLP is continuously seeking top talent. Be supported in your professional growth and recognized for your contributions.

Audit - IT Assurance Manager

POSITION SUMMARY

An IT Assurance Manager is responsible for overseeing all phases of an IT audit in support of a financial statement opinion and engagement management for multiple clients in a wide variety of industries. Responsibilities include planning, directing, and managing resources to complete IT general control audits while maintaining quality with firm and professional standards. The IT Assurance Manager works closely with IT partners, IT staff, and core audit team members, playing a key role in client management. Responsibilities also include participation in the sales process, including responding to RFPs, developing proposals, and participating in oral presentations. Team engagement, recruiting, and training efforts are required to grow a healthy, sustainable practice.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Understand and manage firm risk on IT audits and proposals.
Adhere to the highest degree of professional standards and strict client confidentiality.
Think strategically about practice enhancements and be able to implement and manage change.
Engagement management (including scoping, task delegation, project scheduling, managing budget, quality review, and client management) in support of IT financial statement audits on multiple, simultaneous engagements.
Review operational, financial, and technology processes to provide management with an individual assessment of risk, internal control, and the overall effectiveness and efficiency of the process as well as the risks associated with Sarbanes Oxley as it pertains to internal controls over financial reporting.
Handle day-to-day practice and client administrative matters (performance reviews, staffing, budget-to-actual monitoring, etc.)
Meet or exceed IT Assurance metrics (e.g. – billable hours, managed hours, time delinquencies, sales, etc…)
Maintain a good working relationship with clients and work effectively with client management and staff at all levels to gather information, perform services, and cross-sell firm services as opportunities arise.
Work closely with other Grant Thornton team members and partners to promptly identify and resolve client problems or issues
Communicate (verbally and in writing) externally with clients and internally with all levels of the organization to successfully accomplish objectives portraying knowledge and confidence
Recruit, manage, develop, train, coach and mentor staff on projects and assess performance for engagement and year-end reviews
Motivate others to perform at maximum efficiency without sacrificing quality of the services delivered
Interview campus and/or experienced candidates
Manage business development activities, such as proposals, capture, account teams, whitepapers, conferences, and/or other thought leadership material
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Information Technology, MIS or related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
6 - 10 years of related work experience in a similar consulting practice or function servicing cross-industry clients at a national level.
CPA, CISA, CISSP, CIA or CISM license/certification.
Experience in public accounting or equivalent delivering controls based services including SOC reports, auditing Information Technology General Controls (ITGC’s.)
Experience performing operational and system audits and consulting projects.
Outstanding experience in staff and audit management in an integrated client service team.
Ability to manage and develop staff in a highly interactive team environment.
Demonstrated experience in practice development, business development, and managing other managers.
Exceptional client service and communication skills with a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain outstanding client relationships.
Ability to manage multiple engagements and competing priorities in a rapidly growing, fast- paced, interactive, results-based team environment.
Outstanding leadership, business development, recruiting, training, coaching, and mentoring skills, coupled with excellent written, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
Computer expertise including knowledge of audit-preparation software and an understanding of the impact of technology.
Ability to work additional hours and/or travel as needed.

Alvarez & Marsal is a leading independent global professional services firm, specializing in providing turnaround management, performance improvement and corporate advisory services, is seeking to expand its Private Equity Performance Improvement (PEPI) – Information Technology & Merger Integration team. A&M’s Private Equity Performance Improvement Services (PEPI) practice, with offices throughout the US, focuses on serving upper middle market and large cap private equity firms who have engaged A&M to help improve operating results at their portfolio companies. Job Title: New Business Healthcare IT Sales Executive
Job Description:
Agfa HealthCare, is a division of the Agfa-Gevaert Group which is headquartered in Mortsel, Belgium and traded on Euronext Brussels (AGFB).

At Agfa HealthCare, we support healthcare professionals across the globe to transform the delivery of care. Our focus is 100% on providing best-of-suite Imaging IT software solutions that enable secure, effective and sustainable imaging data management.

From product development to implementation, our unified Enterprise Imaging Platform is purpose-built to reduce complexity, improve productivity and deliver clinical value. We use our proven track record as an innovator, our in-depth medical knowledge and our strategic guidance to help healthcare providers achieve their clinical, operational and business strategies.

The New Business Sales Executive is responsible for selling Agfa HealthCare’s portfolio of IT to hospitals and health systems in assigned geography. Individual will be responsible for growing new business market share, funnel development, strategic planning, territory management and achieving annual sales quota and MBO targets.

This position can be based in Northern California, Washington or Oregon

Achieving annual sales plan by prioritizing prospecting, customer facing selling time and driving sales strategy execution to generate sales volume of new business
Managing the future market opportunity potential of the assigned geography/territory
Developing consultative sales relationships with all key buying influences in each prospective opportunity, including multiple levels within the customer's organization including key management and executive management, CFO, CIO, CEO, CMIO etc.
Adhering to sales process by owning funnel management in the CRM system, driving territory development and account strategy to closing deals in territory and any assigned existing customer accounts
Developing and executing an annual business/territory plan supporting attainment of quota, key performance metrics, market share growth and reviewing progress on a quarterly basis
Collaborating with AGFA colleagues and business partners on closing business and growth strategies in assigned territory and accounts
Developing and maintaining product knowledge of AGFA Healthcare’s portfolio of IT and competitive products
Maintaining complete knowledge of the market drivers in the geographic territory, as well as each prospective and assigned customer account's current and strategic objectives, purchase plans and key buying influences
Education:
Bachelor’s degree and direct sales experience selling enterprise IT solutions to hospitals, academic medical centers and large health systems


Experience:


A minimum of five years experience working in a complex selling environment, where multiple people and/or committees involved in the purchasing decision
Specific skills:


Active and Advanced C-Level relationships within assigned geography
Ability to create value proposition to support a portfolio wide customer solution
Experience selling multi-million dollar enterprise imaging and/or software solutions in the healthcare vertical market
Proficiency in Strategic Selling concepts and/or comparable sales process and tools
Competitive enterprise imaging and/or software product experience/knowledge
Self-starter and independent thinker, with the aptitude to work autonomously
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with customers at all levels
Robust interpersonal skills, with evidence of teamwork and collaboration

Willingness to live in sales territory

Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Capable of communicating complex financial information in an easy to understand format. Able to interact comfortably with the executive management team
Demonstrated ability to work well under pressure, thrive in a fast-paced environment and stay flexible through growth and change

Experience and understanding of the SaaS business model
Strong customer service orientation and a desire to help others succeed

About ECHO TS An integrated technology services company, ECHO Technology Solutions (ECHO TS) serves small and medium-sized financial services (Venture Capital, Private Equity, Investment Funds) and nonprofit organizations. We help our clients become market leaders by providing unmatched solutions that cover the entire technology spectrum – IT outsourcing, Security Services, project architecture and implementation, Salesforce implementations, and more. Role Overview A critical part of our IT services delivery team, the Client Advisors collaborates with clients from the time contracts are signed through implementations and ongoing support. This position requires a balance of functional and technical expertise and works as part of the services team working alongside the Director of IT services, fellow Client Advisors, Architects, and Engineers to effectively support ECHO's various clients. They are strategic advisors and advocates for their clients as well as strong influencers among internal teams. Client Advisors work with the clients assigned to them and are ultimately responsible for client delivery. Client Advisors easily navigate the entire IT technology spectrum from infrastructure through Business Intelligence and can consult and understand all types of projects in this spectrum. Personality-wise, Client Advisors are great communicators and critical thinkers who pride themselves on customer service and overall efficiency; they take pride in structuring environments, improving processes for the greatest success of the IT delivery team so that all individuals contribute to their highest potential. Client Advisors vacillate between competing desires to increase their management skills, technical skills, and team management skills. Ideally, Client Advisors have broad IT system exposure with a focus on leveraging technology for operational efficiency. Client Advisors have strong interpersonal skills, a confident presence, conflict management skills, and ridiculous triaging skills. Client Advisors approach conflicts as opportunities to improve our client relationship as well as the services that we are providing. Essential Duties and Responsibilities Client management and IT Delivery organization (estimate 70%) Lead client service delivery teams using an appropriate approach for the specific client needs and aligning them with the respective team members. Being able to adapt to different client types and challenges. Willing to learn new technology and having critical thinking is a must. Clean communication style that can relay information effectively to clients and the team alike. Strong organization skills and “getting things done” attitude. Ensure that the client and team are aligned on expectations of scope, budget, and timeline; facilitate status meetings, and change management as needed. Develops and presents reports to clients demonstrating our work. Plan and allocate budget and time to different tasks. Facilitate information flow accurately and in a timely manner via software platforms (ConnectWise, email, Slack) and client-facing meetings. Coach and motivate the client and ECHO team through to successful service delivery. Act as the client’s primary point of contact for all matters relating to delivery, hours, invoicing, and timeline Enforce and develop ECHO-established best practices and norms for the purpose of achieving optimal results Understand the client’s business and the technology ecosystem and partner with the client and our technical team to maintain a vision and plan to evolve the technology to better support the client’s business; maintain a list of recommended or future efforts to implement this evolution and help schedule this work to be approved and completed ECHO Internal and Consulting Responsibilities (estimate 30%) *Per person use of this time to be determined based on individual interests and capacity* Act as a knowledgeable liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders. Work with the project and delivery teams to integrate change management activities into overall service delivery. Support business development efforts through sales engineering, contributing proper information, tools, estimates, and subject matter expertise. Facilitate business process analysis and design sessions, gather requirements, and recommend solutions; Design and conduct discoveries and readiness assessments; evaluate results and present findings in a logical and easy-to-understand manner. Deliver client-facing training and presentations, contribute to the creation of client-facing materials. Serve as a power user for our project management tools to best support our work; tools include and are not limited to ConnectWise, IT Glue, Slack, SharePoint. Identify new or additional tools to evolve our practice. Mentor and encourage skill development of IT team members. Participate in the invoicing process. Review and approve invoices. Work closely with the Director of IT Services to agree and implement identified service and delivery improvements. Experience and Skills 10+ years’ experience managing clients and working as a lead on IT projects. 10+ years of project coordination and project management experience, especially for technology projects. Broad IT expertise and knowledge of delivering, testing, integrations different IT architectures Strong client services and communication skills are a must. Technocrat at heart, staying current with trends and new technologies. Strong written & verbal skills, confident demeanor. Strong Background in Technology (Conceptual / Hands-On / Certifications / Formal Training) Location: United States

Job Title: Associate Director, IT End User Support
Job Description:
Why Join Us?
Be a hero for our rare disease patients
Ultragenyx is a commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company committed to developing novel therapies for the treatment of rare and ultra-rare genetic diseases. The company has rapidly built a diverse portfolio of small molecule, monoclonal antibody, mRNA and gene therapy candidates with the potential to address debilitating genetic diseases for which the unmet medical need is high, the biology for treatment is clear, and for which there are typically no approved therapies treating the underlying disease.
Developing new treatments for rare genetic diseases is challenging work. It takes courage, talent, and dedication to look past the easy answers and uncover new solutions that can make a meaningful impact. At Ultragenyx we push each other to perform at our very best, because we never lose sight of our mission – to make a difference in our patients’ lives.
Come join our team during this exciting time of growth and opportunities! During the COVID-19 Outbreak we are committed to our hiring process. The health and safety of our employees and prospective employees take priority which means at this time our process will include WebEx video discussions, interviews & onboarding.

Position Summary
ultradedicated – Your biggest challenges yield rare possibilities
Ultragenyx is seeking a qualified individual to join the Information Technology organization and lead our End User Support team. This is a new position and an opportunity for the right person to mature the team into a state-of-the-art, world-class Support Center. The Ultragenyx End User Support team provides a broad range of end user services to the organization covering traditional desktop support and troubleshooting, hardware/software installation and configuration, phone system and video conferencing support. This leadership role involves leading a team of professionals with heavy user interaction at all levels across the company – excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills are required.
This passionate customer service leader will be a team oriented, collaborative individual who has demonstrated continuous improvement across Service Management best practices and will have working experience of ITIL methodologies (in particular, change control, incident, service request and problem management).
Responsibilities including, but not limited to:
Manage a blended resource team (employees, managed services vendors and on demand contractors)
Drive vision for IT End User Support maturity (including the development of an executive support function)
Drive process, people and technology to ensure customer satisfaction, KPIs and SLAs are managed to meet or exceed expectations.
Ensure appropriate staffing and skill levels are maintained throughout operational hours; participate in after-hours escalations and maintenance accordingly
Identify areas of focus and techniques to improve service quality and customer satisfaction
Establish strong working relationships across the business and within IT
Enhance policies and procedures (for example: runbooks, service level objectives and incident management response); ensure approach, processes, and procedures are aligned; lead knowledge management transfer across critical teams
Assist in policy, security, and compliance documentation efforts as needed
Ownership of Service Management SOP’s (standard operating procedures and policies)
Track, manage, communicate and complete assigned projects on time and within budget
Coordinate internal resources and 3rd party/vendors for efficient execution

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent certification in computer science, information technology, or related technical field
5+ years of proven personnel management experience in a support organization; 8+ years of proven information technology experience
Experience managing a blended resource model that includes employees, managed services partners and on demand resources to deliver excellent customer service
Demonstrated experience managing a sophisticated ticket management system (ServiceNow preferred)
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills with a proactive and agile approach to communication, coordination and escalation management
Experience implementing and/or maintaining a knowledge management platform
Subject matter expert in ITIL 3.0 and supporting end user computing technologies (desktop interfaces, applications, voice, mobility)
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills across a range of technologies (in particular, integration across Microsoft Office products and Apple/Mac)
Experience in Microsoft Active Directory, Group Policy, and related modules preferred.
Experience managing a distributed team in a multi campus environment preferred.
Experience automating process and procedural workflows in ServiceNow preferred.
Industry experience supporting GXP systems and non-GXP systems preferred.
This position may require travel on an as-needed basis to domestic and international company locations and training events.
People Management Skills:
Clarify Direction & Priorities: Set clear direction for your direct reports aligned with functional and corporate goals. Reprioritize work, as needed. Enable others to do their job well by communicating information and making decisions in a clear, timely manner.
Partner & Collaborate Effectively: Listen to and value others’ thoughts and ideas. Demonstrate effective partnership both within and outside your team. Achieve results with and through others.
Support Learning & Growth: Demonstrate self-awareness, humility, and curiosity in service of self-development. Provide regular coaching and feedback that will inspire growth and improvement in others.

Description Under general supervision, to conduct professional level research and analysis on the County’s Information Technology (IT) procurement portfolio, develop the sourcing strategy, schedule vendor reviews, oversee and evaluate vendor performance for assigned IT categories, and conduct vendor risk assessments and ensure regulatory compliance. NOTE: Your answers to the supplemental questions associated with this posting may be reviewed and scored in a Competitive Rating evaluation process based on pre-determined rating criteria. Your answers should contain all requested information, as no additional information will be accepted once the Competitive Rating evaluation has begun. Typical Tasks The following is a descriptive list of the range of duties performed by employees in this classification and is not intended to reflect all duties performed by every incumbent in this classification. Develops sourcing strategies for IT categories with defined products, services, and reasonably stable market landscapes; Develops sourcing strategies to align with enterprise IT strategies, architecture, and standards; Evaluates and determines the most cost-effective and efficient means of sourcing, acquiring and delivering IT products and services across the enterprise; Develops capability to deal with and manage stable, large, and influential IT vendors; Effectively manages the complexity of relationship, performance, and risk of newer and/or smaller IT vendors of emerging disruptive technologies; Explores sourcing options to discover vendors that can potentially augment technical capacity according to IT's skill gap analysis; Ensures vendor governance, including segmentation, business reviews, performance management, and risk identification, assessments, and contingency plans are in place for assigned vendors; Applies a consistent approach to managing IT vendors supporting critical business applications and processes; In multi-vendor environments, oversees or manages IT service integration across multiple internal and external providers; Interfaces with multiple budget holders, project managers, and operational managers, and develops a detailed understanding of the many and varied requirements of different stakeholders to ensure the accomplishment of organizational goals; Oversees transition and transformation planning, monitoring, reporting, and change management to meet business needs, and drives vendor account behaviors; Performs quality review of contracts and process compliance to ensure continuous inspection readiness; Ensures important documents and contractual artifacts are managed; Advises on contract interpretation; Provides project management support on vendor related project activities; Collaborates on creative solutions, such as detailed cost modelling, to improve vendor performance; Conducts analysis in support of IT demand planning, risk management, and performance management; Develops and manages tools and reports to measure supplier health; Conducts relationship health-checks to determine misalignments; May assist in developing IT category and vendor management framework, strategy, and governance; May assist with highly complex vendor assignments; Performs the tasks of an Associate IT Vendor Manager, but at the moderate level of complexity and difficulty consistent with the IT Vendor Manager classification; Provides coaching/mentoring to less experienced vendor management team members; Provides training to less experienced vendor management team members; May be assigned as a Disaster Service Worker, as required; Performs other related duties, as assigned. Employment Standards Sufficient education, training, and experience to demonstrate the possession and direct application of the following knowledge and abilities: Training and Experience Note: The required knowledge and abilities are attained through training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business Administration, Business Management, Economics, Finance, Public Administration, or a related field. Relevant analytical, administrative, lead, supervisory, or management experience that includes interpreting rules and regulations, gathering data and formulating recommendations, and report writing can substitute for education on a year-for-year basis; and Five (5) years of experience in vendor management, strategic sourcing, risk management, contract negotiation, contract administration, procurement, supply chain management, and/or project management in a technology environment. Three (3) years of this experience must have been at a level comparable to the County’s Associate IT Vendor Manager. A Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business Administration, Business Management, Economics, Finance, Public Administration, or a related field, or a Juris Doctor (J.D.) Degree, may substitute for one (1) year of the required experience. Special Requirements Ability to travel to alternate locations in the course of work. If driving, possession of a valid California Driver’s License prior to appointment and the ability to qualify for and maintain a County driver authorization. Depending on the position, other related certifications may be desirable. Knowledge of: Expertise in managing relationship with and performance of large and influential vendors; Broad understanding of information technology environment and business functions and processes; Change management techniques; Source to pay process; Principles, practices, and trends of technology vendor management and technology strategic sourcing; Technology sourcing and vendor management goal setting, strategy development, and implementation; Principles and practices of technology vendor service delivery, performance management, project management, and technology category management; Technology sourcing methods, technology contract development and negotiations, contract management, and compliance monitoring; Principles and practices of sourcing-related financial analysis, including historical spend research, sourcing savings estimates, return on investment calculations, and total cost of ownership projections; Relevant Federal, State, and local laws and regulations related to competitive bidding processes and contracting; Principles and practices of research, data collection, and data analysis; Communication techniques required for effectively gathering, evaluating, and transmitting information; Public speaking techniques, presentation delivery, and negotiation strategy; Current computer information systems, common office applications, and spreadsheets and database software. Ability to: Develop and scale sourcing strategies to allow for agility, speed, and flexibility to expedite innovation initiatives; Formulate effective sourcing strategies for complex IT categories that accomplish performance of savings goals and anticipate potential threats or opportunities, consistent with the organization’s goals and policies; Develop IT vendor management governance framework, procedures, and related tools and forms; Identify problems and formulate constructive policies and procedures in response to them; Represent County IT before County officials, committees, outside organizations, and stakeholders; Produce and deliver well-written reports and presentations containing effective recommendations to County Executive Management, the Board of Supervisors, representatives of other organizations, and other interested members of the community; Apply vendor management principles, practices, and procedures to complete complex vendor assignments (emerging vendors, legacy vendors, and multi-vendor IT service integration); Communicate, motivate, and influence effectively, both within and outside of own organizational hierarchy; Network and communicate effectively with current and potential IT vendors, building and developing effective vendor relationships and cooperative relationships with those contacted in the course of work; Communicate with IT stakeholders and external vendors to understand requirements and expectations and to promote program adherence; Prioritize, organize, and multitask in a fast-paced and challenging environment; Work independently and under pressure, meet deadlines, adapt to varying circumstances, and use sound judgement in the performance of duties; Deal with change and ambiguity effectively; Communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing, including the presentation of ideas and suggestions; Utilize standard office and specialized procurement and database software and programs; Keep abreast of relevant laws, regulations, and professional practices governing public technology contracting; Take initiative in determining areas of concern and executing appropriate responses; Persuade, justify, and project consequences of decisions and recommendations.

About the role

Chime seeks an experienced and strongly motivated leader to manage our growing IT Systems Engineering team in San Francisco. This new role will be responsible for managing the team that supports Chime's portfolio of cloud and productivity applications. In addition to managing business-oriented SaaS applications, you will also lead the team responsible for corporate end-point management, Identity, Networking, and User Lifecycle processes. You will play a key role in IT organization and have the opportunity to help shape the future of Chime and, of course, our Member-experience. This is a hands-on management role and will report to the Director of IT.

We are looking for someone with a technical background, customer-focused, and with demonstrated business acumen who can get things done, provide technical direction, and develop a team of systems engineers. You will partner with business function owners to create and execute a technical plan that helps achieve our business goals, reduce security risks, and drive end-user satisfaction while maintaining reliable and effective operations and systems companywide.

In this role, you can expect to
Define, manage, and update Chime's IT Systems strategy and roadmap
Own and manage the security posture of Chime's IT Systems portfolio
Meet or exceed all security SLAs for patching and remediations
Engineer system integration/automation of manual tasks and processes to improve scalability
Oversee the scalability and refresh of systems infrastructure and core services
Implement compliance controls providing oversight and auditability
Manage vendors against SLAs and handle incidents and response to potential disruptions.
Architect and implement a vision that scales to support hyper-growth
To thrive in this role, you have
5+ years of experience building and managing IT infrastructure, systems, and services in high-growth companies
BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems and or equivalent formal training or experience
Proven ability to manage and develop a technical team of Engineers
A hands-on leadership style, with a start-up mentality
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing with technical and non-technical people. Skilled in writing concise, understandable, technical documentation
Strong negotiation and problem-solving skills. A track record of delivery.
The ability to provide technical leadership and mentoring of staff
Familiarity with compliance and audit standards (e.g., SOC2, ISO27001, etc
Experience working in mixed environments with G Suite, Okta, and other SaaS is a plus!
A little about us

We created Chime because we believe everyone deserves financial peace of mind. By eliminating unnecessary fees and helping people grow their savings automatically, we've empowered millions of Americans to take control of their finances.

Chime is the largest and fastest-growing U.S. player in the challenger-banking space. Through our banking partners, we offer access to bank accounts with fee-free overdraft, provide members the chance to receive early access to their paychecks, help them improve their credit, and more!

We've built one of the most experienced leadership teams in Fintech and were recently valued at over $14.5B. IGM Biosciences (Nasdaq: IGMS) is a clinical-stage biotechnology company focused on creating and developing engineered IgM antibodies. IgM antibodies have inherent properties that we believe may enable them to improve upon the efficacy and safety of IgG antibodies in multiple therapeutic applications.

We have created a proprietary IgM antibody technology platform that we believe is particularly well suited for developing T cell engagers, receptor cross-linking agonists, and targeted cytokines. Our lead product candidate, IGM-2323, is a bispecific T cell engaging IgM antibody targeting CD20 and CD3, and we have initiated a Phase 1 clinical trial for the treatment of relapsed/refractory B cell Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) patients in 2019. Our second product candidate is IGM-8444, an IgM antibody targeting Death Receptor 5 (DR5) for the treatment of patients with solid and hematologic malignancies, for which we have recently initiated a Phase 1 clinical trial. Also in our product pipeline is IGM-7354, a bispecific IgM antibody delivering interleukin-15 (IL-15) cytokines to PD-L1 expressing cells for the treatment of patients with solid and hematologic malignancies.

Reporting to the CFO, the Sr. Director, Information Technology (IT) is a newly created position and will lead all IT activities at IGM. To be successful in this role you should enjoy, and be comfortable, in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial, and hands-on environment.

Planning and execution of projects that support the company’s strategic goals and projected growth.
Execution of a cybersecurity strategy in partnership with the CFO and Audit Committee as well as management of a robust SOX environment supported by policies, procedures and training.
Design of the IT organization inclusive of a hiring plan and perspectives on which functions to build in-house versus outsource.
Qualifications:
A minimum BS/BA degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or relevant field.
10+ years of progressive IT experience, including at least 3-5 years in a leadership role.
Broad IT Infrastructure management experience, with particular emphasis in Biotech desired.
Understanding of SOX and GxP controls, experience in an FDA-regulated environment is required.
Experience with the implementation, integration, management, and securing of hybrid environments where both Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions and cloud-based infrastructure are incorporated is required.
Strong interpersonal, communication, and business partnering skills.
Strategic mindset with a strong analytical foundation.
We offer a fast-paced, collaborative, team-based and family-like work environment. It is one of our biggest goals to maintain our company culture.

One of our top priorities is to maintain the health and wellbeing of our employees and their families. To achieve this goal, we are offering robust and comprehensive benefits with a variety of options:

Job description:

They establish and improve business analysis processes and mentor business analysts. They are responsible for understanding business processes, eliciting and documenting requirements, and coordinating communication among various business groups and IT technical teams for critical and complex projects. Individuals in this position have an understanding of business processes, experience working with multiple technologies, and have demonstrated the ability to work with business users at all levels in the business.

Build and maintain strong relationships with the NV division and act as a liaison between the NV IT Business partner, IT teams and the NV Division.
Responsible for delivering on NV division's Analytics needs across all business functions.

Active participation to define the business case for analytics and BI projects pipeline working closely with business and IT leadership team. Work closely with IT team to develop Proof of Value analytics products and demo the quick value to business.
Build a strong understanding of the commercial processes (including sales, marketing, and other associated functions) within the NV division and apply this understanding to IT strategies and implementations.
Improve the business analysis function through best practices, process management, mentoring, and education.
Manage relationships with high level business stakeholders.
Partner with business and technical teams to drive consensus on the best solution to business problems and the delivery of new solutions and enhancements.
Define tangible use cases that align desired technology output to commercial objectives
Ensure clear communication between business stakeholders and IT technical teams.

Bachelor's degree required
Bachelor's in Business Administration or Computer Information Systems preferred
Qualification in Business Analysis or equivalent preferred
Qualifications & experience:
Minimum 10 years of professional experience is required
Knowledge of medical device and/or pharmaceutical industry and basic knowledge of adjacent areas in terms of processes, organization, products and IT requirements is preferred
Experience working with high level business stakeholders is required.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a matrix organization structure with significant emphasis on collaboration and persuasion, rather than relying entirely on command and control is required
Ability to uncover analytics opportunities that will help the business make effective decisions is required
Experience showcasing meaningful insights to the business stakeholders in an easy to understand story like format and using quick product demo from proof of concept/value is required
Experience working with business intelligence technologies required, (such as Power BI, Microsoft Azure, SQL, Tableau, Cognos, Oracle db, SQL db, ETL and building data warehouse).
Ability to train and guide the business on building visualization dashboards is required (ex Power BI, Tableau)
Experience working with predictive, prescriptive, AI and ML technologies is preferred
Prior experience with an ERP technology such as Oracle or SAP is required
Experience with process mapping is required
Experience documenting complex processes and presenting them in a clear and understandable format is required.
Experience understanding, evaluating, and recommending changes to business processes are required.
Experience working in an agency-regulated environment is preferred.
Knowledge of Agile Development methodologies is preferred.

Demonstrated ability to partner with business representatives at all levels to identify needs, define and document requirements, and drive solutions
Demonstrated ability to guide the business towards optimal solutions
Experience in identifying opportunities for process optimization, process redesign, or development of new process/policies
Demonstrated ability to maintain clear communication channels with IS and business stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Demonstrated ability to convert complex business functions into technical specifications

Job Title: IT Program Manager - BPO Strategy & Support
Job Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Twitter is a growing organization that faces new challenges as it evolves. The IT Program Manager - BPO Strategy & Support function is a new, but critical responsibility within our IT Asset Management (ITAM) team. The Twitter ITAM team is responsible for managing the full lifecycle of IT Assets, including deployment, in-service tracking, and EOL procedures. With additional strategic responsibilities, The ITAM team will manage outsourced and managed service partnerships, organize the holistic IT support strategy, determine appropriate metrics for success measurement, and publish and communicate IT priorities to the broader organization. Our mission is to keep our business and business partners running effectively while maintaining a healthy, compliant IT environment.

Job Description

What You’ll Do

This is a unique opportunity to help grow and drive our broader IT operations. You will coordinate across IT teams, own business relationships and engage with both vendors and partners to deliver solutions. You will rely on a growth mindset to help manage the customer solutions in a manner that is consistent, well documented and communicated, and measured with an aim towards continuous improvement. You will partner with IT engineering teams, product managers, and IT leadership while staying focused on customer needs.

Qualifications

Who You Are

To continually strengthen our growing team, we are looking for an experienced execution-focused individual, who not only can build a plan, but see it through to the end.. You understand Support organizations, both internally and externally facing. You are a great team member who knows how to manage across functional areas to support critical partnerships. You are skilled in communication via process documentation and enjoy iterating these processes as new solutions become available. You are driven and able to execute, while possessing a strategic vision.

If this sounds like you, you probably have experience with these responsibilities:
Build, publish, and communicate policies and IT support procedures governing Twitter’s engagement model for managed and outsourced services
Lead projects and initiatives across the IT organization, partnering with other support organizations and customers, meant to drive consistency and scalability
Conduct internal IT retros for projects / enhancements - identify the issues that IT faces internally and determine strategy to mitigate them
Function as a frontline technical resource for “best practices” and informal customer questions in support of Twitter’s business process outsourcing
Partner with the IT End User Services and IT Infrastructure teams to build and execute on a global support model for managed services at Twitter.
Maintain current functional and technical knowledge of Twitter IT supported services, applications, and hardware
Oversee measurable internal metrics - for reporting and management decision making
Coordinate internal & external IT communications
Collect, analyze, and act on customer feedback
Partner with IT management to track program budgets and resource allocation
Assist in managing IT vendor relationships
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, a related field, or relevant industry experience
4+ years business or support operations experience in an Enterprise environment
2+ years experience as an IT project/program manager, or similar
Knowledge and experience with data analytics & visualization, Atlassian Tools, and project management applications
West Coast Time zone preferred
Knowledge of IT Infrastructure technologies and concepts
Excellent attention to detail and process discipline
Self-motivated and ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent verbal & written communication skills
Additional Information

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.

San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

Program Leadership
